name: Frosteez
description: What's surprising about this cereal is that, in addition to its resistance to Frigost's extreme climate, it gives any milk it comes into contact with a delicate chocolatey flavour.

name: Frozen Icefish
description: Unlike traditional Icefish, Frozen Icefish is already frozen (the clue is in the name I guess), which means it can be kept for longer.

name: Putchup Brain
description: There's not much to this brain, but it brings back vivid memories of the sight of your Iop uncle's brain from that day you all went to the Kanniballs' trepanning festival on Moon Island. Good times.

name: Leatherball Leather
description: If the Leatherball were a little smaller, it would fit into a mouth. You're so used to the World of Twelve that this image doesn’t even shock you.

name: Klime's Moustache
description: On his days off, Klime wears a tight-fitting t-shirt that reads "5% leather, 95% moustache". How depleted must he be feeling right now?

name: Potbellion Molar
description: An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth - or in your case, a tooth for an uncomfortably large chunk of your right buttock.

name: Skateman Brain
description: Skateman Brain is inedible - who would have thought? Well, not the Skateman any more, that's for sure.

name: Nessil Molar
description: The last dentist who attempted to treat this tooth was found at the bottom of a lake, wearing a skirt and reeking of whisky.

name: Krackal Canine
description: You're almost certain that this tooth is false, because it reminds you of the 'diamond' ring you gave to your sweetheart in the Astrub Inn. There was definitely a whiff of lavender about that marriage.

name: Krackal Mane
description: The Krackal's mane is so glossy, because it's worth it.

name: Thermite Carapace
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kan-O-Mat Canine
description: If you'd have known just how eager Kan-O-Mats are to bite dentists, you might not have killed so many of them.

name: Serpulax Volva
description: This membrane hides the Serpulax's most intimate mechanisms, but you were deeply disappointed when you tugged it away. Instead of attempting to seduce you, this mechanical handyman should have stuck to its day job.

name: Nocturnowl Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Nocturnowl Spike
description: This spike acts as a lightning conductor when the Nocturnowl is struck by a bolt from the blue.

name: Klime's Private Suite Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Zipper
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Frozen Spores
description: If you look more closely at the fungal spores trapped in this chunk of ice, you can see some tiny pubic lice larvae in there as well. The fact that they were recovered from Missiz Freezz's private rooms is surely just an unfortunate coincidence.

name: Count Harebourg Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Steamcrab Claw
description: If a Steamcrab offers to shake your hand… IT'S A TRAP!!

name: Bartyclank Leather
description: This leather came directly from Bartyclank's tunic. The artisan who tanned and sold it had a convincing slogan: "No animals were harmed in the making of this tunic, just the buyer."

name: Psychlo Sock
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Merkator's Heart
description: This rusty heart, which once beat so strongly, has long since surrendered.

name: Staruman Eyebrow
description: Starumen are modest, the kind of guys who have tons of talents but never really talk about them. The one who used to own this eyebrow, for instance, was a master at fanning his friends by shaking his facial hair about.

name: Pazpartu Key Fragment
description: Despite repeated cries of "THE KEY! THE KEY!!!" and "QUICK! QUICK!!!" from your teammates, you only managed to grab a fragment of the Pazpartu's key. Hopefully you'll do better in the crystal dome.

name: King Nidas's Palace Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Gein's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 3/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Key to the Belly of the Whale
description: This key will let you go inside the enormous marine mammal known as Kideebom. However, no guides are available – you'll have to find your way around by yourself.

name: Protoz'orror Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Ickyrus Talon
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Wastrel Feather
description: Wastrels sometimes use these surprisingly sharp feathers as projectiles, but their most common use is as torture instruments. Bare feet of the world, beware.

name: Fugitive Loop
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 7/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 5/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: King Kongoku’s Hide
description: You took out its heart, but the powerful monster was still dangerous even in death and could have made your skull explode in a sudden shock.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 1/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 4/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 5/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 2/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 3/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Queen's Belt
description: A belt made out of fur, fit for a queen.

name: King Playa's Seal
description: When in ownership of this seal, it is possible to sign any document in the guise of King Playa. If he had the slightest bit of authority, you could go wild!

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 4/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 6/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Great Game Catzino Token
description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

name: Brass Propeller
description: This propeller won't allow you to fly away, but will however let you go down to explore the ocean depths. Don't look disappointed; you'll find another chance to take off.

name: Jitter Filter
description: As its names shows, this filter is supposed to catch all of your fears, from the most intimate to the most elementary. You have trouble conceiving that such a thing can be possible, but then again, you have trouble conceiving many things.

name: Mol Usk Slobber
description:
Mol Usk Slobber has curative properties, which help certain wounds heal. The only side effect is that it changes the colour of the skin where it's applied.
Some people use it as Al Howin makeup.

name: Meno's Hair
description: Where exactly did you pluck this hair from?

name: Angular Stone
description: An important piece for the Servants of the Unspeakable, this stone seems linked to another dimension.

name: Salikronia
description: This plant is also known as the sea gherkin, but alchemists prefer to use the term Salikronia. That obviously sounds more classy and mysterious to uncultured people.

name: Limpet
description: Sufokian Limpet has abandoned the rocky foreshores to seek refuge in the depths of the bay. To live happily, it lives in hiding… but not well-hidden enough to escape from you.

name: Shimmering Silk
description: This very special cloth would is used to craft the legendary Dofusteuse.

name: Castuc Cocktail
description: This cocktail made from Nonexistent Water and Castuc pulp is essential for crafting a quality Dorado Hat: it allows the tailor to quench their thirst while working.

name: Mumystic Garnet
description: These garnets keep levitating with the magic permeating them; it remains to be seen what purpose they serve.

name: Sneerena Golden Eyelid
description: This is an accessory which will soon be all the rage at Klime's masquerades.

name: Scratchotep Ear
description: The shape and texture of this ear make it a clean and therefore reusable cotton bud. You won't need to buy them in packets of one hundred any more.

name: Chrysonefantine Scarab
description: Hit a Iop's skull, and it'll make this item start to resonate. The sound produced varies depending on the size of the skull and its emptiness.

name: Kerighoul Wing
description: You may be wondering how these wings manage to cope with the weight of a Kerighoul. It's another question to add to your collection of futile questions to which you'll never find an answer. How will you sleep at night?

name: Ghouligan Eye
description: Just like Chafers, ghouls can switch their eyes without injury. Therefore, they sometimes use them to barter for certain favours. More and more ghouls only have one eye left, which is of real delight to the eye patch sellers of Forfut.

name: Red Ghoulobule
description: A dash of idiocy, a drop of frivolity, a few grains of nonchalance: it's actually rather difficult to tell ghoul blood apart from Iop blood.

name: Encapsulated Soul-Blaze
description: Ghost hunters go crazy for this item, which they like to keep on their mantelpiece.

name: Spirigneous Remains
description: This Spirigneous did not meet a happy end.

name: Zombrute Flesh
description: This looks like ligaments connecting pieces of putrid mud together, and it's rubbery. With any luck, it'll make for a chewing gum that doesn't lose its taste after ten minutes.

name: Key to Solar's Tower
description: Thieves misuse this key as a skeleton key, since it tends to melt all locks into which it is inserted.

name: Anerice the Shushess Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Dazahk Freezammer Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Beardrammer Beard Hair
description: You'd almost think that if Stubbyobs are so obsessed with their beards, it's because they'd look like children without them.

name: Warmonbeer Tooth
description: Given their unfortunate habit of biting their opponents, Stubbyobs need to have irreproachable dental hygiene: altering the taste of their beer by leaving residue from previous victims in their mouths is out of the question.

name: Andespite
description: It is said that this volcanic rock comes from a faraway island in the Archipelago of Scales. Known to the Paztek as Shibaparta, and considered sacred, it is a valuable resource that can be used as a currency.

name: Legend of Death-Defying
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Death-Defying.

name: Legend of a Thousand Leagues
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of the thousand league boots.

name: Legend of Rykke Errel
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Rykke Errel.

name: Podploder Hat
description: The Podploders' chef hats have always been the subject of the wildest rumours. Do they wear them to hide extra cocoa beans? Or unlikely cranial protuberances? Or worse yet, haircuts in very bad taste? Chokao alone knows.

name: Pukachi Quintessence
description: Used on a legendary pet, it will grant it a random offensive power.

name: Time Loop
description: In theory, a loop only comes full circle when the end of the loop meets the start of the loop. But time is a reluctant matchmaker who refuses to make introductions.

name: Timeless Loop
description: This is what happens when time stands still while still flowing freely.

name: Cannicodyl Canine
description: You can use this sharp tooth to cut the meat you order to go with your drink next time you visit an inn.

name: Misery's Feather
description: When you're always wanting – and going after – more, you have to be careful someone doesn't pluck your feathers…

name: Starven Tongue
description: Starvens know how to use their tongues, to say the least.

name: Deboning Ribs
description: When correctly prepared, Deboning ribs could be mistaken for some good old Lousy Pig loins. Add a pinch of salt and pepper, and they're great! The meat's a little lean and it's technically cannibalism, but the flavour can't be beat.

name: Rotten Dolid Skin
description: Whether you're looking for fun, or maybe just a bit mad, riding a Dolid is always a perilous exercise. As with any sporting activity, remember: practice makes perfect, and always stretch first to avoid injury. An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth… This shredded skin is a symbol of vengeance.

name: Rhythmic Wand
description: This wand is useful at getting a galley working in rhythm, but can really hurt if it hits you in the eye.

name: Pandora Skin
description: If you're a shoemaker, Pandora Skin has more than one surprise in store for you.

name: Pandora Fabric
description: This fabric is almost as rare as a pleasant surprise from a Pandora's box.

name: Giant Kralove Sucker
description: Given the size of this sucker, there's no doubt about its grip. And when you remove it, the slurping noise is deafening.

name: Icefish
description: Spines as sharp as Bworker's blades, scales as thick as Soft Oak Bark, and eyes as black as Crobak Feathers. This fish may be formidable, but served up on a plate it is quite simply delicious.

name: Obsidian
description: Hard enough to scratch glass and dark enough to sap your morale, this rock has lost all of the heat of the lava from which it came. It would be perfect as a tombstone, as long as it's not your own.

name: Frosteez Seed
description: This seed, cold to the touch, releases a powerful chocolate aroma.

name: Frosteez Oil
description: This oil is good for preserving food and ideal for massages, lending a slight scent of chocolate to all your meals.

name: Harrogant Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Klime's Scalp
description: Placed carefully over your nascent bald spot, this little treasure will take three weeks off you, easy!

name: Karkanik Malleus
description: Karkaniks boast that they can fire their arrows faster than their opponents' shadows can move - but not this one, it would seem.

name: Missiz Freezz's Armpit Hair
description: And to think, she didn't even say thank you for the free hair removal you gave her!

name: Snowdew Sepal
description: Snowdews love the taste of fresh meat, so you've got nothing to be worried about.

name: Tinkerbear Maxilla
description: Tinkerbears will happily use a fallen comrade's maxilla as a vice when something needs repairing. Not everything can be fixed that way, especially not that tattoo you've got on your left bumcheek. Yes, the one you had done as a declaration of love for your sweetheart who left you broken-hearted a couple of days later.

name: Tinkerbear Tail
description: By pulling regularly on its tail, a Tinkerbear can increase its output dramatically for several days. I know what you're thinking, but trust me, it won't work.

name: Mecanofoux Astragalus
description: This bone was specially designed to adapt to the changing size of Mecanofoux ankles. The poor creatures suffer from a terrible inferiority complex, and are very sensitive about the size of their bones. You can readily sympathise with that sentiment, so I'm sure you'll put this to good use.

name: New Bolt
description: Like your brain, this bolt has never been used, but unlike your brain, it will serve some purpose during its short existence.

name: Glass Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Foggernaut Battery
description: The only way to tell if this battery is charged is to touch the contacts with your tongue. If you lose your tongue, it was charged.

name: Barbakle Oil
description: The colour of this oil seems to suggest that the Barbakle didn't have its annual oil change. The Foggernauts usually do it at the same time as their annual bath.

name: Jewel from King Nidas's Crown
description: This gem will have heads turning wherever you go. What are you going to do with it? Give it away? Bury it? Sell it? Eat it? Maybe you should donate it to a charity such as "Enutrofs Without Frontiers", which fights tirelessly to return coveted items to Enutrofs the world over.

name: Enutough Beard Hair
description: Certain naughty painters steal Enutoughs' beard hairs to make their paintbrushes with. All the better for selling overpriced, poor quality knock-offs with, my dear!

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 1/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 2/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 4/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 7/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Terristocrat Bomb Fuse
description: If you leave it sticking out of the ground, this fuse could scare some people by making them think there's a buried bomb. Of course, it goes without saying that a real bomb would probably be more effective.

name: Tortryck Epaulette
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Key to the Throne Room of the Dark Court
description: The path to the throne is sometimes long and fraught with danger. Other times, you just need to know which door to open. Of course, the two aren't necessarily mutually exclusive…

name: Bashillus Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Viring Shell
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Pathogerm Skin
description: Pathogerm Skin is highly sought after for its elastic properties, but its colour makes it unusable for most other things.

name: Vortex Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Krossflire Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scampihorse's Rechargeable Battery
description: No need to pedal to recharge this battery: simply soak it in water for a few minutes, then hop on the spot 36 times while shouting "GAHOO-WAHOO" at the top of your lungs. And there you have it, a brand new battery! Isn't technology marvellous?

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 6/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 3/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 1/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Basalt
description: Laid down end to end, this basalt could be used to build a giant path from Brakmar to Vulkania to see who has the biggest. Stones, that is.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 3/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 1/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Soldier's Pike
description: Used like a spear, this pike always finds its target's heart.

name: Knight's Feather
description: This instrument of torture has already made the greatest feet in the World of Twelve waver.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 1/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fear-Catcher
description: This strange object allows explorers to go down to Rygurgal Pit without being overcome by an unspeakable terror.

name: Yoloinist Crab Claw
description: When the Yoloinist Crab finds a partner it thinks is worthy, it tests it by grabbing its shell and squeezing with all its might. If the shell remains unbroken, the two crabs become a couple. Thank goodness normal dating doesn't work the same way.

name: Aquatic Parasite
description: In an environment dominated by blues and greens, this little parasite absorbs these two colours, causing its host to turn a decidedly more red tint. Unfortunately, this drastically reduces their lifespan, as it renders their hosts much more visible, and therefore much more vulnerable.

name: Mahaquany Wood
description: Marine carpenters avoid using this wood which looks like coral to make ships; this prohibition probably has something to do with the fact that Mahaquany grows in the abysses. Boats were made to float; it's best not to tempt fate.

name: Chamber of Tal Kasha Key
description: To your disappointment, this key doesn't let you get into the Tal Kasha's bedroom, but her burial chamber. So unless you're a Sram, you may draw your colleagues' suspicion and disgust.

name: Forfut Manor Key
description:
If you agree to give your blood, it is possible to enter Forfut Manor without a key.
But it's a one-way journey.

name: Ghoulutton Nail
description: Ghoulutton Nails are soaked in Anerice's power, and can turn you into a ghoul. Luckily for you, they never use their hands to fight.

name: Ectorch Fragment
description: This Ectorch Fragment is always on fire, as if its soul continues to be burn even after being defeated.

name: Dead Key Tooth
description: Having listened too closely to his dentist's advice, Dead Key ended up losing his teeth.

name: Hintense Eye
description: You have to be darn raving mad to remove a dead opponent's eye. What are you going to do with it now?

name: Sucgunner Aquarachnee
description: This harmless-looking little creature will cling to you and will suck your blood down to the last drop. In this sense, it's a nice metaphor for married life.

name: Koutoulou Larva Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Dazahk Freezammer's Epaulettes
description: When one's head is a bit oversized, it's easier to keep it attached with solid epaulettes such as these.

name: Tankanvil Armour
description: It occasionally happens that certain daring Stubbyobs remove their armour before a fight. It's not known whether they're trying to prove that they are the strongest, or the most hard-headed.

name: Mayhav the Bloodthirsty's Map
description: This map will take you to Mayhav the Bloodthirsty's treasure.

name: Legend of Dodge
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Dodge.

name: Legend of the Kicked Ass
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of the Order of the Kicked Ass.

name: Chocomancer Bar
description: This bar is a basic component in the Chokao Priestess set.

name: Chocoligarch Diadem
description: The Chocoligarchs are the second-highest authority in the sect, just behind the Chokao Priestess. The Chocoligarchy also runs military operations, and acts as the Priestess's security detail.

name: Chokao Priestess's Embroidery
description: It would be a shame to damage embroidery of such high quality… but if ever you're invited to a chocolate orgy and you have nothing to protect your clothes or wipe your face with, this piece of fabric taken from the Chokao Priestess will make an excellent bib.

name: Broken Chokao Chip
description: This piece of chocolate is as dark as the dark magic that animated it before; it mustn't be allowed to fall into just anyone's hands, or mouth.

name: Frozen Plasmogrine
description: The evolution of this plasmogrine was suspended when it got trapped in ice.

name: Pukachi Animal Legend
description: Pukachis had a special ability to get on the nerves of all the adults that heard its cry. They were exterminated to bring a bit of peace and quiet to the World of Twelve.

name: Bakusharna Animal Legend
description: To understand the difference between a good and a bad dream, you need to know the difference between a good and a bad Chassullier. Only the Bakusharna could boast such an exploit.

name: Inert Egg
description: No one knows if this egg will ever hatch, or what might come out of it if it did.

name: Alassslash Loincloth
description: According to the legend, Alassslashes don't wear anything under their loincloths.

name: Shackles of Tyranny Key
description: You can use this key to confront Servitude, one of the Horsemen of the Eliocalypse. That way, you'll be freed from the burden of life.

name: Junker Shoulder Pad
description: Junkers are particularly good at turning scrap metal and other rubbish into weapons and pieces of armour that are used to equip Misery's armies. The very basic look of this equipment stands in sharp contrast with its surprising robustness.

name: Judgement of the Scales Key
description: It's almost impossible to talk to Misery unless she decides to talk to you. You may be able to force her hand with this key.

name: Elgrun Leg
description: Asking an Elgrun to shake hands is never a good idea. For one thing, it's a wild monster that's probably only thinking of tearing you to bits. Then there's the pouch of venom hidden in each of its appendages to ensure your slow and agonising death. Fun times all around!

name: Worn Oar Wood
description: Wood so damaged that it must have been used by Galley slaves for years.

name: Ballasted Kanonball
description: This ball is extremely heavy and anyone dragging it must be extra vigilant if they don't want to lose a toe.

name: Meridiawful
description: This idol contains the magic of several Meridia and a fragment of the magic of Sadida himself. However, all this power has a habit of escaping and strengthening your enemies.

name: Eliocalypse Storm Key
description: This key – imbued with advanced technomagic properties – will give you access to the Eliocalypse time storm. If you don't get lost in the twists and turns of time, the Horsemen will have to watch out!

name: The Legend of Corruption
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Corruption's story.

name: Snowdrop
description: Hardened to Frigost's harsh climate, this flower is much more resistant than its delicate appearance would suggest. That said, to preserve the alchemic properties of such a rare plant, it must be handled carefully when harvested.

name: Aspen Wood
description: This tree appears to tremble when you touch it. After all the axe blows you've dealt it, it's not surprising it's scared of you.

name: Puffed Frosteez
description: Lighter and sweeter than conventional Frosteez, this cereal will make you roar with pleasure if you eat it with mimilk.

name: Snow Star
description: This rare flower is named in remembrance of a boy named Savo who swore his love to a shepherdess, using the stars as his witnesses. He gave her a bouquet of these flowers before leaving for Frigost Village where he became a chimney sweep and perished in a fire.

name: Ardonite
description: This rare alloy gives off an energy powerful enough to fuel even the most demanding magical items, such as asymmetric bottle-openers or barycentre-less percolators, to cite just a couple of the better known examples.

name: Harrogant Pants
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Asteraw Leather
description: This leather smells like straw, and the Asteraw's straw smells like leather. the old Tofu and egg paradox again!

name: Revish Stapes
description: The stapes is the smallest bone in the Revish's body. This particular example was shattered into tiny pieces during a recent Jon Lemon concert.

name: Dodox Beak
description: It's not unusual for a Dodox to become particularly attached to passing adventurers, especially by its beak.

name: Thermite Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Snowdew Bract
description: Do carnivorous plants taste of meat?

name: Nileza's Embroidery
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Pingwinch Beak
description: I know you were keen for that Pingwinch to stop sticking its beak in, but was cutting it off really necessary?

name: Pingwinch Sternum
description: The ribs that were attached to this sternum were delicious, but they would have tasted even better if you'd defeated its owner yourself. Watching your fights on Frigost, it's difficult to know whether you're the hunter or the hunted.

name: Serpulax Peduncle
description: You can eat this peduncle shredded, boiled, smoked or even stewed, but the results will be the same - you'll be leaving the castle on a stretcher. Mind you, that's no different to any other adventurer who's attempted to defeat Count Harebourg.

name: Treadfast Claw
description: This razor-sharp claw cuts flesh with disconcerting ease, which is why Treadfasts don't shake hands with the people they meet. Well, that and the fact that they can't stand on one leg.

name: Cycloid Feather
description: Cycloid feathers make excellent feather dusters, and the owner of this particular example will be only too pleased to attack you, once it's finished the housework.

name: Sinistrofu Tail
description: All the birds in the courtyard laugh at this tiny tail, your mother-in-law included.

name: Count Harebourg's Dungeon Key
description: You won't be able to wind up any clocks with this key, but it'll certainly let you wind up the Count.

name: Steamcrab Carapace
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Barbakle Barb
description: Certain knavish Foggernauts have used these barbs to pop the balloons of kids who wouldn't behave, or the hearts of those who dared cross them.

name: Harpo Blood
description: The blood test revealed a large quantity of iron and no small amount of rust. A clean bill of health, then.

name: Bartyclank Embroidery
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Merkator's Beard
description: This beard has become discoloured after repeatedly being exposed to, and abused by, salt water and hundreds of fearsome storms only a hardened sailor could face. Or maybe Merkator dyed it to match his armour. Only his barber knows for sure.

name: Vigilante Insignia
description: Brandished with certainty and conviction against a supervillain, this insignia will force the villain to tell you every detail of his evil plan before he tries to kill you. Note: tries. If he succeeds, you didn't deserve the insignia.

name: Kamasterisk Horn
description: Only an Enutrof would think up the idea of fighting with gold-plated horns. But you have to hand it to him: the result is almost terrifying as the Bearendizer during a honey shortage.

name: Hairsh Golden Ball
description: These balls come in all different colours and glow in the dark. The Hairshes use them to feign magical attacks, which, paired with an icy glare, is enough to send some adventurers running. When not fighting sissies, this bluff technique just makes the Hairshes look even more ridiculous.

name: King Nidas Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 8/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dark Court Fabric
description: Srambad's nobility has some luxurious tastes and this fabric reflects them perfectly: soft and silky, this fabric is obviously not made from just any old material. It just goes to show, even the worst criminals can have delicate skin.

name: The Queen of Thieves' Embroidery
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Double's Scrunchie
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Verminoculate Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Whale Salt
description: Krobes absorb the salt dissolved in the seawater – and that's the only good thing that happens when they show up.

name: Vortex's Eye Key
description: There are many places where you have so much fun that time simply flies by. Unfortunately, the Eye of Vortex is not one of them.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 8/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scampihorse's Map
description: This map will allow you to find Scampihorse's legendary treasure.

name: Rescue Board
description: This board has saved innumerable lives, especially at sea.

name: Aspen Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Slab
description: This slab was torn from the ground in Bonta during the student protests of Maysial in 598. Six centuries later, and they're still paying for it..

name: Voldelor’s Foot
description: According to Enurado tradition, thieves have their feet cut off, are locked up with the gold they tried to steal and are forced to count it over and over until their eventual demise.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 7/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 4/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Voldelor's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Catseye Challenge Key
description: Do you like playing dice? You'll love the Catseye Challenge. Don't worry: if you fail, you'll go straight to the cemetery without suffering the tortures of the Ecaflip toilet. Not everyone's been so lucky…

name: Atcham's Hair
description: You could have cut out his tongue, but in an excess of kindness, you pulled out nothing more than the hair that was sticking out of it.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 8/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Ambergris
description: This rare and odiferous material is worth its weight in Pearls of the Depths. Common people claim that it's "whale vomit", but they have narrow-minded view of the world; you don't share it in any way… do you?

name: Propulsion Accelerator
description: To cross the rough seas that swirl at the edge of the Tritun Rift, there's nothing quite like a Propulsion Accelerator.

name: Crabtun Lantern
description: It was thought that this lantern helped the Crabtun attract its prey in order to eat them more easily. But it actually lets it attract its prey in order to more easily headbutt them. It's a subtle difference.

name: Tryde Trident
description: Their tridents let Trydes turn invisible: it seems that it acts on the surrounding water in such a way as to make it divert all visible light.

name: Dantinea's Dentures
description: Without saying a word, these dentures help you send a very clear message: I'm in no mood to talk. They might mistakenly say you're very hungry, although the two messages are not mutually exclusive.

name: Flauticultist's Flute
description: This flute can emit melodious and recognisable sounds underwater. Flauticultists are one of the rare species able to play audible music underwater. But that doesn't stop them from using their instrument for other means, usually morbid ones.

name: Litlamprey Tooth
description: Litlampreys are always hungry and can eat anything. However, their teeth are impeccable, maintained by Mol Usk Slobber.

name: Captain Meno's Ship Key
description: The legendary Mobilus is finally opening its doors to you, but don't expect to receive a very warm welcome.

name: Bandijd Tooth
description: Contrary to what one might believe, this mummified tooth is in much better condition than your decaying toothypegs.

name: Ghoultimate Hair
description: Their hair is the reason that Ghoultimates are also called fabulous ghouls.

name: Hothing Ashes
description: These ashes are too hot to handle.

name: Ilyzaelle Feather
description: These feathers make Ilyzaelle's armour more aerodynamic.

name: Reallinotseen Vertebra
description: The bones of the Reallinotseen are as resistant as its shield. They can be used to replace bolts or rings lost on a wedding day.

name: Relentliss Tongue
description: Some like them slobbery, others like them gravelly. The Relentliss's tongue is neither one or the other, but sets everything it touches ablaze.

name: Bethel Akarna's Tail
description: A tail is to an Osamodas what a sword is to a Iop: the bigger it is, the more trusty it is. Bethel Akarna's is especially impressive.

name: Submerged Ones' Shell
description: Technically speaking, this shell doesn't belong to a Submerged One, but to one of the many creatures living off it.

name: Solar Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: King Dazahk's Brewery Key
description: King Dazahk's Brewery is probably Pandawas' favourite place, because they can give themselves over to their two favourite pastimes: drinking and fighting – at the same time!

name: Beer Tankard
description: In the Stubbyob kingdom, if there is one thing even rarer than a Stubbyob without a beard, it's very likely an empty beer tankard. Which just goes to show: the rarest things aren't always the most expensive.

name: Gobyob Sling
description: Just like the slingshot you made for yourself as a child, this sling is an excellent way to break the ice.

name: Torreflayer Skin
description: "Doctors in Bonta hate it, but you're going to love it! Discover this chocolate maker's secret to perfect skin!" This lurid advert that appeared recently in the Astrub Gazette wasn't a scam after all.

name: Kwaketch'd Animal Legend
description: Kwaketch'd was famous for showing up in the kitchen whenever it was featured on the menu of the day – and it never came empty-handed. This very peculiar characteristic was what lead to its extinction.

name: Babyhemoth Reflection
description: Even though it contains only an infinitesimal speck of a Babyhemoth's power, this item will let your pet, petsmount, or mount reveal its hidden potential.

name: Nanogrine
description: This plasmogrine has evolved into a tool to perfect living creatures. The side effects from its use are not yet known.

name: Magikrab Quintessence
description: Used on a legendary pet, it will grant it a random defensive or support power.

name: Albino Crocodyl's Eye
description: This eye is red, and not just because it was savagely ripped from its owner's head.

name: Turtelonia's Scale
description: Be careful with this scale. When the moon's rays shine on it, the reflection is so bright it could blind you.

name: Nosee Headband
description: This piece of cloth is as good as any other for covering blind eyes.

name: Caimaneedyl Doll
description: You're going to love playing with this doll. Think about your worst enemy, poke needles into this pile of rags, and savour the results.

name: Corruption Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Skentu Hood
description: "One Skentu can hide another." Actually, the Skentus – also known as "looters of the desert" – developed the technique known as "Kongalining". This technique consists of moving in single file, one after another, to hide their numbers and better surprise their opponents.

name: Corrupted Sprouts
description: A bouquet of these sprouts may attract good friends or bad company. It all comes down to how… open you are.

name: Armiscreant Hood
description: When you spend your life on a boat, you need to protect yourself from the weather.

name: Bloody Fabric
description: This fabric comes from a cape that has been dragged through too much blood and dust.

name: Coagulated Blood
description: The blood comes from an old wound.

name: Linothorax
description: This armour seems perfect for protecting the wearer's joints when they have to make movements that require flexibility.

name: Dumple Leather
description: You should have gone easy on the poor soul that gave up this leather. Dumples aren't known for their intelligence. In fact, they have very little going for them at all.

name: Dumple Fabric
description: This fabric proves that even the stupidest creatures in the World of Twelve can be stylish. Chin up!

name: Putchup Leather
description: This leather was chosen for its wonderful resistance, and not because it was the only scrap left on the factory floor.

name: Asteraw Heart
description: As you move your hand and its murderous contents into a shaft of daylight, you realise with a jolt that this creature had a heart. Perhaps it was not so different from you. Perhaps it had hopes, ambitions, regrets. Stricken with sudden repulsion, you sink to your knees and wail.

name: Stalak Incisor
description: Stalaks are eager, messy eaters, and in a confused blur of teeth and flesh, they often bite their own tongues. You did the owner of this ridiculously sharp incisor a favour by pulling it out. They would say thank you, but you killed them.

name: Skateman Incus
description: The incus, or anvil, is the anvil-shaped ossicle in the Skateman's middle ear. Your mum told me an anvil fell on your cot when you were a baby. I'm guessing it wasn't this one.

name: Missiz Freezz's Underpants
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dodox Feather
description: "But why would a bird that can't fly need feathers?" Those were the last words of an adventurer who tore out his own heart because he hated everyone.

name: Bubotron Beak
description: One decent hammer blow is all it takes to open this beak. Two blows and you'll break it, three and you're likely to lose a finger, statistically speaking.

name: Treadfast Beak
description: Treadfasts won't hesitate to peck the backsides of anyone who attempts to enter Count Harebourg's castle uninvited, so if you've got flawless buttocks it can only mean one thing - you're either a lamentable adventurer, or you're one of the Count's followers. So which one are you?

name: Count Harebourg's Scapula
description: This shard of scapula burst through the Count's bandages like ideas pop into your head - painfully.

name: Missiz Freezz's Frostforge Key
description: This key won't unlock Missiz Freezz's chastity belt, but it will unlock the door to her dungeon.

name: Sylargh's Carrier Key
description: You had to wrench this key from that Handyman's hands, the cheeky little monkey.

name: Crystalline Root
description: This root, full to the brim with alchemical nutrients, is difficult to harvest as it crystallises in the ground.

name: Grasmera's Bony Joint
description: One of the first rituals Zeurg established at the Osamodas Temple was that of slowly sitting down on this joint until it disappeared completely. The screams of the disciples have long been a source of terrible legends.

name: Harpo Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Psychlo Beard
description: Solid enough to scrape the rust off just about any metallic object, the hairs of this beard can be used to scrape the crud out of the saucepans when you let the dishes build up for a month, like we both know you always do.

name: Old Hammer Head
description: This ancient relic was made by an equally ancient Foggernaut. Until you figure out what it's actually for, you could always use it to pound in some nails, or to smash your enemies' feet.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 5/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Gein's Map 6/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Gein's Bottle
description: There's enough liquid here to drown your sorrows, but not enough alcohol to get you drunk.

name: Protoz'orror Nucleus
description: The Protoz'orror can completely regenerate itself from even a small bit, which makes it nearly immortal. Its nucleus is therefore just another disposable part of its anatomy, which it can rebuild at will, given the time.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 2/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sylvan Substrate
description: Eating this won't make you invisible, or indestructible, any more than it will help you burn up the dance floor or improve your *ahem* anatomical characteristics.

name: Tasty Carrion
description: One day, you left with your old mount. In the evening, you came back with a new mount and some meat to cook for supper.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 2/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 5/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 8/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Masterly New Leaf Orb
description: This orb lets you reset an item’s characteristics if you use it during a Smithmagic session.

name: Great Game Card
description: There's a rumour that the picture cards of the Great Game filed a complaint with the Divine Tribunal of Ingloriom for cuts and folds. Since the arrival of adventurers in the Ecaflipus Dimension, the cards have been getting beaten regularly.

name: Catseye's Die
description: In order to make a decision when several choices present themselves, it is important to always have a die handy. Don't hesitate to throw it a second time if the first throw's result wasn't what you were hoping for.

name: Atcham's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 2/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 3/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 7/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Catseye Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Gambasmak Scale
description: Gambasmaks are extremely rapid and agile. Their scales help them be more stable underwater, as well as giving them a unique style.

name: Mantaze Tail
description: Constantly electrified, the Mantaze's tail generates a dangerous sphere around it – so long as it is underwater. In the darkness, certain underwater animals get fooled: attracted by the light, they don't miss out on suffering a few discharges.

name: Octodoll Ink
description: Octodoll Ink is normally black. This sample must have been taken during a particular period.

name: Silyrus Moustache
description: Silyruses love to live dangerously: if two of their moustaches touch one another, it can paralyse them. And yet these are the only underwater inhabitants to give each other a kiss on the cheek when they meet.

name: Tritun Skin
description: Tritun skin, combined with their natural ability to swim, lets them make it through certain underwater passages that they alone can make it through. It's not well understood how that works.

name: Skt-Zo Leg
description: Skt-Zos absorb souls. Their tentacles absorb souls, their mouth absorbs souls, their eyes absorb souls... naturally, their legs absorb souls too. It's a way of life.

name: Quisnoa
description: This pseudo-cereal is consumed by divers in great quantities; there's nothing better than some good Quisnoa gruel to weigh you down and make you reach the bottom faster.

name: Sepiolite
description: This soft, white mineral is as light as foam, which is where it gets its name from. The mineral, that is, not foam… After being dried out, it becomes as hard as your mother-in-law's heart. Its heat resistance and porous nature make for a material of choice to create pipes.

name: Dantinea's Palace Key
description: This key grants you the right to be Dantinea's next meal. Don't forget to season yourself before entering her palace!

name: Koutoulou's Temple Key
description: Entering Koutoulou's Temple… what a strange and terrifying idea! Are you sure your mind's not warped?

name: Jackalnubis Fragment
description: No need to rub it frantically; no genie will come out of this fragment.

name: Tal Kasha Hair
description: You're going to need more than a tuft of his hair to compete with the Tal Kasha's mane.

name: Pipistracker Nose
description: In the past, some Pipistrackers used their sense of smell to get their bearings and track their prey. Now, the smell of ghouls completely masks any trail, so they do the same thing as Borbats and get their bearings using echolocation.

name: Phiretom Eye
description: This eye still moves occasionally, as if it's surveilling the area and waiting for a moment of weakness.

name: Dedbomb Grenade
description: Charred One dentists recommend that their patients place one of these grenades in their mouths to eliminate oral health problems.

name: Charred Ones' Blood
description: Unlike lava, Charred Ones' blood never cools down, and remains molten. This property hasn't escaped Brakmarian chefs' attention, and they now use it to spice up dishes that need to be kept hot.

name: Drowhirl Lance Tip
description: You can impersonate a Unikron by sticking it to your forehead, or you can always impersonate a Unikron by sticking it to your forehead.

name: Bethel Akarna Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Meno Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Dantinea Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Tal Kasha Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Rhineetle Horn
description: The Department for the Control and Regulation of Counterfeit Creatures guarantees that Rhineetle horns will grow back quickly. According to them, this is proven by the fact that nobody's ever seen a hornless Rhineetle.

name: Legend of Bram Worldbeard
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Bram Worldbeard.

name: Legend of Ganymede
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Ganymede.

name: Chokao Temple Key
description: No Chocomancer will let you in to the Chokao Temple without this key.

name: Magikrab Animal Legend
description: The Magikrab was so ridiculous that no god, large or small, has ever dared claim its creation. Even Silouate didn't bother to protect it during the great plague that wiped out so many pets.

name: Time Crystal
description: The delicate fusion of the present physical materials and past and future abstract elements led to the formation of this crystal.

name: Timeless Crystal
description: The delicate fusion of the present physical materials and past and future abstract elements led to the deformation of this crystal.

name: Kwaketch'd Quintessence
description: Used on a legendary pet, it will grant it a random power linked to movement.

name: Bakusharna Quintessence
description: Used on a legendary pet, it will grant it a random special power. Warning: the power obtained will be final and cannot be changed.

name: Great Timekeeper's Spectacles
description: These glasses seem ordinary, but they really are exceptional. They'll let you decipher the millions of volumes in Xelor's archives without spending millions of years at the job. Even for an immortal, the glasses are a wonderful time-saver… that adventurers will never properly appreciate because they never read all the text.

name: Turtelonia's Sanctuary Key
description: You can visit Turtelonia's Sanctuary with this key. But there's no guarantee you'll live to tell the tale.

name: Turtelonia Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Dawaj Eye
description: What you thought were shining eyes are actually translucent stones Dawajes use to cover their eyes to protect them in the daylight and keep their night vision sharp.

name: Servitude Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Pistilick Tongue
description: Adventurers are always on the lookout for unique treasures, but was it really necessary to collect a Pistilick tongue?

name: Tentaclobber Tentacle
description: As their name suggests, Tentaclobbers are a pain to be around. This tentacle is the perfect weapon to make them understand the suffering they inflict on others by their mere presence.

name: Demongrel Petal
description: Make sure you've only plucked the Demongrel's petal. The spores that may be attached to it carry the worst diseases you can possibly imagine. Although, looking at your face, it may already be too late…

name: Servitude's Lock
description: No one has ever been able to break this lock, all those who bore it served their master until their very last breath.

name: War's Cap
description: Some will put it on their heads, others will smash it with their heads. You immediately recognised that this object would make a perfect knee brace… because you're such an intellectual.

name: Sharp Blade
description: The number of heads cut by this blade could turn yours.

name: Pandora Hair
description: This mysterious hair aids the sewing of magical hats and capes with surprising magic effects.

name: Giant Kralove Ink
description: Slimy and dense, the Kralove ink can be used either to write romantic letters or to paint your room a depressing black depending on how your love life's going.

name: Flask of Draconic Gas
description: This flask is filled with gas from a dragon's wounded colon. Only the most skilful craftsmen will be able to use it without putting themselves at risk.

name: Leatherball Tooth
description: This tooth is the perfect illustration of why you should never put your hand into an unknown mouth, even if it is to impress a girl.

name: Potbellion Blood
description: This brute's blood can't even be used to make black pudding. Outrageous!

name: Stalak Ethmoid
description: This bone was broken on more than one occasion when the young Stalak still played Gobbowl. You know what they say about Gobbowl, though: "Them's the breaks!"

name: Karkanik Blood
description: Not even a vampire would drink this stuff.

name: Revish Moustache
description: Ridiculous moustaches were all the rage before you were born, so have some respect for those of us who are still brave enough to wear one!

name: Nessil Slobber
description: A thorough analysis of this slobber shows that Nessil should really think about flossing a lot more regularly.

name: Nileza's Buttonhole
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kan-O-Mat Claw
description: When a Kan-O-Mat feels sad, it scratches its claws on Count Harebourg's tapestries. When a Kan-O-Mat feels happy, it scratches its claws on Count Harebourg's tapestries as well. Any resemblance to real persons in your guild, living or dead, is purely coincidental.

name: Mecanofoux Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sylargh's Wool
description: This wool kept Sylargh warm while he worked outside until the fateful day he developed a terrible phobia of snowflakes.

name: Sylargh's Incisor
description: This hollow tooth is almost as rusty as your social skills.

name: Bubotron Feather
description: The Frigostian bourgeoisie love to pluck these feathers from Bubotrons and use them to adorn their hats. Count Harebourg loves to pluck these feathers from the Frigostian bourgeoisie and uses them to adorn his Bubotrons.

name: Cycloid Eye
description: Cycloids can spot mechanical defects with an unerring accuracy, so it's no surprise that this eye is staring directly at you.

name: Sinistrofu Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Count Harebourg's Bandages
description: Icy yet warm, clean yet sullied by insults. You're still not convinced the Count deserved his fate.

name: Nileza's Laboratory Key
description: There might be some powerful potions in Nileza's laboratory, although they probably taste foul. You'll just have to try them all to find out.

name: Grasmera's Pouch of Magma
description: This organic pouch will withstand even the highest temperatures, which means that you can safely bury your head in it when your ears are burning with shame.

name: Merkator's Aquadome Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Levitrof Tooth
description: Its ex-owner may be a long-forgotten threat now, but this tooth seems to contain some kind of mystical power. People in its vicinity get the impression they're being followed everywhere by a Levitrof. Way to awaken old phobias!

name: Mastaklyr's Disarmed Trap
description: This trap is no longer all that dangerous – at best it could be reused as a hammer.

name: Magic Skemage Skull
description: Skemages use this skull to channel their magic. But, truth be told, it's mostly just a decorative element.

name: Bacterrible Antenna
description: We're not really sure why many Bacterribles have antennae like this. Some theories say they're purely cosmetic, others hold that they serve some sort of olfactory purpose.

name: Queen of Thieves Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Hystairkal Horn
description: Not all Fugitives have horns, you know. You really shouldn't jump to conclusions about why some have them and some don't.

name: Crushmore Claw
description: Crushmores love using their fists, but their claws are not a pretty sight close up.

name: Vortex Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Fragment of Scampihorse's Map 4/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Tasty Meat
description: One day, you left with your parents-in-law. The next, you came back alone, your bag full of ground meat they gave you. No one's seen them since.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 6/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Kongoku's Map 8/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kongoku's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 6/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Voldelor's Map 7/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Jack's Vest
description: This vest supposedly brings luck. Its former owner should have held on to it better.

name: Fragment of Atcham's Map 5/8
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Merdiodon Spine
description: Before grabbing a globe-fish, Merdiodons aren't immune to their poison. It's after continuously being stung while handling them that they build up a tolerance.

name: Diepwon Tentacle
description: This tentacle is a vestige of what the Diepwon was before fully possessing its host.

name: N'yalgy Tentacle
description: Often confused with a sea snake, this tentacle lets the N'yalgy frighten away animals that come too close while it's attempting magic rituals.

name: Spookkoth's Eye
description: Synonymous with conspiracy, Spookkoth's Eye is its main tool for sewing discord.

name: Koutoulou Larva Wing
description: It's hard to believe that such a small wing could support the immense weight of a Koutoulou Larva. Thankfully, magic can explain anything.

name: Anerice's Spike
description: The spikes on Anerice's dress make anyone who comes to close bleed, not to offend them.

name: Ilyzaelle's Lookout Key
description: Ilyzaelle's Lookout is a place that sends shivers down your spine. Luckily for you, the Soul-Blazes are very cuddly, and are always there to give you a bit of warmth.

name: Skoul Claw
description: This type of claw is highly sought after at funfairs. They're generally used in games where you have to grab items with them. This is made all the more difficult by their ghostly nature.

name: Solar's Brain
description: Against all expectations, Solar had a brain that was several times larger then a green pea. With the little use he made of it, he shouldn't miss it too much.

name: Funerbroadsword Protection
description: This removable protection can be used as an elbow pad, knee brace or muzzle, to name but a few.

name: Piece of Micrab Armour
description: The Micrab claims to wear this armour for purely defensive purposes, but has never managed to explain what adding thorny growths to it was supposed to do in this regard.

name: Key to Bethel's Tower
description: Ideal for picking your nose, cleaning your ears out, and scrubbing under your toenails.

name: Ilyzaelle Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Rokrusher Leggings
description: No one has yet seen a Stubbyob kneel before anything. Some biologists even theorise that they do not have knees and so are physically unable to kneel.

name: Legend of Crocobur
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Crocobur.

name: Legend of Lady Jhessica
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Lady Jhessica.

name: Legend of Fallanster
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Fallanster.

name: Legend of Buhorado
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Buhorado.

name: Legend of Jahash Jurgen
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of the saga of Jahash Jurgen.

name: Milipraline Hair
description: Even though it looks exactly like candy floss covered in angel-hair noodles, the Milipralines' hair is not edible, alas.

name: Temperaumaturge Cauldron
description: This cauldron is perfect for simmering delicious stews for hours, but it might give your meals the bitter taste of chocolate and victory through physical violence rather than through dialogue and sincere communication.

name: Golden Leviatun Scale
description: Leviatun scales only start their slow transformation into gold after several centuries on their host. This, combined with the near extinction of Leviatuns explains why they are so difficult to find these days.

name: Aziz Feather
description: The wingspan of the Aziz is so wide that people claim that if it spread its wings it could hide the sun and plunge the World of Twelve into darkness.

name: Babyhemoth Animal Legend
description: Some claim that the Babyhemoth's real name is "Uglyhemoth" after its appearance at birth. Since there's no reliable testimony from anyone who's seen this creature, the theory has never been proven.

name: Guilodyle Tongue
description: This tongue is absolutely delicious stewed with a few vegetables. Albino Crocodyls obviously prefer it raw.

name: Sterile Soil
description: This handful of sandy-textured soil might not make a very good fertiliser. It's as if all of the nutrients it once contained have been sucked out, down to the last one.

name: War Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Misery Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Blood Throne Key
description: This key will let you challenge the most bloodthirsty Horsman of the Eliocalypse. Don't forget to equip your weapons and shine your armour – if you're going to be buried by War's hatchet, you might as well not look like a beggar.

name: Tree of Death Key
description: Decay, decrepitude and alienation – such are the charms of the Tree of Death. Do you want to go back to your roots and become one with nature? Corruption, the Horseman, will be delighted to turn you into compost.

name: Corruption's Horn
description: It takes bravery to endure its sharp thorns, but if you're going to be corrupted, why not go all the way?

name: Slave Necklace
description: Anyone wearing this necklace is deprived of any will to rebel. It is the symbol of persecution in a world of obedience.

name: Whip Handle
description: This very ergonomic handle means you can whip harder to increase efficiency.

name: Armour Fragment
description: This fragment from some titanic armour appears to have been forged in blood.

name: The Legend of Misery
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Misery's story.

name: The Legend of War
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of War's story.

name: The Legend of Servitude
description: From dream to reality, memories become legends. This one tells part of Servitude's story.

name: Synthetic Leather
description: As well as being smoother than a Dragoturkey's bum cheeks and more resistant than an Enutrof's hairpiece, this leather is also an excellent insulator. That's probably why Frigostians use it to gag their wives, children and mothers-in-law.

name: Kwismas Minotoball Gift Package
description: This package was given to the Kwismas Minotoball because he was a good boy all year long. Incidentally, that's also the reason he gets to take several weeks' holiday every year in Descendre, to unwind by brawling merrily with any adventurers who cross his path.

name: Mopy King Fabric
description: This fabric has more holes than Swiss cheese, but it is still capable of absorbing a maximum amount of waste to regurgitate at the least opportune moment. BANG! And the dirt is back.

name: Mopy King Inside Out Shorts
description: Taking after their ancestor, Mopy King Dagobert, all Mopy Kings wear their shorts inside out. What's confusing is that it doesn't turn their stomachs inside out as well.

name: Yokai Snowfoux Skull
description: The skull of the Yokai Snowfoux has just about enough room to hold a snowflake that has been crushed in a vice and then evaporated. But as stupidity is frightening, all Frigostians are terrorised by this creature, even though it is barely able to put one paw in front of the other.

name: Yokai Snowfoux Wool
description: It's difficult to find anything more stupid than the offspring of a Yokai Snowfoux, yet some parents seem to have succeeded. You're trying to work out what that's got to do with this Snowfoux Wool, but you can't see anything, even squinting and shaking your fists.

name: Kolosso's Caverns Key
description: Nope, it doesn't matter how hard you stare at it, you won't get an answer. This isn't the key to the gates of paradise.

name: Kolosso Claw
description: Elderly Frigostians say that in order to shatter this claw, it must be heated to white-hot and then quickly plunged into the snow.

name: Mellifluous Bearbarian Tail
description: The Mellifluous Bearbarian's tail puffs up when it is upset. No Frigostian has ever had the chance to see it unpuff, sadly.

name: Kami Snowfoux Incisor
description: This tooth smells just like your underwear and you've got a terrible pain in your buttocks. There must be a reason behind all this.

name: Sylargh Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Void Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Vivacity Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Obscure Shard
description:
This Shard comes from the inky black body of a creature from the Lost Dimension.
It doesn't seem terribly useful, except to players who've finished the quest "The Army of Shadows", who can use it to persuade a Globilum to follow them everywhere.

name: Count Razof's Camp Key
description: A tin of food or a bottle of red wine would have done just as nicely.

name: Rustic Implants Diagram
description: To create a Rustic Implant, a Blacksmith must follow this diagram with 1 Pyrute and 1 Midnight Meat.

name: Hunter's Trap Chest
description: This chest contains several Hunter's Traps.

name: Maho Snowfoux Wool
description: Long used for stuffing the underwear of complex-ridden Frigostians, this wool is now known to give spots to anyone who strokes it. You have just found an excellent excuse to justify your pestilent pimples.

name: Bestial Brockhard Hair
description: The hair of a Bestial Brockhard is so abundant that certain Frigostians have used it to stuff mattresses, and as a result, their own pockets. However, they're not here any more to tell us about it.

name: Venomous Brockhard Tail
description: This tail's only use is to keep the Venomous Brockhard balanced. In other words, it's neither useful nor ornamental. Ah, there you go! Something you have in common.

name: Rampant Bearbarian Wool
description: The Rampant Bearbarian is not known for having fresh feet. Now he'll be known for not having fresh sheets too.

name: Vespal Bearbarian Antenna
description: The Vespal Bearbarians don't use this big antenna to communicate, but it does give them the opportunity to tie their enemies up easily.

name: Fuji Snowfoux Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Grohlum Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Klime Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Nileza Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Vice Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Obscurati Symbol
description: Vengeance, Viciousness, Vivacity, Violence, Void… Ever visible, this symbol evokes visions of visages not long forgot… vessels of the villainous revival.

name: Father Whupper Pattern
description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Father Whupper Set.

name: Swordfish
description: This fish is an incomparable duellist, which is to be expected when you consider how much time it must spend practicing.

name: Bottle of Nottlebeck
description: This artisanal beer, whose production secrets are known only to the initiated, has the power to reunite hunters, both good and bad.

name: Sakai Mine Key
description: Who would want the key to a disused mine on a frozen island, lost and guarded by strange goblins desperately seeking a lost nugget?

name: Maho Snowfoux Leather
description: This leather is thick enough to allow the Maho Snowfoux to withstand low, low temperatures and go sledging on his arse without hurting himself, which makes you particularly jealous.

name: Frozen Fabric
description: A piece of fabric that's colder than a Goblin in the middle of Descendre. One of two things: either your opponent delved into some seedy magic – you know, the strange dimensional kind – or he liked to go for a walk early in the morning. One thing's for certain: he wasn't faint hearted.

name: Temporal Shard
description: A shard of glass that looks pretty ordinary at first glance, but if you look closely, you can see scrolling images on its roughened surface. Memories? They look like events that took place nearly a century ago. This shard was part of a much larger piece, that's for certain.

name: Fuji Snowfoux Leather
description: This leather is very soft but has a rigidity that is hard to beat. Unfortunately, the pheromones it gives off are likely to attract a lot of unwanted attention.

name: Nightcrawling Brockhard Fabric
description: This fabric is very insubstantial. Be careful it doesn't disappear into thin air.

name: Icy Brockhard Molar
description: One of the great things about being a Icy Brockhard is that you can eat what you want and your breath stays as fresh as a snowdrop.

name: Torpid Bearbarian Iris
description: You laid into this poor creature with such ferocity that all that remains is this iris, without even its vitreous body for company. You're such a brute!

name: Torpid Bearbarian Hair
description: This hair could make you a fortune if sold in Torpidbearbarianville. Unfortunately there's no such place.

name: Rampant Bearbarian Leather
description: Every time you look at this piece of leather, you can't help but hum that famous song by the Amaknian duo Lark and Mard: "Oh what a glorious thing to be, a healthy, grown-up, busy buzzy bee, whiling away the passing hours, pinching all the pollen from the corned-beef flowers".

name: Esurient Bearbarian Incisor
description: Still covered in honey, this incisor must be rotten to the pulp.

name: Esurient Bearbarian Fabric
description: Some people have the fabric of heroes. You have the fabric of an Esurient Bearbarian.

name: Vespal Bearbarian Wings
description: The death rate amongst young Vespal Bearbarians is very high, since their honey-covered wings tend to get stuck together when they're in flight. Their inability to fly well makes them excellent Kamikazes.

name: Ice Powder
