description: Sprinkle this powder into the underwear of those of your fellow adventurers who are just that little bit too smooth-talking for their own good.

name: Violence Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Shadow Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Holy Bamboo Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Crambo Arrow
description: If you ask Count Razof why Cra would create such a creature, he'll inform you it wasn't the goddess but him who created Crambo.

name: Count Razof Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Bearbarian Antichamber Key
description: Any self-respecting Frigostian can blab on for weeks about the many virtues of honey. Rather than listen to the gassy old windbags, why don't you have a look inside the hive yourself? You might even get the chance to see the inside of a Bearbarian's stomach while you're at it.

name: Bestial Brockhard Claw
description: The Bestial Brockhard is able to scratch his back very easily using his claws, but has to make sure he doesn't scratch any lower.

name: Icy Brockhard Ear
description: It's probably not a good idea to play Chinese Whispers with an Icy Brockhard; you could end up with chapped lips.

name: Kolosso Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Vengeance Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Shadow Horn
description: If someone tells you to take Shadow by the horns, you perhaps shouldn't take them literally. This horn doesn't contain much shadowy power anymore, but all the same, it's evil – handle with care.

name: Quixote Swordfish
description: During mating season, this fish swims upstream to attack waterfalls in order to impress its sweetheart. This lets fishermen catch it without having to go out on the ocean.

name: Hunderp Blood
description: It's hard to say if this blood is the Hunderp's or one of its victims.

name: Buckshot Tail
description: It's not the first time that you've held such a hairy tail in your hands, and it feels just as good as it ever did.

name: Draftwit Slobber
description: If you distill just one drop of this slobber, you could keep the Amakna Tavern stocked up on beer for an entire month.

name: Nemroz Bone
description: This bone belongs to a hunter who won't live long enough to become anything but skin and bones.

name: Count Razof Hair
description: It's quite normal that Count Razof has practically no hair left on his noggin, because you've got it all in your hands.

name: Hunter's Trap Blueprint
description: To create a Hunter's Trap, a Handyman must follow this blueprint with 7 Holy Bamboo Woods and 7 Amakna Beers.

name: Muscle-Bound Beverage Formula
description: To create a Muscle-Bound Beverage, an Alchemist must follow this formula with 8 Mandrakes, 10 Drinking Waters, and 1 Cawwot.

name: Muscle-Bound Beverage
description: This beverage is intended for an animal, and its effects on a Twelvian might be drastically different. Therefore, please don't drink it before you go strutting about the beach this summer.

name: Holy Bamboo Wood
description: Normally, only the most deserving Pandawas can get their hands on a piece but sometimes, lumberjack tourists take a little souvenir of their trip to Pandala Island. Bloody tourists.

name: Frozen Fragment
description: A seemingly innocuous stone, but completely frozen, right to the very heart of the rock. Even around the frozen Frigost Island, such a thing is strange. Even an Ice Kwak couldn't accomplish such a feat! So who has such power? And how did they get it? A mystery.

name: Fuji Snowfoux Condyle
description: This Snowfoux condyle is perfectly designed to dig into any concave, bony cavity that presents itself. Your skull, for example.

name: Nightcrawling Brockhard Ear
description: This ear, thinner and more contoured than those of the other creatures in the Fangs of Glass, is aerodynamic perfection incarnate, which comes in very handy when you're crossing the different dimensions.

name: Venomous Brockhard Scapula
description: You were sitting on this bone and you didn't even realise. Fancy that!

name: Kolosso Fabric
description: Formerly known as Piautre, Kolosso was renown for having hair as strong as steel. Unfortunately no one has ever found any trace of lead in his brain.

name: Celestial Bearbarian Tail
description: If the Celestial Bearbarian's Tail doesn't stay a pristine white and if it touches the ground, or some honey, Frigost Island will be engulfed in ice five times over. Well, that's the Celestial Bearbarian's excuse for being carried around by a slave, anyway.

name: Celestial Bearbarian Hamate
description: The Celestial Bearbarian has broken this bone several times playing Growlf. Growlf is a game invented by the Bearbarians which consists of hitting small enemies into a hole using a sceptre. The prize for the Bearbarian who manages to do this in the least number of shots is a honey bath.

name: Mellifluous Bearbarian Calcaneus
description: As a result of tap-dance lessons, the Mellifluous Bearbarians' Calcanei have become incredibly resistant.

name: Kami Snowfoux Cornea
description: You can finally look the Kami Snowfoux in the eye without your bony knees knocking together.

name: Snowfoux Tear
description: Having heard about the death of his mother, the Snowfoux shed this unique tear just before he himself shuffled off this mortal coil.

name: Celestial Bearbarian Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Missiz Freezz Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Merkator Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Shadow's Pyramid Key
description: With this key in your possession, you now have access to a place steeped in mystery. When you go there maybe you can cast some light in the shadows.

name: Midnight Meat
description: Only the best father pheasant plucker that ever plucked a father pheasant could pluck this meat.

name: Midnight Carrion
description: If it were blue, it would be called something else. Well, no, it wouldn’t be called Something Else literally.

name: Rustic Implants
description: These implants give Ben Wodent claws and fangs. What better way to make your partner jealous?

name: Gobshell Wood
description: This wood smells of explosive powder and Goblin chewing tobacco. That makes two excellent reasons not to put it in your mouth.

name: Gobshell Egg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Great Rocha
description: Whoever's closest is usually wrong. But not by a wrong shot.

name: Drilla Stone
description: It was inevitable that the Drilla would eventually find this stone as all he does is drill rock all day long. He is convinced that its odd appearance means it is worth more than a vulgar piece of coal, so he keeps it, and will almost certainly exchange it for a beer or perhaps a female goblin, although the beer would be a much better choice and far less hassle in the long term.

name: Drilla Brain
description: Clearly this is a rarity. Finding a Drilla Brain in a Drilla skull is like looking for a needle in a haystack or an ant tooth a bag of rice.

name: Bomma Distributa
description: This strange piece of wood is supposed to produce an electrical pulse to cause a spark to travel to the spark plugs of the Bomma's machine. Hmmmm. A piece of wood that produces an electrical pulse? You're almost certainly holding a magical object that could explode in your face. Put it on your tongue and check it still works.

name: Bomma Stomach
description: This stomach was very firmly attached to its former owner, but then it does take a huge amount of guts to pilot the Bomma's incredible machine.

name: Sakai Nugget Fragment
description: Count Harebourg was quite clear: "It's there for sure, under your nose! Just a few pickaxe blows away. Keep looking." So the Goblins tirelessly continued to seek the true nugget of Sakai, deemed to be bigger than the fist of a Trool and heavier than a bowl of Kerbabben Salad. How could such a stone go unnoticed on such a small island?

name: Soryo Snowfoux Ear
description: We don't know how the Snowfoux arrived on Frigost, but we do know that their distant cousins come from Pandala. Now you understand a little better where that frozen McSheth residue that you slept in last night came from.

name: Soryo Snowfoux Paw
description: Having taken several blows to the face from this paw, you finally have the right to place it in your bag as a good luck charm.

name: Obsidemon Slag
description: Even the Obsidemon itself thinks this is junk. Just don't put it in your pockets, especially those that aren't fireproof.

name: Obsidemon Vertebra
description: This vertebra contains bone marrow that has already been cooked and is ready to be consumed. What you are holding in your hands is the precursor to an entire line of microwave ready meals.

name: Stabba Tail
description: Even other Goblins don't know where the Stabba hides its tail. And yet here you are, holding it in your hands.

name: Stabba Fibula
description: This bone appears to have suffered several fractures, most probably from the pickaxe blows of other Goblins whose vocabulary is often limited to "Grüüüp" and "Oukk", and whose sentences are punctuated by pickaxe blows.

name: Grabba Radius
description: Looking at this bone, you can't help but think back to your last fight against a Grabba and his horrible northern accent, capable of scaring Moskitos and Orange Larvae. That aside, he has a big heart, which means he can be skewered more easily.

name: Grabba Skin
description: There's a Goblin shopping list written on this skin in adventurer blood: "Beer, Meat, Beer" - everything needed for a successful party. You should keep it.

name: Asploda Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Great Zaihn
description: The eye of the cyclone is less dangerous than the cyclops' club.

name: Asploda Wig
description: The younger generations wear this tuft of hair on their torso. Old Goblins wear it on their head. Grumpy old Goblins are forced to swallow it.

name: Bworker's Cave Key
description: This keys allows you to enter the Bworker's Cave Caution: it will be destroyed after use.

name: Pyrute
description: This alloy was used to forge blades which wouldn't rust when in contact with the blood and drool of its victims.

name: Ougaat Fragment
description: Ougaa has stunning headgear, and you're holding a piece of his special hat in your hands.

name: Synthetic Root
description: This root was created by a Frigostian biologist to repair the damage caused by his past mistakes.

name: Dramanita Eye
description: Even torn from its mycological socket this eye continues to emit a slight glow, but sadly not enough to help you find your way through the Petrified Forest at night.

name: Fistulina Ear
description: Able to hear the sound of Kanigloo fleas at a distance of more than seventy-two Cromagmunk feet, these ears have had the nosiest, deafest Frigostians fantasising for generations.

name: Pyrotechnic Brockhard Eye
description: Such big, moist eyes and so cute, too. How could you do such a thing to this poor creature?

name: Father Kwismas's House Key Mould
description: Using this mould, you might just be able to make it into Father Kwismas's House. That doesn't mean you're going to make it out alive though.

name: Trechepeira Venom
description: This venom inflates any organ it's injected into to incredible levels. They say that Sram's Herald once accidentally suffered its effects.

name: Key to Toxoliath's Cave
description: A veritable herbal paradise for alchemists, Toxoliath's cave is nonetheless pretty noxious.

name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Millet Nial
description: Wine experts are ready to buy this grain at a price that would give any self-respecting Enutrof a heart attack.

name: Virgin Forest Substrate
description: Alchemists use this substrate to develop new contagious, fatal diseases.

name: Tench
description: Tench sounds a lot like stench. This is not a coincidence.

name: Haunted Tench
description: It seems that this magic fish brings bad luck. At least that's what the fishermen say.

name: KOs’ Massive Epaulette
description: These epaulettes are so huge that only a phenomenally strong creature can wear them without getting crushed under their weight.

name: Fragment of the Warrior of KOs' Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of the Warrior of KOs' Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fir-Green Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this fir-green astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Temple of the Great Ougaa Key
description: This key grants you access to the terrifying Temple of the Great Ougaa and his Funguses.

name: Ougaa Spine
description: This beast only has four spines on its head, but what spines… sharp as gads they are!

name: Buzta Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dramanita Gill
description: Frigostians cook these gills in parcels of fabric made from Kanigloo hair before washing them three times in the snow. Their hallucinogenic properties have never been demonstrated, and those who have consumed them have strangely escaped from Frigost Island by swimming, without ever managing to return.

name: Serpula Flake
description: The Serpula is known to Frigostians for inflicting considerable damage to buildings by devouring, among other things, their timber frames. It is said that cutting off its volva is enough to render it completely harmless. But as you've killed it, you'll never know.

name: Pyrotechnic Brockhard Ear
description:
Pyrotechnic Brockhards are somewhat timid creatures, and their ears point backwards so much that it becomes almost impossible to find them.
You, however, appear to have succeeded.

name: Gluttonous Brockhard Manubrium
description: This bone is extremely solid and resistant, and is capable of supporting the weight of the Gluttonous Brockhard's claws and thoracic cage.

name: Apewicubic Bearbarian Vomer
description: This bone has been broken several times due to the Apewicubic Bearbarian being punched repeatedly on the nose, but still stays firmly in its skull. Once ground up into powder, it has several curative properties.

name: Ougaa Eye
description: This eye looks at you with a burning desire for vengeance.

name: Bworker Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Amorphid Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dethornit Stinger
description: The Dethornits only rarely come out of the Toxoliath's cave, and they have a tendency to implant their stinger into the first person they see.

name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dremoan Sporm
description: You hold in your hands Dremoan's descendants.

name: Mandrakueso
description: As strange as it may seem, alchemists have succeeded in making cheese out of this plant.

name: Elm Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Nahuatl
description: That which is dead may yet be killed.

name: Major New Leaf Orb
description: This orb lets you reset an item’s characteristics if you use it during a Smithmagic session.

name: Jade Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this jade astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Azure Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this azure astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Mauve Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this mauve astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Zinzolin Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this zinzolin astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Yomi Snowfoux Tail
description: The tail of the Yomi Snowfoux is always covered in bandages because the bone within it tends to break very easily, which is a very painful experience for its hapless owner.

name: Fistulina Volva
description: It is very important that you distinguish between a Fistulina's Volva, and another thing it has which, despite sharing a similar spelling, is actually something completely different altogether. Yep, that's right, a Volvo.

name: Korriander Foot
description: Thin, hairy, ugly and smelly, this foot is the perfect image of its former owner.

name: Gluttonous Brockhard Tail
description: The hunters of Frigost used to sell Gluttonous Brockhard Tails to Dame Antium.

name: Father Kwismas's House Key
description: This key was made by local craftsmen. Some of Kwismas Island's strongest monsters also have copies of it.

name: Toxoliath Blood
description: This blood fascinates alchemists: it's the only part of the Toxoliath that is completely noxious. In fact, it seems to have healing properties.

name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Millet
description: Don't confuse this grain with the famous Amaknian brewing company with the same name.

name: Amber Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this amber astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Sapphire Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this sapphire astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Indigo Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this indigo astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Bworker Hide
description: This skin has been through the wars and yet it has emerged unscathed. It should be just as useful now it's been removed from its former owner.

name: Buzta Foot
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Yomi Snowfoux Malleolus
description: As a result of the Yomi Snowfoux spending so much time mucking about in the snow, this bone is prone to suffering terrible fractures. There's never been a better time to shatter it once and for all than now.

name: Serpula Peduncle
description: Looking at this Serpula Peduncle, you'd think this evil creature had deserved his sad fate. Korriander will think the same when he sees yours.

name: Korriander Eye
description: This glassy eye is perfect to accompany a salad dressed with Rattedaugue vinaigrette. Recommended for the toughest of palates only, or for those without taste buds.

name: Korriander Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Sculucanus Pincer
description: Being incredibly sharp, these pincers can be used as an offensive weapon or as a tool – it all depends on what you're using them against.

name: Toxoliath Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Mandrake
description: It used to be that this plant only grew underneath the traps on the gallows. Since then, it's branched out a bit, and can be found all over cemeteries.

name: Drawing Board
description: Carrying this board with you everywhere lets you come up with new plans faster when your old ones fail.

name: Spoiled Carrion
description: There’s always a way to falsify documents or grease the palm of a health inspector in order to certify the perfect quality of this meat.

name: The Warrior of KOs' Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mary Reankle's Map
description: This map will take you to Mary Reankle's treasure.

name: Coral Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this coral astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Crimson Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this crimson astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Emerald Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this emerald astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Cyan Prysmaradite
description: As you look at this cyan astral stone, your eyes slowly close, ready to transport you to a new dream.

name: Elm Wood
description: Once a common type of wood, Elm is now much sought-after. A long time ago, a terrible bewitchment called Grafioze was cast by a powerful Bwork Magus of the worst kind, decimating whole forests of it.

name: Dolomite
description: Irko, the Dark Miner, had great respect for dolomite – "the hard and unbreakable rock" as he used to call it.

name: Korriander's Lair Key
description: This strangely shaped key shines at night. So if you happen to get lost in the Petrified Forest, instead of helping you find your way, it'll help the monsters find you instead.

name: Fungore Peduncle
description: Haug Rusrte Rondin was a famous Frigostian sculptor known for his sculptures of peduncles on log slices. One of his most famous works is "Rondin's Fungore".

name: Fungore Gill
description: The Fungore was once reputed to be an ugly creature who loved to play tricks on Frigostians. He was suspected of burning down houses and eating children. Fortunately, all this was a myth. In reality the Fungore is a gentle creature who burns children and eats houses.

name: Treecherous Bark
description: Frigostians once used this bark to cover benches and chairs. They would then all rush to rub up against them, with their bare bottoms hanging out of their pants, because having such smooth buttocks would allow them to reach much faster speeds when sledging on their backsides.

name: Treecherous Root
description: While shambling through the Petrified Forest one day, the Treecherous got its foot caught up in a root. Poor Treechy struggled so much that its foot snapped off, so now it uses the offending root as a replacement. Don't you love a happy ending?

name: Apewicubic Bearbarian Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Bworker Nail
description: Too big to use as a lucky charm, too dirty to take pride of place on your mantelpiece… This is yet another item for you to stuff under your bed, amongst your dirty washing, to be lost for eternity.

name: Giant Kralove Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Ougaa Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Necrotick Chitin
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Scoliopode Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dremoan's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Dremoan's Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Spoiled Meat
description: Your parents taught you early on that even though you're spoiled, it's no reason to throw you out with the rubbish, even if in this meat's opinion, you deserve it.

name: Fragment of the Warrior of KOs' Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of the Warrior of KOs' Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of the Warrior of KOs' Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mooring Ball
description: The original and biggest Mooring Ball was the subject of one of Frigost's longest-standing traditions: it was said that cupping the ball gently in your hand would bring luck for the coming year. Queues of citizens lined up at the port every winter to give it a stroke. Even after the ball was carried away by the storm that ripped off a chunk of Frigost Island, replicas have been made and fondled ever since - at least, that's what the P.A.N.T.S. prophets who gave you this imitation told you.

name: Cybwork Bolt
description: It's no good shutting the stable door after the horse has bolted, but really, if the Cybwork had been more careful with his hardware, he wouldn't be so screwed over now.

name: Cybwork Briefs
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mush Mish Eye
description: The Mush Mish has the annoying habit of wanting to scratch its itchy eyes with its pointy staff. Sometimes it loses an eye, and sometimes when it scratches its neck, it loses its head.

name: Mush Tup's Blade
description: The Mush Tup has two arms, two legs and two heads. All this means is that it's two times dumber than you'd expect.

name: Mush Rhume Slobber
description: This spit is delicious, if a little slimy. It's often used to grease weapons. Or warriors if they enjoy fighting with no clothes on.

name: Trumperelle Trunk
description: This Trumperelle trunk still has the toxic breath of its former owner. Now it's usually used as a phony musical instrument to kill whole audiences at 'assassination concerts.'

name: Great Sak
description: Whatever doesn't eat you makes you stronger.

name: Hemp Fibre
description: This fibre is more resistant than beautiful and can be smoked in your quiet moments of introspection.

name: Mushmunch Tongue
description: The Mushmunch has a tongue of incredible length and softness for licking spores off its companions. If I'm not mistaken, it's the only enviable trait they have.

name: Venerable Puddle
description: It may be small, but this puddle can prove a deadly trap for any Xelor who steps in it. In fact, if he's not rescued quickly, he might drown.

name: Holey Air Bandana
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Steam Crackler Heart
description: This stone heart fills with steam when the Steam Crackler meets a partner. This unique feature lets you determine quickly if you've killed a single Steam Crackler… You just need to see if its heart floats.

name: Mofette Tuff
description: Behind this strange name hides a rock with a vascular structure. But you can just content yourself with likening it to a piece of the giant mofette you just savagely split in two.

name: Venerable Mud
description: Ever since you've been carrying this mud around in your bag, a strange smell has been following you around, as if you've stepped in something. If I were you, I'd stay away from Eltneg Wood, in case a Trool falls in love with your delicate perfume.

name: Venerable Ashes
description: You won't have to look far to find the source of that barbecued Lousy Pig smell. These still hot and smoking ashes are burning your fur.

name: Holey Earth Bandana
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: White Boxers
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Steam Crackler Egg
description: Steam Cracklers are comparable to Cracklers made from steam that have decided to do battle with anything that does not resemble them in any way, or that they can just about make out through the steam. Unsurprisingly, they lay eggs filled with steam. Did I mention the steam?

name: Mofette Stone
description: The Mofette takes its name directly from a geological feature that is quite common in the Tears of Ouronigride. This stone resembles one of its organs, a kidney perhaps.

name: Sauroshell Fang
description: This long and pointy fang will be the envy of all your vampire friends. It is, after all, the size that counts.

name: Holey Water Bandana
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Loafing Potion
description: After abusive consumption, this sale of this potion is forbidden at Zaaps.

name: Venerable Powder
description: This powder is used to make the famous Mont Noir pencils. Its rarity doesn't really explain their exorbitant prices though, or the ridiculous profits their manufacturers make.

name: Venerable Smoke
description: This Sauroshell was just about to lay a magnificent Madreggon, but thanks to you, these dreams have gone up in smoke.

name: Holey Fire Bandana
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Blue Boxers
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mama Bwork Boil
description: When you compress the sides of this boil between your fingers, you'll cause a yellowish liquid with unknowable properties to ooze out. In public, you claim that you'd never do something so gross, but statistics show that 77% of people take a perverse pleasure in doing it in private.

name: Mushnid Bark
description: A parasite never feels so at home as when he's lodged in the bark of a Mushnid. From time to time the creature will scratch itself, tearing off a part of its diseased skin which can turn into a mushroom itself if it falls in the right place. This mushroom will then find the nearest Mushnid to parasite... as vicious circles go, this one is pretty gruesome.

name: Great Teleb
description: Keep your friends far away and your enemies even further.

name: Dark Bamboo Wood
description: Walloh, a young Pandawa, once asked his father, "What's the difference between Bamboo and Dark Bamboo, Daddy?" His dad slapped him for asking such a stupid question. Everyone knows that the difference between Bamboo and Dark Bamboo is the size of their seeds.

name: Snowfoux Den Key
description: It smells a bit like frozen, damp Bow Wow, but it'll get you into the Snowfoux Den.

name: Atomystique Tephra
description: This lava fragment was ejected at high speed from an Atomystique orifice that you never knew existed! Desperately trying to finish it off with blows from a rusty rake probably wasn't the best idea... Luckily, you weren't in its way when it came crashing down, lodging itself between the fleshy bum cheeks of a local builder.

name: XLII Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Tremrus Skin
description: This skin is ideal for camouflaging yourself in a rocky environment… so long as you're a Crackler.

name: Fumaroller Stone
description: The Fumaroller was waving this huge stone at the end of what appeared to be his tail. He had hoped to intimidate you, until you found his weak point. Unfortunately you failed to memorise it, as your head is full of cotton wool.

name: Fumaroller Artefact
description: This vaporous artefact smells like rotten eggs mixed with guanocamole. The mere mention of this mixture makes you hungry.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Wool
description: Ripped straight from the body of Tengu Snowfoux, this wool is particularly warm, and will strengthen your virility if your chest wig is a little sparse.

name: Cod
description: The number of cod has been greatly reduced by massive consumption in the big cities.

name: Lean Meat
description: All the fat from this meat has been carefully extracted in order to make the confectionary that is given to kids on school outings.

name: Wurmlord's Passage Key
description: The Wurmlord takes great pleasure in feeling adventurers penetrate his passage, then go back up all the way to his glottis. Therefore, feel free to jump into his hole feet first.

name: Sharcut Tongue
description: This is what happens when you bite your tongue with a mouth full of several rows of sharp teeth.

name: Mastifang Paw
description: Ridiculously small, this paw is a painful reminder of the mockery you suffered in the school locker room.

name: Thriten Tooth
description: People say that Thritens are the unluckiest Altdemons ever. Their teeth are sometimes used to make the bad luck potions so popular with Trool Fair vendors.

name: Twentoo Skin
description: Twentoo Skin is an extremely rare resource that is sometimes used to bribe influential figures with luxurious tastes.

name: Thirtree Loincloth
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sethen Beard
description: Superstitious types swear by Sethen Beards. Apparently they're deeply magical, although the only unusual thing you've noticed about this one is that it smells like sardines and must.

name: Tuft of Siks-T Hair
description: This tuft of hair is absolutely priceless. Maybe you'll find out how Siks-Ts manage to keep them in such good condition, no matter what hardships they may face.

name: Bearded Cod
description: This could be resold for a tidy sum at the Trool Fair.

name: Dark Bamboo Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Cyclouse Tooth
description: Let's just hope that any toothless Mimice are willing to pay you for it!

name: Atomystique Stone
description: This stone was levitating around an Atomystique until you tried to avoid it, or levitate yourself - you don't know exactly what happened, but now you've got a headache and you're covered in steaming mud.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Leather
description: The completely waterproof leather was used by Frigostians to craft supple, smooth, soft containers to put things in. Some of them even claimed they didn't need to use the containers, as they were happily married.

name: Tengu Snowfoux Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: XLII Horn
description: XLII's horns didn't start out that colour. How on earth did they get like this?

name: Altdemon Hair
description: These hairs are as irritating as your mother-in-law, which is really saying something.

name: Stapleworm Spike
description: A Stapleworm without spikes is like a Sadida without a doll, or an Enutrof without a beard: it loses everything that characterizes it and gives it its charm.

name: Wurmlord Eye
description: The Wurmlord's eye is his most developed sensory organ. So it makes sense it being valued by alchemists trying to reproduce this effectiveness.

name: Wurmlord Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: XLII's Metronomicon Key
description: Will you finally find the answer to the meaning of the universe?

name: Lean Carrion
description: The way the fat has been reduced in this meat is something that can easily be copied by aspiring slimmers - cut off any fat that sticks out. Immediate results guaranteed.

name: Sandworm Shell
description: This piece of shell is robust enough to serve as a sled on the dunes.

name: Great Boble
description: You can't taste a Dofus without breaking the shell.

name: Great Dagob
description: When well the battle goes, happen the worst does not.

name: Buck Anear Hair
description: Also known as "Buck Lightyear", "Buck Aroo", "Buck Adoaboutnothing" or "Buck Off", this pirate has sailed every sea known to man and beast. The tides have decided that he should end his days on the black sand beaches of Alma's Cradle.

name: Buck Anear Scapula
description: Broken twice by cannon balls, three times from rolling in the sea spray, and four times having slipped on dried guano, this bone made a wealthy man of the ship's doctor, until he was eventually thrown to the sharks for dark tales of gambling, women, alcohol, insubordination, provocations to a duel, treasure theft, scuttling and mutiny. A succession of small things which eventually led to his downfall. You don't mess with Buck Anear.

name: Solfatara Ulna
description: This steaming bone changes shape according to the mood of the Solfatara - a beast renowned for its terribly foul moods.

name: Solfatara Residue
description: How can a vaporous creature give rise to solid waste? This question was first asked 74 years ago during the famous Frigostian contest for the Promotion of Young Graduate Geologists. No participant was admitted that year and the issue still remains one of Frigost Island's most terrifying mysteries.

name: Korria
description: Better hurry it up.

name: Djim
description: He who always fights in the same spot gives up the opportunity to win elsewhere.

name: Hornbeam Wood
description: This wood is affectionately known by lumberjacks as "Hornbeam Wood" because of the tree it comes from. Perhaps if they knew what Sadidas did underneath these trees in the dead of night, they wouldn't be so eager to search them out.

name: Siktrin Bass
description: A cousin of the Lard Bass, the Siktrin Bass is officially an endangered species. The population was hunted enthusiastically ever since some quack idiot doctor claimed that it improved the singing voice.

name: Minotot Room Key
description: Crafted from diverse materials, this key will grant you an audience with the terrifying Minotot. If you go the distance, it'll make a great story for the taverns and picnic tables of the land. You'll also have a sore ass, or perhaps the remnants of a sore ass, if you do live to tell the tale… Good luck!

name: Minotot Wool
description: This wool is particularly thin making it possible for the Minotot not to have frizzy hair all over his body. No one knows why he has it. Maybe you should try to make hair grafts out of this wool so that you'll be able to display an abundant growth of brown hair on your chest. See, even your childhood dreams can come true!

name: Minotot Femur
description: This impressive bone successfully bore the Minotot's excess weight for centuries. Such a feat always deserves to be pointed out.

name: Kimbo Sock
description: Despite appearances, Kimbo does wear socks, but he just doesn't wear them on his feet. He prefers rolling them and then placing them in strategic places.

name: Kimbo Sphenoid
description: You'll never manage to place this bone correctly on Kimbo's skeleton, even after profound anatomical studies. Maybe it's because Kimbo has never actually had a sphenoid…

name: Minotot Ethmoid
description: This tiny bone from the Minotot's skull isn't the strongest, but it has never been broken thanks to the featherweight brain that it's used to supporting.

name: Kimbo Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Kanigrula Tail
description: This tail is covered with silky fur and is bendy, solid and machine-washable all at once. You can think of a thousand things to do with it, but none better than using it as a replacement bathrobe belt.

name: Anatak’s Scalp
description: ‘X marks the spot.’ You remembered this sentence as you were scalping Anatak, but unfortunately you did not find anything of value under his skin.

name: Fresh Carrion
description: Somebody had to find a use for the cannon fodder that mounts up every time a peace treaty goes south.

name: Fragment of Anatak's Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Weremoggy Catzino Token
description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

name: Gold
description: Gold is a rare and precious metal. Thanks to its intrinsic qualities, it is essential to the making of powerful and beautiful weapons.

name: Lard Bass
description: You can find this type of fish in glacial lakes and rivers. Fishermen really love it because of its size and its fresh flesh.

name: Kimbo Relic
description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

name: Alliagem
description: This rare stone will give you the influence you need to create an alliance. To destroy one, all you need to do is attempt to share a valuable piece of loot between several members.

name: Obsidemon Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Kanigrula Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Belladonna
description: Once popular with Otomai's disciples, but they gave up farming this plant after several fatal accidents having to do with its ingestion. Since, it's common to see alchemists in Sram's service on the island.

name: Fragment of Anatak's Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Brassic
description: A shiny alloy, Brassic is tolerated by bankrupt jewellers who can't afford precious stones. They usually make very competitively priced alloys. Comes in handy when you want to marry for money.

name: Minotot Horn
description: From a distance, this horn looks like a giant, extremely powerful Gobball Horn. Surprisingly enough, from up close, it looks like a Minotot Horn.

name: Kanigrula Fur
description: Sniff this silky fur and the warm, bestial musk it gives off will send your testosterone levels through the roof. Naturally, specimens regularly fetch small fortunes on the black market, but unfortunately for the Enutrof collectors who see it as their latest get-rich-quick scheme, most of the hunters who try plucking it straight from the source end up as adventurer stew.

name: Bread Board
description: Executioners like to use these boards to keep from damaging their work surfaces while executing smaller creatures.

name: Fresh Meat
description: Oto Mustam’s personal butcher, who has been recently promoted to work in the fiery lower levels of Brakmar, has become an expert in preparing this kind of meat.

name: Fragment of Anatak's Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Anatak's Map
description: This map will allow you to find Anatak Goldisk's legendary treasury.

name: Pouncer Fur
description:
"The Pouncer's soft and silky fur is as blue as the reflection of the skies in your eyes."
– Khan to Bakara
Taken from the tale "The Adventurer of Ecaflipus"

name: Calleyat Ear
description: When it's cold out, the Calleyat can always use its giant ears as impromptu blankets.

name: Ush Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Minotot Leather
description: Almost as rare as Gobball leather, this leather is perfect for creations that require supple seams... leather masks, for example.

name: Minotot Hoof
description: An enormous number of adventurers have been trampled by this hoof, but then so have many huge turds scattered around the Labyrinth of the Minotoror. You must understand that it's not easy for a charging Minotot to distinguish between the two at first glance.

name: Kimbo's Canopy Key
description: This strange key will enable you to enter the Kimbo Canopy in one piece.

name: Chewed-Up Helmet
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kanigrula's Cave Key
description: This key holds the promise of a future filled with hours and hours of wild, torrid excitement. You like claws and whips, right?

name: Primary Forest Substrate
description: This reminds you of vacations at the beach, being chased by the natives who wanted to roast you on a spit for some strange ancestral ritual.

name: Fragment of Anatak's Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Anatak's Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Ush's Plateau Key
description: This key is like a token which allows you to make a foolish bet: to survive a battle against Ush Galesh. Many would hesitate before risking their life, but not you. The emptiness of your existence is such that you have nothing to lose.

name: Catsquatch Tail
description: This tiger-striped tail works perfectly as a scarf. But be very sure it's not still attached to its owner before you put it around your neck.

name: Sucatrose Tooth
description: Each time you cross a Sucatrose, you feel an irresistable urge to munch on its fur, as if it were a snack. Don't be surprised, then, if it doesn't act very sweetly toward you.

name: Lord Crow's Scythe
description: This Scythe was originally designed to cut down Iops, but Lord Crow realised that harvesting grain was just as profitable as harvesting blood-thirsty warriors.

name: Used Bwork Protection
description: Love can sometimes be more destructive than war, but that's not what Bworker told you.

name: Kimbo Wig
description: To hide his premature baldness, Kimbo puts on this stupid wig. Fortunately for him, the coconut covers most of it.

name: Kimbo's Precious Stone
description: Let me tell you a little story… for many long years, the Kimbo sucked on this precious stone to soften it up. Then he shoved it up his nostril. Hmm, sometimes mother nature suckles her runts.

name: Obsidemon's Hypogeum Key
description: This worn key was once used to access the Frigost mines. Nowadays, it can be used to enter the Obsidemon's Hypogeum, where the bodies of adventures foolish enough to have crossed its path are kept nice and warm.

name: Minotot Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Belladonzel
description: It used to be common for Otomai's disciples to offer this plant to young women who caught their eyes. Since Iops joined their ranks, the practise has been abandoned.

name: Corn
description: Otomai's disciples love grilling this dried grain in a pan, with salt or sugar, before watching a spectacle.

name: Kornub
description: The sailors making the journey between Otomai Island and the continent of Amakna always keep this grain nearby, which they sell for a tidy profit in Madrestam.

name: Hornbeam Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Catichan's Collar
description: Even though it's as fast as air, you'll always hear a Catichan coming thanks to this collar decorated with a little tinkling bell.

name: Ush's Moustache
description: Each of Ecaflips' sons cherishes their fur - when they have some - like a divine gift. So it's normal that you hunt them down and rip out their fur like it was an invaluable treasure.

name: Great Pikmi
description: You can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

name: Alyeena Face
description: This adorable face will tremble if there are evil spirits around, which means that the Cania hunters have no trouble at all selling it as a natural vibro-massager on the Brakmarian market.

name: Light Treeckler Knot
description: Captain Chafer heard the name of this object, and for ever more, the Treeckler was known as "Knob Head".

name: Alyeena Hair
description: This hair is the subject of many a Iop's jealous rage. In fact, they were so incensed by the idea that their hairstyle was not unique that they spent centuries trying to massacre the Alyeenas. Unfortunately, they continually confused one another with the monsters and ended up fighting with their own kin. Rish Claymore had to intervene in person to put an end to this madness.

name: Kannihilator Mane
description: Believe it or not, Kannihilators are born with snow-white manes. They take on their terracotta hue over several years, as the Kannihilators get used to burrowing for food in the entrails of Iop hunters who brandish their swords a little too close to the Alyeenas.

name: Kannihilator Skin
description: If you spent all day digging up the earth and crushing gravel with your bare hands, your skin would be just as tough and rocky as a Kannihilator's!

name: Light Treeckler Stump
description: Don't you know why this stump is unlike any other stump? It's obvious!

name: Vigi Pirate Fabric
description: If you turn this fabric over, you'll find some invaluable advice: "If you see an enemy, rob him of his treasure, hide it on a desert island and put a cross on a map so you can remember its location. Remember not to hide the map with the treasure".

name: Sewer Keeper Leg
description: This hairy, greasy leg is just downright dirty. Were you hoping to pick your nose with it? You might make matters worse...

name: Kanazure Fabric
description: This fabric is rarer than Kaniger fabric for the simple reason that it's much harder for an Astrubian to slay a Kanazure than a Kaniger.

name: Orfan Mane
description: Rumour has it that Nevark shaved the manes off all the Orfans in a single day, after leaving them each with just one eye to cry with. The hunter himself is unable to confirm if every single Orfan was really there, because he was only two years old and didn't know how to count yet.

name: Harpy Pirate Scale
description: This scale belongs to what appears to be a former Frigostian-turned-pirate who was transformed into a ghost when he swallowed too much water while swimming. That's what happens when you have too much salt in your diet!

name: Magic Blood Orange Dye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Vigi Pirate Eye
description: Vigi Pirates are selected for their excellent visual capacity. They are able to discern a school of tuna during a storm at night with an octopus covering their eyes, guano on their eyelids and the songs of Jon Lemon playing in the background.

name: Kanazure Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Great Horiz
description: When the wiseman points to the horizon, the idiot looks at his finger, and the monster eats the finger. The idiot survives, the wiseman is down a finger, and the monster is hopefully sated.

name: Harpy Pirate Shell
description: The Harpy Pirate stole this shell from a powerless mollusc. It hasn't made him any more powerful so far.

name: Alteration Potion
description: The doctors advise you not to drink it, but your future heritors are all for it. Who to believe?

name: Orfan Buckle
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Felygiene Canine
description: With two of these canines inserted into your dentures, people will sincerely hope that you are not coming back to bite them in the bum.

name: Bigheera Chain
description: Slipped around your neck, wrists and ankles just before your deep-sea diving test, this heavy chain might just make your mother-in-law the happiest woman in the world.

name: Felygiene Claw
description: This claw is so sharp and pointy that it can be used by surgeons as both a scalpel and a needle for stitching patients back up. Thrifty!

name: Bigheera Ball
description: Why do Bigheeras drag such heavy balls along behind them? Could they be trying to compensate for something?

name: Snailmet Shell
description: Round and shiny, this shell has been polished with slobber for several centuries.

name: Snailmet Slobber
description: This Snailmet Slobber won't break a Pikoko's bones, but it'll certainly keep one glued to the ground.

name: Great Hulhu
description: Fear makes the Gobball run faster than a Tofu.

name: Air Pikoko Nut
description: There's no milk in this Pikoko Nut but you'll find some brain juice with a few floating neurons.

name: Air Pikoko Rump
description: This rump will enable you to create items that will cover up your own backside.

name: Open-Market Shark
description: A cousin of the Sickle-Hammerhead Shark, this animal is more ferocious and doesn't have a considerate fish-bone in its body. Catching an Open-Market Shark is the dream of every fisherman - or more precisely, catching one AND staying alive to tell the tale.

name: Kaliptus Wood
description: This scented wood can be used to build nice-smelling houses even if their owners stink. It's a pity it isn't supple enough to make underwear.

name: Second Sphincter Dungeon Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Retspan Pirate Tooth
description: Even the best Frigostian research scientists have failed to explain the usefulness of teeth for a ghost, especially a ghost tied to a mast. Perhaps it uses them to gnaw at the ropes?

name: Buck Anear's Bunch of Keys
description: While his men waited to share the loot contained in the Hesperus's chests, Buck Anear spent hours working out which key on this bunch went with which particular chest. His men, fed up of waiting, went off to do something else, which meant Buck Anear could keep everything for himself.

name: Amakna Castle Rat Dungeon Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Grozilla Dorsal Spine
description: Legend has it that Grozilla's front legs are so small because he's never been able to reached back to scratch his back without slicing a chunk off on his deadly dorsal spines. Really, though, they're just withered because he insists on killing his enemies by reducing them to ashes or swallowing them raw. All the same, this spine is mighty sharp.

name: Kwismas Nightmare Pattern
description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Kwismas Nightmare Set.

name: Oogie Betty's Braces
description: Sick of your reflection being ruined by your rotten teeth? Here's your chance to change your life! Pearly white smile and stray pieces of food getting stuck guaranteed.

name: Powa Drhell Horn
description: The Powa Drhell prefers to use its horns in combat than its tusks, which it saves for digging underground passageways. Don't bother taking a red flag with you when you fight it, as it really doesn't need any provocation at all to charge.

name: Biltong Carrion
description: The kind of meat that is favoured by jerks.

name: Weremoggy Claw
description: Each Weremoggy has its own way of slashing at its victims' back or intimate parts: its claw marks form its signature. The one you tore this trophy from may not be able to make any dedications for quite some time.

name: Aquamarine
description: This precious, slightly blue, transparent stone is so bright that it can hide the most ravine-like wrinkles when worn as a necklace. Pandawas even tell tourists: "With this stone, keep your man happy and watch with pity the ravages of time misshape your loved ones." A nice way to kill two birds with one stone!

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Leaf
description: This leaf feeds on the grey matter of the Royal Rainbow Blop. It's a good thing it's not too greedy!

name: Wreck of the Hesperus Key
description: Battered by the waves, this key smells of iodine and rotten seaweed, like a chain-smoking Enutrof who has let himself go. It is, however, the only way of entering the Wreck of the Hesperus.

name: Tunder Alloy
description: This Frigostian alloy was frozen solid in a barrel of beer when the curse struck. That explains why not even the best miners can craft it and only master jewellers can use it without cracking it.

name: Drheamer Claw
description: In your experience, this claw is hellishly sharp despite being small, and the Drheamers are far more belligerent than their name would suggest.

name: Perfidhius Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Drhellvina Tail
description: The Drhellvina's tail is almost as dangerous as its horns: when you're least expecting it, the Drhellvina will remind you that it fights just as well backwards as forwards.

name: Fragment of Zatoishwan's Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Zatoishwan's Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Zatoishwan's Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Zatoishwan's Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Zatoishwan's Map
description: This map will allow you to find Zatoishwan's legendary treasury.

name: First Sphincter Dungeon Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sphincter Cell Fabric
description: This fabric seems to be covered in a strange chemical... It definitely has side effects, but I really don't know what they are.

name: Sphincter Cell Femur
description: Sphincter was not kind to bones and would break them in two, three, four and sometimes even five pieces when he had to buck up his sleepy students.

name: Cheeken Plait
description: This thick and harsh hair can be used as a mop if not to hide your baldness. But you'll have to wash it many, many times before.

name: Solar Pebble
description: Please make sure nobody ever throws this pebble at your head. Not only will it leave a nasty bump; it could also give you sunburn.

name: Sphincter Cell Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Drhossil Tusk
description: The Drhossil's tusks are worth a small fortune on the Astrubian market. Some wise men say that they grant their owner a blessing from Enutrof himself.

name: Digshot Skin
description: Since Drhellers don't have ears, they need to be highly receptive to vibrations from all directions. The Digshot's skin has evolved specially for this purpose: as well as withstanding pressure during long underground journeys, it also allows the Digshot to distinguish certain sounds made by its fellows.

name: Cheeken Cloaca
description: No, it's not disgusting! It's nature!

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Flower
description: This flower was hidden in the cranial box of the Royal Rainbow Blop. It plugged up all the holes in the creature's memory.

name: Buck Anear Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Drheller Tooth
description: If you chewed on stones all day long, your teeth would be in bad condition too. The tooth fairy doesn't even stop by Enurado any more.

name: Drhossil Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Zatoishwan's Hairs
description: These hairs have a rather delicate odour, a subtle blend of Bamboo Milk liqueur and broiled fur.

name: Biltong Meat
description: Only traditional hunters know how to procure and pronounce this choice cut of meat.

name: Fragment of Zatoishwan's Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sickle-Hammerhead Shark
description: This blue shark is an activist with a strong herd instincts - there is no sense of the individual in their group even if their chief, Stakemoff, is idolised as a hero.

name: Sphincter Cell Skin
description: Who would have believed that one day you'd be holding the skin of the famous Sphincter Cell? Well, not Sphincter for sure. His over-confidence led him to his death.

name: Yuara Pirate Oil
description: Yuara Pirates always keep a little oil with them to ensure that their wheel rotates correctly, but end up drinking it in a misguided attempt to stop their heads rotating instead.

name: Yuara Pirate Shell
description: This shell protected the Yuara Pirate from sea spray and guano while it was sailing. Once back on dry land, the shell protects its delicate pupils from the black sandstorms of Alma's Cradle.

name: Retspan Pirate Mast
description: Ignorant people might think this is a Spinnaker pole or a bowsprit, while any Frigostian tell you that this is a vertical spar and therefore a mast.

name: Grozilla Ardent Bezoar
description: This magic bezoar, lodged in Grozilla's throat and burning eternally, is what enables him to spit fire. Lodged in your throat, you'll just cough your lungs out whilst running in circles and shrieking like a little sissy. Remember, wanting to be Grozilla won't make you Grozilla.

name: Sparkling Pebble
description: This pebble looks like your own bald pate decorated with mashed firefly. That's all you have in common with it, though, because the pebble is magic.

name: Mahogany Pebble
description: It's not the prettiest pebble out there, but for some reason it has certain citizens of Astrub - after a few drinks, admittedly - singing its praises as though it were some kind of god - and religion sells, dontcha know!

name: Sphincter Cell Ear
description: Big and hairy, this item boasts all the characteristics of a perfect ear.

name: Drhossil's Caves Key
description: Drills at the ready - the Drhossil is not going to be happy about sharing his gold mine!

name: Kaliptus Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Moopet Fabric
description: This fabric has a strange texture but it can be used to quickly dress any modest monster.

name: Moopet Stuffing
description: Nature having been only modestly generous to the Moopet, the creature has to resort to artifice to pass for a living thing. At times, he uses it to make his bed pass for a bed too.

name: Major Rocha
description: Whoever's closest is usually wrong. But not by a wrong shot.

name: Bliblirect Fabric
description: Contrary to its leather, a Bliblirect's Fabric has a smell that should never be sniffed. It could rouse a Sadida from hibernation.

name: Bliblycerin Hoof
description: Bliblycerin Hooves are generally covered with mud or dirt but sometimes with colourful Biblops, which is not that unusual. The Bliblycerin hates Biblops as much as you do.

name: Bliblirect Stomach
description: This stomach is big enough to hold many things. A heaven-sent opportunity for a Iop to sort its Swords out.

name: Bliblycerin Tusk
description: This Bliblycerin Tusk will you remind you how unpleasant this type of Bliblis is. Indeed, the tusk is as worn as a nibbling Wabbit Tooth, which probably means it's already skewered its fair share of adventurers.

name: Bliblido Leather
description: Despite its high quality, shoemakers refused to use this leather for many years. Customers thought it was fake because it has no smell! As they say, never judge a boot by its odour.

name: Bliblido Horn
description: Underneath its thick fur, the Bliblido has two lovely horns. To find a reason for their existence, wise men tried to study the habits of the female Bliblido, but without success.

name: Bliblitch Hairs
description: This type of hair is really disgusting. If you have a closer look at it, you'll discover a great microcosm of different parasites living on it… How lucky you are!

name: Bliblitch Leather Strap
description: This leather strap can replace your suspenders.

name: Royal Pingwin Feather
description: The Royal Pingwin is well respected by the inhabitants of Frigost, who, blinded by his noble title, think he's probably more important than he actually is, and don't hesitate to kill him as a result.

name: Karrybean Pirate Buoy
description: Some pirates can't swim and so they need a buoy. They may eventually beach on the black sand beaches of Alma's Cradle after floating around for several years. Once they're back on terra firma, they're generally thirsty for revenge. But since they can't take revenge on the sea, they take revenge on the weak, as well as tourists, or just simply weak tourists.

name: Karrybean Pirate Tail
description: It's difficult to call this a tail... It's more of a Karrybean Pirate extremity.

name: Talklyka Pirate Claw
description: Very handy for pinching the buttocks of its enemies or grabbing pickles stuck to the bottom of the jar, this claw is a Talklyka Pirate's pride and joy.

name: Talklyka Pirate Rope
description: It's difficult to say what purpose this rope could serve for a Talklyka Pirate, because everyone knows they haven't got a clue how to tie knots.

name: Great Oaf
description: Keep your distance.

name: Great Payo
description: There'll always be something to unite those who are worlds apart.

name: Great Kyoub
description: He who underestimates the resistance factor of projectiles when encountering air resistance probably won't make it through winter.

name: Major Zaihn
description: The eye of the cyclone is less dangerous than the cyclops' club.

name: Ebony Wood
description: This wood owes its name to a misunderstanding… A family of lumberjacks living in this forest had a daughter named Bonnie. Bonnie was the only one who knew where to find a rather special type of tree and so this wood was named after her: "Bonnie Wood". Time and poor spelling finally produced the name "Ebony Wood".

name: Soft Oak Bud
description: This huge bud of hot and syrupy sap should remind you of your baby's bottles if you dare suck its contents. Be careful you might turn into a dead leaf as a side effect.

name: Soft Oak Amber
description: This amber contains one of the Soft Oak's leaves, trapped for aeons in the sticky sap. This precious treasure is truly a collector's item, just like LeChouque's yellow and red polkadot socks.

name: Fouxwork Factory Key
description: When stuffed up the nose, this key will protect you from foot odour and stinky breath after a night of excessive imbibing at the inn.

name: Shihan Hair Stick
description: Certain pedants wonder if the Kozaru have hair or just long fur on their heads. This begs the question of whether these items should be called hair sticks or fur sticks.

name: Soft Oak Clearing Key
description: This key will grant you to access to the most intimate parts of the Soft Oak's anatomy... I bet you won't even know it when you get to the special place. As disturbing and exciting as the much loved Amaknian sport of naked Judo, this trip will not leave you empty handed, that's for sure.

name: Pingwin Key
description: This key contains high levels of asbestos and as a result floats very well on water and on salad dressing. You can also use it to enter the Royal Pingwin's excavation.

name: Royal Pingwin Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Critus
description: A critical mass of massive criticals.

name: Macerated Carrion
description: This meat is fresh from the butcher between the sewers and the waste water pond.

name: Hemp
description: The Hemp stem can be used for research into hallucinations but is also used in construction where it serves a very different purpose.

name: Fouxnamballist Hairs
description: This hair was ripped off the back of a horrible red creature.

name: Fangshu Spearhead
description: Experienced Fangshu use the tips of their spears like harpoons to jump on their enemies.

name: Kurookin Fabric
description: This scrap of fabric is waterproof and extremely durable. It's your best friend when the rain-and-wind apocalypse arrives. But everyone knows that such an apocalypse will never happen…

name: Wind Dojo Key
description: This key lets you enter the Wind Dojo. Be careful, though: it will be destroyed after use.

name: Tynril Amber
description: This amber is different from any other. If you close your eyes, shake it and dance the manic tango of Captain Chafer, you might feel it vibrate and glow as if a mysterious spirit inhabited it. To be honest though, you'll look like an idiot. A shiny, vibrating idiot.

name: Uchiwang Ribbon
description: If you see an Uchiwang tie a ribbon around her hair, you can bet she's just invented a new technique for tearing you apart.

name: Founoroshi Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Ginsengoku
description: This plant is particularly appreciated by Moon, who prefers it to the Citronana diet.

name: Captain Ebrous's Map
description: This map will take you to Captain Ebrous's treasure.

name: Soft Oak Root
description: Some people make beer with this kind of root. Given that the Soft Oak had no tolerance for the grog, it's very inadvisable.

name: Boombardier Hairs
description: These hairs come from a Boombardier, a terrible creature that looks quite puny but in reality has terrible magical powers.

name: Aerodynamic Pelt
description: The Kozaru can cut through the air effortlessly with this pelt.

name: Ino-Naru Bracelet
description: Certain unscrupulous people sell these bracelets by claiming that they bestow "insert random property" on anyone who wears them.

name: Peki Peki Hair
description: Who would have believed that a Peki Peki would accept to give away a bunch of hair just to please you? No one, besides Garlik Jorisk, famous doofus of Amakna, renowned for his dishonesty, and his pathological affection for stuffed Peki Pekis.

name: Lichangoro Broken Blade
description: Just like thorns and brambles can give you a nice prick after you've cut them down, this broken blade still cuts deep. Take care, there's plenty of fight left in it.

name: Magical Founoroshi Tail
description: This tail is so magic that it's still wagging, even after having been cut, dried and stuffed! If you're smart enough, you'll find another use for it that doesn't involve hanging it above your fireplace.

name: Tynril Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Lacerated Tynril Skin
description: This skin probably covered a sensitive area of the Tynril. Poor lad.

name: Forest Substrate
description: This concentrate is obtained after cooking various boards that have been marinated in dubious brine. Any resemblance to your grandmother's recipes is pure coincidence.

name: Tynril Calyx
description: This bouquet of sepals protects the Tynril flower from aggressive adventurers. Unfortunately, this time around they didn't prove very effective.

name: Monkfish
description: This dead fish has the same empty look as your grandfather.

name: Macerated Meat
description: You don't know where and how many times this meat has been macerated, and it's better that way. Trust us.

name: Kobalite
description: Kobalite is the most impressive alloy ever discovered. The ancient miners thought it was the perfect mixture until they realised it crumbled into dust when it came into contact with Gobball Slobber.

name: Soft Oak Bark
description: This bark is more resistant than others; strength emanates from it. But nothing proves it's not a fake painted Treechnid Bark. Now might be a good time to con a friend.

name: Firefoux Fabric
description: This red fabric has a magic power. I would be glad to say the same about you, but…

name: Hanshi Scarf
description: This scarf floats in the air constantly even when there's no wind. This significantly increases your charisma, except when it flaps into your eye or it catches on a branch.

name: Tynril Relic
description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

name: Tynril Lab Key
description: This strange key will enable you to enter the Tynril Lab in one piece.

name: Pandora Master Triquetral
description: The triquetral bone is the one that causes the most pain when the Pandora Master slaps you on the wrist.

name: Shihan and Hanshi Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Humonkfish
description: Due to its name, some Iops believe that this fish is a part human hybrid.

name: Etching Board
description: Don't confuse this with a retching board, which doesn't exist.

name: Bauxite
description: When properly tapered, this metal is much appreciated for its sharpness and unusual colour.

name: Soft Oak Wood
description: This wood has had a few close shaves with Brouce Boulgoure's Axe. It has also experienced many other mysterious and dangerous things that even the book of the Bwork Magus does not reveal. You have every reason to expect the worst.

name: Bangartifoux Hairs
description: This thick, stinky hair was ripped off the back of a horrible, red creature.

name: Gingerocket Skin
description: This smooth, fine skin offers excellent protection from the various magical attacks that the Gingerocket encounters when spells backfire.

name: Spitfoux Skin
description: In times gone by, people used this to make underwear for children with sensitive skin. Spitfoux skin underwear has been approved by Captain Chafer's descendants.

name: Peki Peki Fabric
description: This fabric used to cover up the Peki Peki's hairy behind until you rubbed it up the wrong way.

name: Tynril Pistil
description: Should a Sacrier be lucky enough to remove several of these sexual organs from the four Tynrils after a long, arduous fight, the rest of his teammates would be well within their rights to refer to them as "The Sac's Pistils". Whether they should or not is another matter altogether.

name: Frozen Heart
description: This heart doesn't need to be preserved in the fridge; it's already as cold as a Rattedaugue's insincere salutations. Since the disappearance of the Ice Cracklers, hearts like this one have been in great demand by Frigostian organ smugglers.

name: Soft Oak Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Tynril Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Fertile Ruby Fragment
description: This precious stone has been blessed by Silvosse, Master of Cuttings. Plant this in your garden and watch your lawn turn into a veritable jungle. If your dream is to have a large family, you can also keep it in your pocket.

name: Ginseng
description: The root of this plant is used as a panacea by the Kanniballs on Moon Island.

name: Ebony Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Ratter Pill
description: To stay in shape, the Ratter swallows vast quantities of these blue pills made by the disciples of Eltux.

name: Ratter Tail
description: Chinese whispers around the sewers are saying that a Ratter's caudal appendage is able to triple in size when rubbed up the right way. Given the way that the owner of this example was treated, it's hard to tell.

name: Summoning Branch Finger
description: This gnarled wooden finger looks like the middle one that the Summoning Branch raised in your general direction right before meeting its maker.

name: Summoning Branch Eye
description: This eye is capable of looking deep into your very soul and reading you like an open book. Both literally and figuratively.

name: Healing Branch Leaf
description: This leaf is as soft as an Eniripsa's hands. It's unfortunate that its odour is more like that of a retired Foggernaut's diving suit.

name: Healing Branch Eye
description: This eye can make an excellent lure for Neyes if held out at arm's length in the Evil Forest.

name: Dark Treeckler Seed
