description: With a lot of patience, time, water and fertiliser, you might manage to grow a Treeckler in your garden so that you can practise fighting against him. It would be easier to just catch a boat to Otomai Island…

name: Dark Treeckler's Achilles' Heel
description: You won't defeat the Dark Treeckler by shooting an arrow in his Achilles' heel. But you can always try…

name: Great Domo
description: Generally speaking, spreading out is a horrible tactic. It's almost as bad as sticking together.

name: Dark Pikoko Nut
description: There's no milk inside this Pikoko Nut, just brain juice. If you're lucky, you might find a few neurons floating on the surface.

name: Major Sak
description: Whatever doesn't eat you makes you stronger.

name: Dark Pikoko Tonsils
description: The Dark Pikoko is not as nuts once he's got his tonsils removed. Well, this is no surprise since the surgery usually kills him.

name: Floramor Stamen
description: The stamen is the male organ of a plant. Yep! Despite appearances, it seems that Floramor is a male…

name: Kanigloo Ear
description: This ear reminds you of one of the favourite songs of young Frigostians: "Kanigloo gloo gloo, Greedoblop blop blop tadada tzum tzum". There aren't many lyrics, sure, but that way a Iop can just about memorise it.

name: Ancestor Potion
description: This drink has as much character as a good beer, and your grandfather.

name: Great Yosh
description: …then I took an arrow to the heart.

name: Kung-Fu Pingwin Tail
description: Don't be fooled by its modest size - it knows exactly where it's going.

name: Kanigloo Fabric
description: This fabric reminds you of the second verse of one of the favourite songs of young Frigostians: "Frighog hog hog...". Unfortunately, you don't remember the rest of the words.

name: Floramor Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Kung-Fu Pingwin Ear
description: Usually hidden by a decaying fish, the ears of the Kung-Fu Pingwin hear one thing, the calls of available partners during mating season. So you're free to make fun of Kung-Fu Pingwins in perfect safety as long as you don't look like a potential partner.

name: Royal Pingwin Egg
description: Don't pretend you don't know exactly which hole this enormous egg came out of.

name: Short-Tempered Treechnee Leg
description: This Dark Treechnee was so grumpy you didn't mind leaving him without a leg to stand on.

name: Barkritter Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Barkritter Calyx
description: Don't bother trying to use the Barkritter Calyx to drink anything. It might resemble a cup, but it's about as solid as a sieve.

name: Packrat Eye
description: After gazing longingly at the sinewy muscles of Strodents, this Packrat's eye detached from its socket. The same could happen to you if you're not careful.

name: Short-Tempered Treechnee Mandible
description: If coated in Snailmet slime, this mandible can be an effective weapon against Moskitos.

name: Rotaflor Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Rotaflor Carpel
description: A little biology lesson: the flowers are the plants' sexual organs and the pistil is part of the flower while the carpel is part of the pistil... I'll let you decide what does what.

name: Great Petunia
description: The harder you are, the bigger you fall.

name: Gwass Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Gwass Sepal
description: This part of the Gwass' body is always green, no matter what. Is it due to some excess of chlorophyll or to something else?

name: Major Teleb
description: Keep your friends far away and your enemies even further.

name: Warguerite Bark
description: This bark is curiously curved. It looks like it's been through a rasp.

name: Warguerite Bract
description: The Warguerite bract refers to an area that decency prevents me from uttering.

name: Blue Ray
description: The Blue Ray rules the sea bed in which, for some mysterious reason, it digs tiny holes all day long. Every once in a while, it returns to the surface. Sometimes long enough for you to catch it.

name: Shinobuubusu Mask
description: This mask enchanted by Earth magic lets Shinobuubusus turn into terrifying golems.

name: Tanukouï San Hair
description: This Tanukouï San hair stinks but who cares?! It's hair from a Tanukouï San!

name: Kwapa Coveralls
description: These coveralls are a very functional piece of clothing. Oddly, however, these don't come in XXL and so they rarely cover all.

name: Frighog Pierced Ear
description: A Frighog's ears are pierced all over. Is this because they like piercings, or is it because Jon Lemon's songs can even be heard on Frigost too?

name: Cross Strich's Aviary Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Cross Strich Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Millimaster Scarf
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mastigator's Map
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mastigator's Egg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Marbled Meat
description: You know the phrase about somebody losing their marbles? Well, you’ll find them all again in this dodgy sirloin. As well as the person who lost them.

name: Marbled Carrion
description: More veins than an old Enutrof’s leg, and tastes almost as bad.

name: Saguaro Whiskers
description: These whiskers are truly classy. You could wear more of them, but your case seems hopeless.

name: Cucumber
description: It is very hard to explain just what cucumbers are and what they're used for. Mainly because how they're used depends on the context.

name: Kwapa Water
description: Kwapa water isn't very different from the water you drink every day, but crafters continue to believe that it's needed to make many different items.

name: Tatatojiki's Broken Pottery
description: You destroyed this piece of pottery but unfortunately it didn't contain any rubies.

name: Kwamurai Katana
description: Katana is a very big word to describe such a tiny wisp of a thing that can barely cut anything. At the same time, the Kwamurai are very pale imitations of samurai. They seem more like children waving twigs than real swordsmen. Good riddance!

name: Titinuki Wand
description: It's difficult to say which – this wand or your face – most offended the massive Titinuki from whom you managed to steal it.

name: Parashutackle Glasses
description: These glasses are too small for your face, but if you want to amuse those around you, they'll fit your family jewels nicely.

name: Nagate Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Tanukouï San Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Pair of Cross Strich Balls
description: The Cross Strich probably has the biggest pair of balls in the world. Frustrated at being so clearly outdone, some adventurers don't think twice about snipping them off and slipping them into their own trousers. Really! It's insane what some people will do just to make themselves look important.

name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Panthyrozy's Perfume
description: Panthyrozy the thief leaves no trace but this perfume at the scenes of her crimes: a scent every bit as bewitching and deadly as its owner.

name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 4/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Short-Tempered Dark Treechnid Amber
description: This precious stone will not fit on your finger nor make you invisible. But you can call it 'my precious' if you want.

name: Castuc Juice
description: By squeezing enough Castucs, a juice comes out of them which is particularly sweet and refreshing.

name: Levito Maraca
description: Don't let go of these maracas, because seeing as they're lighter than air, they'll fly off straight away, and you'll never see them again.

name: Cactana Scroll
description: It's often wondered what's contained within Cactana's scrolls. Now you have them, the mystery's solved. It's actually a recipe, made using Spice. It's sadly inedible for non-Castucs.

name: Castupod Flower
description: Don't sniff this flower too closely, otherwise you'll find yourself with a lovely flower-style nose piercing. Not very threatening, is it?

name: El Piko Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Chocopingwin Stomach
description: This stomach is renowned for its light, fresh mousse.

name: Tanukouï San Skin
description: This thick, stretched Tanukouï San skin would make a perfect purse for your kamas.

name: Magic Tanuki Hairs
description: Tanukis reputedly bring good luck and fortune. These hairs, which you ever so gently borrowed, will make an excellent good luck charm.

name: Valley of the Lady of the Water Key
description: This key lets you adventure into the Valley of the Lady of the Water, a mysterious valley at the edge of Akwadala. Please note: bathing is strongly discouraged in this beautiful place.

name: Tanukouï San Testicles
description: These enormous testicles are covered with a very soft down which works wonders in resisting magic attacks as well as the damage the Tanukouï San causes himself when summoning a Tanuki Chan. In any case, what you're holding in your hands is something really very special!

name: Frighog Baleful Eye
description: You killed a Frighog, and just before shuffling off this mortal coil and joining the sanctuary of other Frighogs killed in action, it gave you one last look of such ferocity that your blood ran cold. As if it wasn't cold enough already on Frigost.

name: Short-Tempered Dark Treechnid Bud
description: These buds will nip you in the bud!

name: Cross Strich Egg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Elsumo Pants
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Short-Tempered Arachnotron Broken Mask
description: Instead of giving him a break, you broke his mask, which will do nothing for his mood, to say the least.

name: Squashed Short-Tempered Arachnee
description: This is what happens when you have a quick temper but you're not quick enough. If only it had been crabby, it might have stood a chance with a shell.

name: Hazel Wood
description: It seems that Akornaddikt built himself a decadent palace with these boards… Can you believe it? It also seems that you'll believe anything.

name: Ultram
description: For the first time ever, all your enemies want to be in your shoes.

name: El Spiko
description: Each of these tips has its own moustache, and is far more classy than you.

name: Crunchy Bar
description: This bar is a basic component in the Crunchler set.

name: Chocolate Fur
description: For little and big kids aged 7 to 77, our chocolate Bearbarian furs please everyone. And if all the little Marshmallow Bearbarians held hands, they could stretch five times around the World of Twelve!

name: Tanukouï San's Workshop Key
description: This key lets you enter Tanukouï San's Workshop. Be careful, though: it will be destroyed after use.

name: Shaman Pingwin Giant Fishbone
description: There are plenty of questions about Frigost that don't have answers, and, more worryingly, plenty of answers that don't have questions. You will never know where the Shaman Pingwin found this giant fishbone.

name: Zoth Pipe
description: There's no better way to steady your nerves than by taking a puff or two from a peace pipe such as this one. An old legend says that the clouds that float in the sky were actually created by the accumulation of smoke from the Zoth Village.

name: Totankama's Tablet
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 5/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Sramurai Bone
description: Some hide their knives in their sleeves, some in their boots. As for Sramurais, they've found a unique solution for hiding their blades: their bones.

name: Key to Captain Scarlight's Ring
description: If you feel like a Rassler at heart, Captain Scarlight is waiting for you in his ring. Be careful though, he's not faking it, and you shouldn't either.

name: Rusty Hook
description: Although you could use it as it is, this hook is far more useful for making Lockpicks.

name: Fragment of Mastigator's Map 2/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Crunchery Key
description: Tempting as it may be, don't eat this key. Use it to enter the Crunchery instead.

name: Yazkooalak Ear
description: The apparent softness of these ears has tricked many an adventurer before you. Tempting as it may be, we don't recommend using them as earmuffs. They lose all resistance to heat if not attached to their owner.

name: Nibbled Nugget
description: The Chocruncher from which you managed to take this piece still managed to bite it before dying. Animal instincts can be odd at times.

name: Chocosnailmet Coating
description:
Chocosnailmet recipe (Warning: the presence of a responsible adult is highly advisable.):
- Take one Snailmet
- Dip it in oil
- Dip it in water
- Cover with cocoa
- Now you have a Chocosnailmet ready to go!

name: Kwakao Beak
description: Tempestuous and anger-prone, Kwakaos are not the most easygoing birds in the World of Twelve. It's all due to their high cocoa content. Stories abound about hungry adventurers crunching down on a Chocruncher only to be crunched by a crunching Chocruncher.

name: Farle's Ray
description: Farle Ingalsse personally discovered this particular species of ray during one of his great adventures. Apparently it has the ability to enchant fish with its deep, southern voice and rhythmic train-like beating of its tail.

name: Bamboo Blowgun
description: This item is a sort of hollow tube that shoots small projectiles when you blow into it. Kind of like a blowgun, only made out of bamboo.

name: Ishibig Pak Rocky Fist
description: One can reasonably wonder how stone gloves can be articulated. They aren't really, but become articulated in the hands of Ishibig Paks and their stupefying Rock magic.

name: Akakwa Akapants
description: These pants are red, of course. Not blue. What am I saying? They're not vulgar underpants, they're a true work of art! You could even call them a masterpants! Get it? Masterpiece, masterpants… Don't worry… That joke will get funnier every time you (don't) hear it.

name: Nagate's Rubber Quaquack
description:
The Lady of the Water is a huge fan of the rubber Quaquack method. Have your plans to capture small children all come up empty? Telling your Quaquack all your troubles could help you figure out where you've been going wrong!
That said, holding this duck in your hands isn't a sure sign that the method will work.

name: Shaman Pingwin Beard Hair
description: The Shaman Pingwin's Beard smells of fish and goat musk. This potent mix is used by the bravest inhabitants of Frigost as a Mastogob repellent.

name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 1/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Totankama's Tablet Fragment 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Malitiamen Insignia
description: Srambad inhabitants had developed the ability to recognize Malitiamen by their characteristic odour, but since all the adventurers came, it's become much harder to smell the difference. So an insignia was created to ease the confusion a bit.

name: Captain Scarlight's Heart
description: There are those who doubt that Captain Scarlight has a heart, and even this doesn't necessarily prove them wrong. Even his heart is mocking you.

name: Kartridge Bag
description: The Kartridges keep their ammunition in this bag. And they keep such large ammunition, and in such great amounts, that they can use their bag as a deadly bludgeon.

name: Blundergus Bandage
description: Blunderguses are covered in bandages, but they're not Xelors. The best proof is their size.

name: Lockpick
description: This simple Lockpick is a formidable tool in the hands of a capable burglar.

name: Fragment of Panthyrozy's Map 3/5
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Panthyrozy's Map
description: This map will allow you to find Panthyrozy's legendary treasure.

name: Hazel Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Pampastuc G-String
description: This beautiful g-string would suit you perfectly. Be sure not to put it on backwards, or you'll have to say goodbye to your tackle.

name: El Piko Golden Star
description: This star would be perfect at the top of a Kwismas tree.

name: Crunchler Heart
description: Despite its unappealing and inaccessible appearance, this mountain of chocolate hides a tender, tasty heart that will delight lovers of fine chocolate.

name: Major Boble
description: You can't taste a Dofus without breaking the shell.

name: Corrode
description: Little Tofus fell great oaks.

name: Zoth Abacus
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Great Nyoro
description: It's said that it can hypnotize, but no one's really clear how or why it would do that.

name: Royal Mastogob Tail
description: The Royal Mastogob uses his tail to shoo away Moskitos during the summer months. It's completely useless for the rest of the year though, and sometimes he even forgets it's there.

name: Royal Mastogob Wool
description: No one can say exactly when Mastogobs first arrived on Frigost. What is certain is that they've been there a long time, because certain Frigostian households still pass down Royal Mastogob Wool underwear from generation to generation, and there are several examples that date back centuries.

name: Mama Pingwin Down
description: Everyone on Frigost loves to stuff their underwear with Mama Pingwin down. Some people say they do it to keep warm, but only a Iop would believe that.

name: Second Fire Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

name: Third Water Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

name: Mature Smoke
description: Smoking kills, and this Sauroshell's paying the price.

name: Second Earth Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

name: Third Earth Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

name: Fourth Air Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

name: Major Dagob
description: When well the battle goes, happen the worst does not.

name: Mama Pingwin Oil
description: This oil was extracted from a Mama Pingwin. It will take you a very long time to wipe the memory of how exactly you extracted it from your scarred mind.

name: Woolly Piggoth Tusk
description: This tusk smells like someone's underpants. Not yours, though.

name: Woolly Piggoth Leather
description: A Woolly Piggoth's skin pads its angular bones quite nicely, meaning it stays festively plump all year round.

name: First Fire Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

name: First Water Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

name: Second Water Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

name: Mature Ashes
description:
What's small, black, covered in soot and smells of sulphur?
The Mature Ashes of the Incandescent Sauroshell! Although, the answer 'Zeurg' would also be accepted.

name: Sauroshell Shell
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Roachelf's Antennae
description: These antennae are highly sought-after by fishermen, perhaps because they start vibrating whenever there's phishing to be done. It's probably not a good idea to wear them at the Astrub, Amakna Village and Frigost Village Zaaps.

name: Third Fire Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

name: Fourth Fire Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Firestone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Fire Fragments.

name: First Earth Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

name: Fourth Earth Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Earthstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Earth Fragments.

name: First Air Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

name: Mature Puddle
description: Cras really love water. It rains down on them and makes them laugh.

name: Fourth Water Fragment
description: You'll obtain a Waterstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Water Fragments.

name: Second Air Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

name: Third Air Fragment
description: You'll obtain an Airstone if you crush this Fragment with the three other Air Fragments.

name: Mature Mud
description: Adventurers who want to hold off resorting to cosmetic surgery often cover themselves in this mud to prevent wrinkles. They forget, however, that this hardly makes them any more beautiful.

name: Mature Powder
description: Ecaflip women of a certain age use this powder to cover their greying fur. Unfortunately, their ruse is quickly uncovered when their potential one night stand rubs them up the wrong way.

name: Minokid Horn
description: Seen in the personals section of the Daily Maze: "LOST: one horn after a dishonest fight with a belligerent adventurer. Whoever finds it will be rewarded with a free go with my sceptre and a guided tour of the labyrinth."

name: Quetsnakiatl Feather
description: The ancients say this feather used to be covered with magic stone dust which made one unit of Quetsnakiatl feather be heavier than three units of Tofu feathers. It seems that these days, however, the Quetsnakiatl have rid themselves of the excess weight.

name: Minokid Hair
description: This hair seems to be covered with short-haired-Tuftie-musk based brylcreem and cave Kirball grease. It almost looks appetising.

name: Quetsnakiatl Stone
description: Not big fans of feathers, Crackler dancers prefer sporting Quetsnakiatl Stones.

name: Penitent
description: Only a penitent man shall pass.

name: Stretch Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Stretch Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Precious Zoth Stone
description: This stone is responsible for sharpening the Zoth Warriors' wits and axes.

name: Great Dynamo
description: Better hope you can hit a moving target…

name: Watchamatrich Tongue
description: This tongue is paradise for bacteria, which multiply in its valleys and ridges faster than Cras and Sadidas do in the Astrub Forest.

name: Watchamatrich Rump
description: The Watchamatrich is loved by physics and chemistry teachers alike for its incredible ability to pass waste in all three states (solid, liquid and gas) simultaneously.

name: Kittenperch
description: With the hideousness of its father and the savagery of its mother, this fish is the most difficult of all to catch. It's the rarest of its kind, too. Indeed, the mating of a Kittenfish with a Perch was once described by a famous statesman as "Grotesque, unbelievable, bizarre and unprecedented." The phrase GUBU has since been coined to describe such scandalous events.

name: Broken Royal Tofu Crown
description: This crown was either broken by a powerful magic attack or by that last headbutt the Royal Tofu tried to give you.

name: Royal Tofu Feather
description: You'd have to be a lop not to realise that this feather comes from the backside of a Royal Tofu. You'd have to be an Osamodas to want to touch it.

name: Minotoror Tail
description: It's a miracle to see a Minotoror's tail without the Minotoror itself attached. The poor thing must be looking everywhere for it. Unless it is not really aware of the situation, which is possible too.

name: Skeunk's Hideout Key
description: Rigroulak gave you this key in exchange for the Koolich set... Unless it's just a cheap replica crafted by a common-as-muck handyman. Either way, it should enable you to enter Skeunk's Hideout.

name: Dragandrop Hide
description: This dark hide is covered with a multitude of small scales that supposedly improve the Dragandrop's aerodynamics. In reality, however, they're just for show.

name: Dragmatic Horn
description: When the Dragmatic has a touch of lava reflux, its horn lights up. If you see that happen, get out of there immediately.

name: Crocabulia Skin
description: You could use this red skin to make a Little Red Waddling Cape, but your tailor would be very confused. "This recipe has produced nothing!" they would cry, somewhat awkwardly.

name: Vibrating Royal Tofu Feather
description: More royal than the Royal Tofu feather, more vibrating than the Vibrating Kirball of the Kruup mines, this feather will tickle whoever you want, wherever you want. The instructions say that it should be easy to look after.

name: Skeunk Hair
description: Skeunk thinks nothing of a full body-shave. Here's the proof.

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Lair Key
description: This key grants you access to the Rainbow Blop Dungeon.

name: Pingwobble Wing
description: Frigostians have often wondered what purpose these ridiculous wings could serve. After all, a Pingwobble could never possibly hope to take off.

name: Sabredon Hair
description: Sabredon Hair was once used to stuff quilts - which certain Frigostians of dubious personal hygiene could then use as an excuse to mask their polecat stench.

name: Lord Crow Down
description: This eiderdown duvet allows the Master to keep warm, even if it is as cold as ice in his library.

name: Diamondine's Damaged Boomerang
description: This boomerang is in as pathetic a state as Brakmar's expansionist policy, which is exactly why Diamondine got rid of it.

name: Trubout Mite
description: This little parasite has shown no sign of life since it was plucked off a Trubout's corpse. Be careful, though, as once it finds itself in a warm, smelly, humid place, it's bound to wake up and invite its extended family to live with it too.

name: Segmantid Pixel
description: This pixel only appears when you've wrestled a Segmantid to the ground, and is proof that it is no longer in a fit state to fight.

name: Fraktal's Megalith Key
description: Getting out of Fraktal's Megalith in one piece is quite an accomplishment. Make sure you prepare properly before going in… Some strong glue to hold your limbs in place should be fine.

name: Tri Pandkin
description: This plant is used to reduce taste and lighten the odour of Lousy Pig tripe.

name: Silver
description: Silver is bright, pure and much-coveted by discerning jewellers. Contrary to the myth spread round by the unscrupulous Miners' Association, it has no particular effect on vampires. Unless they're miserly vampires… Or artistic vampires… Do vampires make jewellery? It doesn't… say… here… Anyway, if it's a really nasty vampire who's only out for blood, who has a good job… damn. Do vampires work?… Look, just sell the "bloody" thing or something.

name: Minotoror Hair
description: This hair smells very bad but is very resistant. Wearing a material made of Minotoror hair will make a fearsome combatant of you… much appreciated by flies, on top of that.

name: Burnt Minotoror Horn
description: A very powerful incantation has scorched this Minotoror Horn, which makes it a much sought-after magical artefact. Unfortunately, like many things, they only work correctly in pairs.

name: Dark Vlad's Epaulette
description: This epaulette has survived many long battles... It's stronger than it looks. It'll make you think twice about hitting Dark Vlad on the shoulder if you're attached to your weapon at the time.

name: Minotoror Wool
description: This exceptional wool has experienced some bone-chilling moments, like the terrible encounter with Vlad. Its hairs are so thick that they can protect you from even the most deceitful blows.

name: Minotoror Leather
description: This leather is as resistant as Brakmar's fortifications. Its intrinsic qualities lend themselves to the making of high quality items.

name: Pandkin Seed
description: This humongous seed is filled with a heavy but magical oil. Its shell is said to be unbreakable and many craftsmen use it to enchant their weapons. Others stick wiggly eyes on it and put it on the dashboard of their cart.

name: Dragostess Skin
description: Smooth and perfumed with young adventurers' blood, this skin makes Dragostesses irresistible. Used to make boots or belts, this skin can be washed in a washing machine at any temperature.

name: Crocabulia Tooth
description: This huge tooth was pulled out at the very last minute, right before Crocabulia closed her mouth for the very last time.

name: Zoth Girl's Handkerchief
description: The Zoth girl does not use this handkerchief to wipe away her tears but to clean off her enemies' blood.

name: Royal Tofu Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Crocabulia Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Trubout Feather
description: This feather had already been steeped in the blood of dozens of victims when it was yanked out of its Trubout's Rump. Served it right!

name: Malt
description: The name given to germinated Barley, the most important ingredient in quality beer. Be careful with Malt, it has an enormous capacity for absorbing beer in its germination phase... just like Tot after a hard day hunting Tofus.

name: Minotoror Femur
description: This bone is sturdy enough to be used as a girder or to break bricks, ten at a time. It comes in handy if you want to destroy your neighbour's house. Useless for people of sound mind.

name: Key to Crocabulia's Lair
description: This key will let you enter the lair of the Dreggons' protector. Take care not to end up char-broiled, as being reborn from your ashes is not something just anyone can do.

name: Zoth Warrior Shinbone
description: Just like all the other bones of the Zoth Warrior, this shinbone has been broken many times. It healed perfectly and became even stronger. If it could talk it would say: "What doesn't kill you, makes you stronger."

name: Royal Mastogob's Greenhouse Key
description: Use this key to enter the greenhouse where the Royal Mastogob hides.

name: Pingwobble Skin
description: It's very oily, isn't washed very often, and it shines. Nope, I'm not talking about your wig, but this Pingwobble Skin.

name: Sapphira's Hairpin
description: This hairpin is the only hair accessory that supports the weight of Sapphira's barnet. You find it has a better use as a tool for pinning down the most ferocious opponents.

name: Tuft of Ruby's Hair
description: We're not entirely sure which part of Ruby's body these tufts come from, nor how they were detached. What we do know, however, is that they smell of sea salt, despite the sea being far, far away from Koalak Mountain!

name: Emeralda's Diary
description: This diary reveals the unsuspected secrets of Emeralda's life that would make even Mitomiel, the Meridia of Shamelessness, pale with jealousy.

name: Ruby's Reminder
description: Ruby uses this reminder to jog her memory. She often forgets her name and is forced to repeat "Ruby, Ruby, Ruby, Rubyyyy".

name: Wewe-Wabbit Blood
description: This blood changes colour according to the cycles of the moon. In other words, it's a nightmare for scatter-brained alchemists.

name: Minotoror Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Xelomorph Symbol
description: Looking at this symbol really makes your mouth water. Waiter! The menu, please!

name: Husse Malt
description: The beer brewed from this malt helps its drinker see good from bad: drinking it in moderation is good - drinking too much makes for a bad time the next morning.

name: Pastry Board
description: Since many "gourmands" have developed the strange habit of licking this board and getting splinters in their tongues, a law was created that expressly forbids seeking compensation for any injury caused by this board.

name: Bloody Meat
description: You could almost believe this to be the remains of a Sacrier, but a closer examination will remove any further doubts. It is the remains of a Sacrier.

name: New Leaf Orb
description: This orb lets you reset an item’s characteristics if you use it during a Smithmagic session.

name: Cherry Wood
description: This type of wood is appreciated in the cabinet-making trade because of its dense texture and the brown-reddish colour it acquires with time.

name: Kristalite
description: This magic stone with a particular name is not suitable for general public as it can give great powers to weapons and jewels.

name: Guildalogem
description: This rare stone will give you the influence you need to create a guild. Without it, guilds such as Miners With Attitude and the Men Who Stare at Gobs would never have come into being.

name: Perch
description: This fish doesn't look like much but it is the slyest and quickest of its kind. It's worth a try though. Its matchless taste and unique flavour will be ample reward for your efforts.

name: Minotoror Hoof
description: It must have crushed many adventurers with this hoof. Depending on where you're standing, the beast now looks either ridiculous or extremely dangerous as it hops about on one hoof.

name: Protective Dreggon Tooth
description: Protective Dreggons' teeth are extremely sharp, so sharp the slightest touch can leave a gaping wound.

name: Dragnnoyed Horn
description: The Dragnnoyed uses this horn as an aiming device to help him hit his targets when he drinks and flies.

name: Dragnarok Hide
description: Tough enough to resist its own blade, Dragnarok hide is also renowned for being edible… provided you boil it for several years first.

name: Zoth Disciple's Kneecap
description: Since the Zoth Disciple always attacks with his knees, the kneecaps became extremely large and tough. I know tortoises who'd trade their shells for one of these things.

name: Emeralda's Skeunk Autograph
description: If you give this powerful artefact to a female Sadida, something rather strange will happen: she'll swallow a name change potion and start calling herself Emeralda. If you give it to a male Sadida, its effects are stranger still, because he'll swallow a sex change potion instead.

name: Diamondine's Concert Ticket
description: This ticket for Skeunk's first ever concert has expired. Now you finally have the ideal excuse to drown your sorrows in a barrel of Bamboo Milk.

name: Oni Leather
description: In days gone by, the Onis haunted the Mystified Forest, where they would torment adventurers by telling them the opposite of what they actually meant. After the big freeze, they all but disappeared, which is why this leather has become so rare.

name: Royal Rainbow Blop Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Brikablak Pixel
description: Brikablaks can get hold of just about anything for you… Well, so long as it's rectangular and black all over.

name: Smashlete Pixel
description: Smashletes aren't the friendliest of the Xelomorphs, but they do have some undeniable talents, such as beating absolutely anyone in a footrace (...despite not having feet).

name: Fraktal Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Undergrowth Substrate
description: The side effects of this substrate include making really lame jokes about its name.

name: Bloody Carrion
description: Vampires go crazy for this meat, so it's time you stopped wearing it as a fetching necklace.

name: Kriptonite
description: This remarkable Alloy was pulled out of the ground far from here. Use it to decorate the fireplace or, if you wish, to hit a Iop over the head.

name: Labyrinth of the Minotoror Key
description: This wonderful key will allow you to get into the Inner Labyrinth of the Minotoror. It won't help you get out again, though.

name: Secret Royal Tofu House Key
description: This key will grant you access to the Royal Tofu House. You'll get the thrashing of your life there too.

name: Dragandrop Wing
description: Even when his wing is damaged, torn and burnt, the Flying Dreggon can still fly freely above the void like a young, carefree Moskito.

name: Crocabulia's Broken Horn
description: Crocabulia broke her horn in a terrible fight while protecting the egg from which Crocoburio hatched some 15 years later.

name: Skeunk Skin
description: This piece of skin probably comes from Skeunk's heels which can explain its nice yellowish colour. Though this old skin won't enable you to make fashionable clothes, you'll still be able to create "retro" ones that younger generations will love.

name: Zoth Master's Fly
description: The Zoth Master's fly is outstanding. It's been specially designed not to cut you. Any adventurers who have ever been traumatised by their flies will understand.

name: Zoth Sergeant's Insignia
description: This embroidered insignia is more of a childhood memory than a military insignia.

name: Sabredon Tooth
description: A very serious, progressive scientific study has shown that the teeth of the Sabredon were the very first cause of perforated buttock amongst the Frigostian population.

name: Sapphira's Kaliptus Shampoo
description: This shampoo gives a particular shine to Sapphira's hair, and even a particular odour.

name: Cawwotman Leaves
description: You may well ask yourself how a living Cawwot manages to survive in a land filled with Wabbits. Perhaps the Wabbits from the Abandoned Labowatowies don't like Cawwots. Perhaps Cawwotmen aren't edible. Nibbling on these leaves might bring you all the answers... but you don't feel brave enough. Where's that dim-witted friend of yours?

name: Glo Wabbit Ears
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Vampiwe Wabbit Teeth
description: These teeth are pointier than the other Wabbits'. And that means… Yes! Their owner must feed on something other than cawwots. You genius, you.

name: Janus Wabbit Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Twansgenic Cawwot
description: Biting into this Cawwot will bring about some surprising effects. If you're scared by the very thought of it, just remember that all your childhood heroes were born in puddles of radioactive waste and genetic laboratories.

name: Royal Mastogob Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Skeunk Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Fraktal Pixel
description: Fraktal is still watching you through this pixel.

name: Bigbit Pixel
description: Never tell Bigbit he's fat. Try "cuddly" or "bubbly" to cushion the blow.

name: Elfacet Pixel
description: Don't let their childlike appearance fool you: Elfacets are the most mischievous of all the Xelomorphs.

name: Hoskar
description: If the enemy is in range, so are you.

name: Cherry Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Patrich Glands
description: Holistic doctors use these glands to make invigorating ointments whose immediate effects include toning the skin, firming up the muscles and triggering testosterone overproduction. The perfect gift for your father-in-law – maybe that way your mother-in-law will finally fall for him.

name: Patrich Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Venerable Mastogob Wool
description: It's dirty, but venerable. Kinda reminds you of someone.

name: Podgy Tofu Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Atrophied Podgy Tofu Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Stricheetru Fluff
description: This fluff is softer than your grandmother's stubble and is completely hypoallergenic, so it won't irritate your skin when you rub your cheeks against it.

name: Stricheetru Beak
description: Stricheetrus are fond of earthworms and opera singing. Using their pointy beaks, they can pierce the flesh of their still-conscious prey in order to dig around in their entrails. And the baby ones are so cute!

name: Venerable Mastogob Tail
description: This hairy little tail was well hidden under the Venerable Mastogob's thick wool. That didn't stop you from finding it and pulling it off, though, did it?

name: Zoth Girl's Toy
description: What kind of Iop brain would let a child play with a toy like this?

name: Major Pikmi
description: You can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

name: Fattrool
description: You can use this thick and nutritious grease to cook most types of food in old pots without ruining the dish. Some Osamodas also use it to slip Tofus into places that the Iop moral code condemns.

name: Troofle
description: This is the original recipe for Troofle; the Bworks' industrial version is nothing but a poor copy, with its comparatively bland flavour and insipid smell. In plain English, it stinks for kilokametres around, and a single drop could fertilise the Cania Fields for a month.

name: Troolewd Hair
description: Under its clothes, the Troolewd hides a very soft down that would make the most coquettish of princesses jealous.

name: Furious Trool Wool
description: This piece of wool comes from the most dangerous Trool of Amakna who, apparently, has been transformed into a bedspread by an unscrupulous tailor, the same tailor who, if you believe what is publicly rumoured, has once exchanged his wife for a magic thimble. It's a mystery.

name: Troolaraj Mane
description: A mane of hair like this one is hard to find. Rich Enutrofs use it as hair replacement.

name: Trooligark Epaulette
description: This is the best way to admire this epaulette. The worst would be still attached to the Trool's shoulder. Now you can go on parade!

name: Tofubine Feather
description: The Tofubine was so busy cavorting with the Royal Tofu that she dropped a few feathers, which you were quick to pick up.

name: Trool Bone
description: If we consider the weight and solidity of a Trool bone, it's easy to understand why it hurts so bad when they smack you during Trool-playing games.

name: Pingwinkle Beak
description: When it's not planted firmly in the jaw of the Pingwinkle, this beak can be found planted firmly in your backside.

name: Cromagmunk Tail
description: Cromagmunks use their tails to balance when they're rolling their acorns along the floor. Cromagmunks seem impervious to ridicule.

name: Cromagmunk Acorn
description: Cromagmunks spend the first few years of their lives looking for the best acorn possible. They spend the rest of their lives trying to remember where they've hidden it.

name: Pingwinkle Feather
description: In olden times, Pingwinkles only used to visit Frigost's shores for a few days during the winter, but now the island has frozen over completely, they've decided to stay - which is as good an excuse as any to steal their feathers all year round.

name: Major Horiz
description: When the wiseman points to the horizon, the idiot looks at his finger, and the monster eats the finger. The idiot survives, the wiseman is down a finger, and the monster is hopefully sated.

name: Troolaraj Briefs
description: Judging by the state of these briefs, the Trool wasn't careful about where it sat. You can also estimate the age of its owner. By smell, of course...

name: Tofubine Egg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Trool Bracelet of Strength
description: As if a Trool needed a Strength Bracelet! This incredible bone-grinding machine wears one bracelet on each wrist.

name: Koalak Master Boomerang
description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

name: Reapalak Fabric
description: This fabric smells like death, whereas you smell as if you were dead. The difference is worth noting.

name: Deminoball Leather
description: This rough, cracked leather will remind you of your beloved's cheeks.

name: Adventurer Skull
description: According to the Reapalaks, Adventurer Skulls are better than Kaliptus Wood in two ways: they can be harvested all year long without causing deforestation and they are just as hard. Whether you use it as a decorative ornament or as building material for sinister edifices, you can't deny that this is a fantastic item.

name: Koalak Master Skin
description: This old and worn skin used to protect the Koalak Master's behind. It still has some nice reddish traces, ample proof of a crazy, restless life.

name: Scaratos Carapace
description: This small shiny shell is very useful for creating nice jewellery at a low cost... You'll be able to sell it to an Astrubian for a fortune once you convince them it can make you fly.

name: Deminoball Horn
description: At first sight, this impressive horn does not seem to be very useful. And even when you take a closer look at it, it doesn't seem very useful - a bit like an army of ticks.

name: Blastofu Ashes
description: The Blastofu is apparently capable of being reborn from its ashes. Since they've changed hands, these ones might not work any more.

name: Tofuzmo Feather Duster
description: The Tofuzmo used this feathery ruff to look cool and rebellious. Sadly, it just makes you look like another teenager who hasn't quite got to grips with puberty.

name: Tofuzmo Rump
description: This rump got spanked more than I ever have, you can't help thinking as you look down at it in your inventory.

name: Great Behelit
description: He who seeks only to dominate their adversaries dies with a collar around his neck.

name: Blastofu Ember
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Khamelerost Tongue
description: It may not look it, but this tongue's actually many large 'ring' muscles. The Khamelerost flicks it out by contracting them. Being mostly incompressible water, their volume can't change, so the rings shrink in diameter, but get thicker, making the tongue much longer almost instantly.

name: Khamelerost Skin
description: This roasted skin protects sensitive skins from rays of sunshine. It's a particularly close-fitting skin.

name: Scaratos Horn
description: This horn used to be the pride and joy of a particular Scaratos. Then one day, his wife was introduced to the handsome postman. Now the horn is in your pocket. That says it all, doesn't it?

name: Mumminotor Bandage
description: Wrapped up around the horns but especially around the private parts of the Mumminotor, this bandage became imbued with the Mumminotor's magic with the passing years. Smelly and terrifying, this bandage is much sought after by the fetiologists of the World.

name: Mumminotor Horn
description: Wrapped up in a magic bandage, this horn must be extremely expensive, very precious, awfully smelly and cursed. A bit like a mummy would be.

name: Zoth Smoke Machine
description: This smoke machine is supposed to be the cause of the mist that constantly surrounds the Zoth Village and the Canopy. Some people say that Zoth Disciples' heads are all full of mist too, but nobody dares say that to their faces.

name: Mastogob Warrior Eye
description: This eye must have seen the rumps of a fair few female Mastogobs in its time. Now all the poor thing can see is the fluff in your pocket.

name: Purple Warko Used Nappy
description: You can tell how wise a Purple Warko is by the number of nappies it goes through each day. The more often it changes them, the wiser it is. Studying habits really is an interesting little thing!

name: Mastogob Warrior Horn
description: The most reckless Frigostians have fun with sleeping Mastogob Warriors by attempting to throw three metallic rings around each of their horns without waking them up. Unsurprisingly, no one has ever made it to the end of the game alive.

name: Koalak Mummy Ulna
description: Thanks to the Koalak Mummy's numerous wrappings, which give good protection against the most powerful magic attacks, this bone has kept all of its splendour.

name: Major Hulhu
description: Fear makes the Gobball run faster than a Tofu.

name: Purple Warko Beard Hair
description: This hair is urticant, making this beard a war weapon much more destructive than a Bwork's bad breath, if we were to compare them. Shocking!

name: Clakoss
description: Lord Crow is just full of surprises! For example, he always carries a Clakoss - the famous royal cheese - in his pocket. He must really love it to have tamed such a beast!

name: Invigorating Nectar
description: This nectar contains all the energy of Plantala – an unexpected natural power that could surprise you.

name: White Rat Fabric
description: This fabric, as greasy as a Wabbit Hair that has been dipped into Blop grease, efficiently protects you from the cold. Especially if you set it on fire.

name: Greater Bherb Relic
description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

name: Kwismas Cavern Key
description: This key was made by local craftsmen. Some fairly tough monsters on Kwismas Island also have copies of it.

name: Damadrya's Bamboo Grove Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kwismas Cavern Key Mould
description: Like most moulds, this can be used by men and women alike. The difference is in the way it's used... which is the same for all users.

name: Wild Koalak Scarf
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Silf the Greater Bherb Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Lord Crow Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: White Rat Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Bytbul Palp
description: The Bytbul was feeling around so much that he got a smack. Well, he was warned.

name: Lord Crow's Heart
description: Without its heart, his song is going to take a turn for the worse. But don't say a word, Lord Crow is very sensitive.

name: Bamboo Wood
description: Unlike reed, bamboo can break when bent. Most of the time, it's the teeth of a careless adventurer that will break first. These bloody dentists even have nature on their side... I tell you.

name: Magic Bamboo Wood
description: This amazing magic piece of Bamboo can move. A tribal legend says that every night it wanders round the village and knocks on the doors of people who abandon themselves to nightly pleasures. Pandawas often chain their Magic Bamboo before going to bed to prevent all kind of disappointments.

name: Bulbiflor Pollen
description: When it is pollen season, no one is immune… Burning eyes, sneezing, itchy throat – nothing really dangerous, but adventurers all agree that it's a nightmare all the same.

name: Lord Crow's Library Key
description: Use this key to meet Lord Crow himself. If you're lucky, he might invite you to share a piece of cheese in his company.

name: Wild Koalak Femur
description: Once carved and shaped like a dagger, this bone makes a great a boil-piercer.

name: Capsaaloock Leather
description: The Capsaaloock always had sensitive skin – that's why he has to cover himself up with bandages. Spiteful gossips say that it's to hide other shocking things.

name: Bonta Rat Dungeon Key
description: This key will let you into the Rat dungeon located deep in the sewers of Bonta. No need for a disguise, you'll go unnoticed even if you're not a Bontarian.

name: Greater Bherb Skin
description: This skin is softer than a Kilibriss' bottom. Fat lot of good it will do you.

name: Captain Scarlight Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Grey Sea Bream
description: No one really cares what a bream is, or how it can be royal.

name: Nekineko
description: Stop touching it!

name: Colousses's Meowsoleum Key
description: You thought you'd be able to get in to the Ecaflee-infested meowsoleum without a key? You can always itch your brains.

name: Geriatick Skin
description: Just like a vampire, this old skin absorbs the blood of anyone who comes into contact with its hairs.

name: Colousses Gland
description: The seed contained in this gland is the cause of the Ecaflee infestation of the Elevation Stones. Be very careful then not to leave it just laying around, unless you want to see the little pests polluting your home.

name: Ecaflee Catzino Token
description: Do you feel lucky? Well do you?

name: Nenufrog Tongue
description: This species of monsters has evolved to have the hunting instincts of animals and the immobility of plants so they can hide for hours to lull their prey into a false sense of security. And when their prey least expects it, out snaps a tongue so quickly that it's over before you can even lick your lips.

name: Flowistil Pistil
description: It's said that, because of their inflatable pistils, flowistils would be able to fly if they breathed in helium.

name: Capsaaloock Hair
description: It's useless insisting! This hair is not edible.

name: Black Rat Skin
description: The Black Rat was well-known for his bad breath but also for his rough butt skin. The creature evolved this way after generations of slipping off toilet seats. Unfortunately, since he lived right in the sewers, this Black Rat never needed to go to the toilets.

name: Greater Bherb Feathered Tail
description: One by one, year after year, the number of feathers on the Bherb's appendages increases. You can tell its age by the bushiness of its brush.

name: Bamboo Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Dried Meat
description: You simply do not understand why your grandparents give off a musty smell while this meat has no odour whatsoever.

name: Fleeflee Paw
description: Stickier than your mother-in-law during a family dinner, the Fleeflee paw will never separate from the person it's attached to. Handle with care if you don't want to end up with a new limb.

name: Lord Crow Feather
description: One day, startled by the glint of something shiny from the corner of his eye, Lord Crow spread his massive wings and flew off, leaving behind this feather. It's just a feather… right?

name: Bambooto Stalk
description: This hollow stalk has many uses. Indeed, when bamboo runs short, some Kwapa use it as a blowgun.

name: Brakmar Rat Dungeon Key
description: This key will let you into the Rat dungeon located deep in the sewers of Brakmar. No need for a disguise, you'll go unnoticed even if you're not a Brakmarian.

name: Black Rat Ulna
description: This rat bone can be emptied, pierced and carved. Then it can be used as a musical instrument... or a little place to keep change if you're not into music.

name: White Rat Skin
description: The White Rat loved to mope round the sewers and waited for some nice person to come and comfort him. Then he would abuse the naivety and credulity of his victims to skin them alive, stuff them with cashew nuts and roast them. Poor little cashew nuts.

name: Greater Bherb Eyebrows
description: To prove that he's the Boss, the eyebrows of the Greater Bherb are always frowning, even beyond death.

name: Zoth Fabric
description: Made of a soft and resistant material, this fabric is perfectly adapted to the Zoths' figure and hides what needs to be hidden.

name: Bherb's Gully Key
description: This strange key will enable you to enter Bherb's Gully in one piece.

name: Damadrya Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Damadrya's Exploding Bud
description: This bud bodes well for new beginnings but also seems a wee bit unstable… As a precaution, keep it in a stable, shake-free environment.

name: Colousses Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Bulbush Thorn
description: When a plant doesn't seem to have thorns, that's when it pricks you. That's the Bulbush's hidden talent.

name: Black Rat Fabric
description: Coiled around a soft wooden strip, this fabric can be used as a sponge or as a butt-scratcher. To each their own.

name: White Rat Tooth
description: This tooth is actually a horrible fang that enabled the White Rat to transmit many diseases to his victims when he bit them, ensuring that they would die even if he couldn't finish them off. Any means will do when you're trying to earn respect.

name: Black Rat Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Royal Sea Bream
description: No one really knows what a bream is, or how it can be royal.

name: Dried Carrion
description: This meat has undergone a conservation process similar to that of the oldest Enutrofs, which guarantees exceptional durability.

name: Petrified Ecaflee Larva
description: This larva could have become a Fleeflee or a Geriatick if it hadn't gobbled up so many mineral substances. And now, here it is, hard as a rock, condemned to a life as material used for making keys. What an unhappy ending.

name: Melouse Eye
description: This eye shows the Melouse to be a nasty little beast: it prefers to have to leave an eye behind rather than to have to miss a good scrap.

name: Itsh Spine
description: How valuable could it be? After all, look how many the Itsh had laying around.

name: Ugly Tofu Beak
description: The only advantage of putting this beak in your mouth would be to shut you up and give your team mates some peace and quiet.

name: Ugly Tofu Tuft
description: Once upon a time, there was a shy little Tofu quite unlike the others: for one thing, he was the only one in the village with fur. Teased mercilessly by his peers, he ran away, hoping that adulthood would set him free. But it never did.

name: Bloody Koalak Tuft
description: The Bloody Koalak only has hairs this long on two parts of its body. These look like they sprouted from his head... Or at least that's what you'll continue telling yourself...!

name: Bloody Koalak Tail
description: This ridiculous, tiny tail is so insignificant it could have belonged to you. But this is not the case... Consider yourself lucky!

name: Bloody Koalak Boomerang
description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

name: Rocha
description: Whoever's closest is usually wrong. But not by a wrong shot.

name: Koalak Rider Skin
description: This torn skin was worn out against that of the Koalak Rider's Mount. Obviously, this is a proof of its good quality.

name: Dead Crobak
description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

name: Koalak Warrior Bandage
description: This bandage is normally wrapped around the Koalak Warrior's arms. This way, he can blow his nose without using any handkerchiefs. When this bandage is old and worn out, you hang it on the ceiling of your house to catch passing Moskitos.

name: Koalak Gravedigger Shinbone
description: This bone can be used as a shovel to unearth corpses and strip them off, if you like spending your holidays next to cemeteries. Incidentally, it's also the Koalak Gravedigger's shinbone.

name: Crowfox Hair
description: The Crowfox loves to dress up as a Crobak. No one really knows why, but most people have something to say on the subject.

name: Old Kralove Sucker
description: Mopeats will pick anything up, probably because they've lived with the Giant Kralove for so long. If you believe the rumours, this old sucker has magic powers, and is worshipped by a tribe of particularly cretinous Wabbits. On a more practical note, it comes in very handy for unblocking toilets.

name: Drinker Heart
description: This heart will remain faithful to you. As long as you don't sell or exchange it, it will stay in your bag. What a lovely thought!

name: Pointed Crowfox Feather
description: A Crowfox sometimes has a pointed feather different from the others. As a rule, it's magic, and even if it isn't, you can use it for dressing up as an Indian Chief.

name: Crobak Foot
description: No need to break the foot of a Crobak. Especially as you know that, contrary to Wabbit Paws, Crobak Feet bring bad luck.

name: Koalak Warrior Hair
description: Koalaks don't go to school, so the Koalak Warrior didn't have the opportunity to become the playground bully. It has, therefore, decided to take revenge on random adventurers and become the Agony V'Helley bully.

name: Dried Mopeat Peat
description: Made from rotting vegetables, this peat has incredible powers of absorption. Mama Bworks save them for Auntie Floe's monthly visits.

name: Tamed Crobak Feather
description: This greasy feather belonged to a Tamed Crobak who spent most of his life locked up and force-fed until he became fat enough to completely fill the space of his cage.

name: Major Oaf
description: Keep your distance.

name: Mastogob Wool
description: Mastogobs need to be shorn once a year, just like the armpits of Pikokos.

name: Mastogob Clavicle
description: There isn't the tiniest piece of edible meat left on this bone, so there's no point you gnawing on it.

name: Manderisha Skin
description: This spotted skin is said to be covered with a poison capable of changing anyone into a dried Karaball.

name: Kilibriss Down
description: Kilibriss down is light and much sought after for the making of mattresses.

name: Minoskito Skin
description: Worn out by the sand and the sea salt, this skin is as thin as an old sock worn out by... sand and sea salt. Does that mean a healthy Minoskito looks like a fresh sock? Yes it does.

name: Manderisha Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Kilibriss Staff
description: Thanks to its length, this staff will enable you to reach the most difficult places to access and to scratch yourself all over.

name: Minoskito Proboscis
description: This proboscis has made the Minoskito quite successful, in a natural selection sort of way. It allows the Minoskito to feed on fresh blood, coagulated blood, wagwan blood… just about any blood, really.

name: Plain Pikoko Wing
description: The Pikoko never was famous for its grace in flight. Once you've seen its wings, well, you'll understand why.

name: Plain Pikoko Nut
description: There's no milk inside this Pikoko Nut, just brain juice. If you're lucky, you might find a few neurons floating on the surface.

name: Major Payo
description: There'll always be something to unite those who are worlds apart.

name: Major Kyoub
description: He who underestimates the resistance factor of projectiles when encountering air resistance probably won't make it through winter.

name: Polished Stone Heart
description: The only thing that can differentiate a Crackler's heart from that of a polished Crackler is the delicacy with which the item can break between your toes when you least expect it.

name: Polished Brain Fragment
description: Thanks to this fragment, you'll learn the Cracklers' good manners: hand crushing to say hi.

name: Kido Beak
description: This beak is so fragile that Otomai's disciples used it to make training arrows with blunt ends.

name: Kido Rear Feather
description: One of Otomai's greatest riddles was inspired by this resource: what's the heaviest? One hundred pods of Kido feathers or one hundred pods of Pyrute?

name: Miremop Double Chin
description: The Miremop spends a lot of his time taking mud baths in the hopes of slimming down. He has never lost an ounce, but at least his double chin evens out his figure.

name: Miremop Tooth
description: The Miremop is the owner of a fine (if dangerous) set of gnashers that it uses to nibble on the fingers and toes of curious adventurers who get lost in the peat bogs. Who knew something so soft could bite so hard?

name: Zaihn
description: The eye of the cyclone is less dangerous than the cyclops' club.

name: Yew Wood
description: The wood of the Yew Tree is very strong and flexible. Consistently voted wood of the year by the bow makers of the region, it's also rather difficult to find - the peasants of Amakna destroy any shoots they see because they're poisonous to Gobballs.

name: Dragon Pig Leather
description: The Dragon Pig was so keen to transform into a Dragon that he burnt all the stubbly hair from his skin, which partly explains why this leather smells so strongly of pork scratchings.

name: Rye
description: This dark cereal can grow under the worst of conditions, it's one of the rare cereals capable of surviving long periods of drought.

name: Kouartz
description: This strange alloy contains an impressive energy which makes it quite unstable under certain circumstances. The best smiths are mad about Kouartz and use it to create weapons with almost legendary powers.

name: Ap Ga Rune
description: This rune is so powerful that it should be hurled off the World by the gods themselves. It makes a weapon so easy to use that you can slay ten warriors while... let's see... changing a nappy, sipping a cup of tea, erecting a dry stone wall in your front yard... just about anything.

name: Greedovore Flower
description: This flower facilitates digestion. Now you can stay as long as you want at the local free buffet.

name: Domoizelle Feather
description: This pale pink feather will help you craft some of the most delicate and sought after items in all of Amakna.

name: Ambusher Bud
description: This little Ambusher bud contains a sticky, syrupy sap. If you have the misfortune to walk on an old Ambusher hidden in the long grass, you may remain caught until it devours your boots entirely. On the other hand, if you manage to make off with an intact Ambusher bud, you will be able to hush the most moany of Fecas by offering it to them and pretending it is chewing gum.

name: Bworker Token
description: Great for playing heads or tails so you can kill your enemy while the coin spins, this pure gold token will make you happy, but maybe unlucky as well.

name: Rice
description: Either sticky or slimy, rice is a long-time favourite with young, starving Pandawas.

name: Tanukouï San Ghost Fabric
description: This fabric comes from the armpits of the Tanukouï San Ghost, famous for their softness and their smell, which resembles rotting Crobak meat... and that's a best case scenario.

name: Koolich Cavern Key
description: This key of bone will enable you to enter the Koolich Cavern even if you haven't been invited.

name: Dorgan Ation Skin
description: Dorgan Ation has once more been extremely generous with you in spite of his bad temper. He gave you his skin before leaving and moaning like a Lousy Pig. What a nerve!

name: Gorgoyle Handle
description: This handle can be used to knock on a door to announce your presence. It also works very well on monsters or on boyfriends who are a little too forward.

name: Thicket Substrate
description: Chafer Axit was sprinkled with this liquid four times when he was still small and puny. I can't imagine a better start in life, can you?

name: Greater Bherb Feather
description: Worn on your arm, this feather is sure to tickle someone's fancy.

name: Al Howin's Vegetable Patch Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dramak's Holey Pants
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dramak's Holey Sock
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Moowolf Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Antrezure Antenna
description: You never quite know what you're going to find on the end of an Antrezure's antennae, but given that their favourite pastime is attacking sensitive body parts, you're probably most likely to find scraps of underwear.

name: Dimensional Fabric
description: Here's a piece of fabric you definitely shouldn't use to make underwear with. Let one rip and you might destroy the universe!

name: Riz Cola
description: This grain is often used in the creation of cough drops.

name: Yew Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Key to Kharnotaurus's Lair
description: Despite what you might imagine, this key won't get you into the inn's storeroom. Not at all. Instead, it'll let you into the lair of a very peculiar innkeeper.

name: Moowolf Eye
description: Even after being yanked out of its owner's head, this Moowolf eye won't look away. But sometimes, when it thinks you're not looking, it sheds a tear. Ah yes, the distant memories of a disembodied eye. Or dreams of the evil eye?

name: Moon Hair
description: This hair feels incredibly soft and warm when you touch it… almost as though it were alive.

name: Pandora Ghost Fabric
description: This fabric is still imbued with Pandora Ghost sweat, which adds to its value considerably.

name: Maho Firefoux Ghost Bone
description: This bone is still imbued with a magic that can best be described as 'home-made', so do not be surprised if it comes back to life and tries to find the remains of its owner.

name: Pandikaze Ghost Bone
description: This bone is the only thing left from the ghost you've just exterminated. Bad luck for you, it doesn't seem to have any magic.

name: Pandulum Ghost Bone
description: Finely carved, this bone can be used as a hand for a giant clock. Just essential.

name: Soryo Firefoux Ghost Bone
description: The first time the Soryo Firefoux broke a bone, he tried to take his revenge on the first man that came along. At that very moment, Jon Lemon, minstrel by trade, was walking and singing when he came across the Soryo Firefoux. No one knows what happened next. The only thing that could be noticed afterwards was that his voice had become even more high-pitched.

name: Signature Rune
description:
This rune allows the best craftsmen to put their signature on their creations.
(To be used along with the ingredients when crafting items.)

name: Second Part of the Dragon Pig's Maze Key
description: This might be part of the key which opens the treasure chest you've always dreamt of. It may also be the key to your grave.

name: Holy Bamboo Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Dragon Pig's Den Key
description: After getting lost in the Dragon Pig's Maze, you realised that you had forgotten the key to the Dragon Pig's Den. Fortunately, your Porco pals had a spare with them.

name: Mane in Bloom
description: This mane is an improbable hybrid of hairs and flower petals, which means it's doubly allergenic. So keep away if you're sensitive… a single sneeze could send your brain flying out your nose.

name: Gutted Frozen Icefish
description: Once gutted, Icefish look a lot less dangerous.

name: Al Howin's Bristly Sideburns
description: Sideburns were banned on the Amaknian continent at the same time as Al Howin. They're now considered even more of an atrocity than Al's famous curse.

name: Grasmera's Pouch of Coal
description: What was an organic pouch filled with coal doing in Grasmera's oozing guts? Before you ponder this question any further, please wash your hands.

name: Dramak's Theatre Key
description: This key is a VIP pass for latecomers like you who forgot to reserve a seat AGAIN.

name: Dragon Pig Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Brutatax Embroidery
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Mimicasket Tongue
description: Mimicaskets always have trouble keeping a civil tongue in their heads, and sometimes the easiest solution is simply to rip it out, especially if you can't stand being insulted.

name: Brutatax Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Miniature Sandglass
description: This sandglass is a symbol of passing time. You can't help but wonder if there isn't more than meets the eye with this thing…

name: Margedelweiss
description: It's said that this flour grows in dragon vapour, but no one has been able to prove it.

name: Awkwood Board
description: Many a Twelvian schoolboy lives in mortal fear of walking around with this board.

name: Moon's Tree Key
description: No one is allowed to climb Moon's Tree without first giving the sacred key to his humble servant... And forget about trying to bribe her with Citronanas, peanuts, or Adventurer Meat, she’s completely incorruptible.

name: Oozing Meat
description: Can be used in place of hair dye - assuming red is what you're going for.

name: Doitall Plank
description: The Miserites are outstanding handymen. Bartering means they can make everything they need themselves. This doitall plank is one of their pride and joys. It's as solid as they come.

name: Edelweiss
description: This flower is beautiful but very rare. It's no surprise - its magic is so powerful that it can even bring people back to life.

name: Moowolf Teeth
description: There's nothing sharper.

name: Dostrogo Feather
