description: The deep blue of this rare feather will let you hide in the puddles of Moon Island, or in the sky, if you use its cannon.

name: Dead Glukoko
description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

name: Dragon Pig Tail
description: This big piece of Dragon Pig Tail is a true delight. Fry it up with a few Sesame Seeds, coat it with a Sauce-Age and your guests will never leave your house. Isn't that great? No? Oh well.

name: Pandikaze Ghost Fabric
description: This heap of hairs is almost intact despite the punishment you must have inflicted on the poor Pandikaze Ghost to pull it out.

name: Soryo Firefoux Ghost Fabric
description: This medium-sized fabric might help to block the draft under old doors when winter sets in.

name: Yokai Firefoux Ghost Fabric
description: This fabric comes from the most sensitive parts of the Yokai Firefoux Ghost… these also happen to be the smelliest parts. And no, I'm not talking about his moustache.

name: Pandulum Ghost Fabric
description: Contrary to vicious rumour, this fabric is not edible. The last ones who tried to cook it were turned into Tanukouï San. Quite a stroke of luck for some of them!

name: Pandora Ghost Bone
description: This bone hasn't come out of the Pandora's Box… yet, we have every reason to believe it has.

name: Tanukouï San Ghost Bone
description: By dint of bearing the immeasurable weight of their humongous testicles, the bones of the Tanukouï San ended up being extremely tough.

name: Dragon Pig's Maze Key
description: If you think this key will attract your dirty pig-friends, you really haven't got it… The only thing it will do is open up the Dragon Pig's Maze. Be careful, though as it will be destroyed after use.

name: Moowolf Mojo
description: This small flask contains the virile power of the Moowolf in liquid form. Be careful though, it's not edible.

name: Moowolf Lair Key
description: This key will grant you access to the terrible Moowolf Lair. Once inside, you'll most likely be gutted in a relaxing, low-key atmosphere.

name: Koolich Stone
description: Though the Koolich is quite a generous thing, he wasn't exactly happy about giving you his big stone. And it's understandable, given what you're going to do with it.

name: Aspen Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Ice Saw
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Steel Plate
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Protective Gloves
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Gleaming Pebble
description: This pebble will enable you to forge powerful items whilst preventing you from forging an opinion on the quantative theory of kamas.

name: Smoked Pebble
description: The origins of this pebble remain unknown. Certain adventurers believe it's actually one of the many burnt loaves baked by Xavier the Baker's careless apprentice. They say he always used to forget to turn off the oven when he went out to help his mentor beat off the monsters around the bakery.

name: Al Howin's False Teeth
description: This is what will happen to your teeth if you eat too many treats on Al Howin's Day, kiddywinkles!

name: Jumpy Flea
description: This vicious little flea has just one purpose in life: spread the ugliest illnesses. It particularly likes silky fur and Ecaflip cards.

name: Grasmera Scale
description: With a couple of these taped onto your back, you might just manage to pass your humpback off as some kind of exotic costume. Sadly, nothing can be done for your nightmare-inducing face.

name: Scale of Courage Fragment
description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

name: Persaport Cord
description: If anyone tries to grab your purse strings from your capable grasp, you can use this cord to bind their hands safely behind their backs.

name: Precious Moustache
description: Here is the finishing touch for your next Too Faux Karnaval disguise. You'll look absolutely precious, dahling!

name: Kamatrix
description: This piece of money comes from another dimension entirely and is only valuable to Enutoughs. They say the Kamatrix has the mysterious power of making projectiles deviate from their initial trajectories.

name: Skull and Crossbones
description: A symbol of Srambad, this type of relic is generally taken as a souvenir. So you can definitely hook it up to your Bunch of Keys.

name: Dripping Meat
description: Well, the vast quantities of toxins in this meat had to go somewhere, didn’t they.

name: Dragon Pig Skull
description: Despite its small capacity, this skull is a real collector's item. Its similarity with the skull of a Iop has allowed numerous medical students to write theses on the intellectual weakness of Amakna's most intellectually challenged class.

name: Scalding Poison
description: This Arachnee leg poison will send your head right into space. Both literally and figuratively, since after a short period of wide-eyed cosmic clarity, your skull explodes due to the massive increase in blood pressure.

name: Moowolf Magic Testicles
description: As strange as it may seem, these testicles have magic powers. We don't really know to what extent that helped the Moowolf, and to be honest, it's probably better not to ask.

name: Leopardo Ghost Fabric
description: This fabric is not as soft as the Leopardo's music but it should still be useful. For what? That's the real question…

name: Leopardo Ghost Bone
description: The Imps once used this small pointy bone as a nasal decoration. An elegant way to enhance a hooked nose, for instance.

name: First Part of the Dragon Pig's Maze Key
description: If this snout doesn't appeal to you, don't try to make something out of it. You'll get slapped all the way home.

name: Ancestral Wood Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Moon Skin
description: Deprived of his soft skin, poor Moon was taken by surprise and could only run away in the jungle screaming with pain. This is a nice bedtime story you'll enjoy telling your kids to make them go to sleep.

name: Magic Moon Fabric
description: Judging by the tiny stars twinkling around it, this fabric seems to be magic. Hard to believe? Maybe. But one day, you'll have to face the truth... You're just too stupid to tell if something's magic or not. Do not follow your Astrubian killer instinct... trust all these descriptions.

name: Mufafah Moustache
description: Marylork the painter prefers his brushes to be made from thick, luxuriant Mufafah Moustache, rather than the slightly wispy Kittenfish Moustache, which is liable to blow away in the slightest of breezes.

name: Poisonous Slobber
description: Mixed with stale beer, this slobber will heal all of your ailments, including unhappiness.

name: Lunar Pebble
description: This pebble is named for the curious light that it gives off, which makes it look like the moon. It doesn't glow in the dark, so there's no point taking it with you for your midnight encounters.

name: Koolich Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Scale of Ferocity Fragment
description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

name: Strongboxer Part
description: This Strongboxer, or what remains of it, doesn't look like much now, but it doesn't matter. It was beautiful on the inside.

name: Rock Eel
description: Fishing with explosives has allowed Rogues to corner the market on this fish.

name: Chance Biscuit
description: This little cake, drier than your mother-in-law's heart, contains a bit of paper with the following message written on it: "All is not yet lost." You feel reassured.

name: Kharnotaurus Eye
description: Some claim that fortune tellers use this eye to communicate with spirits.

name: Kharnotaurus Tooth
description: A tooth of this size could almost be used as a sword.

name: Kharnotaurus Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Tin
description: Tin is a soft and heavy metal, a bit like the Wo Wabbit but worse.

name: Dragon Pig Blood
description: This phial is full of a blood which used to confer evil powers to the Dragon Pig. To be drunk in moderation or used as an ingredient of the Dragon Pig black pudding, if you like it, of course!

name: Ancestral Wood
description: This elm wood comes from the Olag-lacustre Island, which was struck by lightning one Fall morning. Rumours have it that a Bwork Magus is responsible for it because he didn't control his elementary spells properly.

name: Glu
description: This pot of pink jelly might smell good... But you must never taste it or you won't ever speak again. It's an excellent fixative.

name: Resistant Rye
description: This dark cereal can grow under the worst of conditions.

name: Ambusher Leaf
description: Ambusher leaf has a very unusual taste, somewhere between hazelnut and limp Babbage. If you dare to try the meals you make, you will soon realise they taste a little like treachery.

name: Dragomilk
description:
How many farmhands does it take to milk a Dragon Pig? Seven. One to milk it and the other six to carry his coffin.
BOOOOO! GET OFF THE STAGE!

name: Moowolf Scalp
description: When you and the Moowolf met, the same thought ran through your warped minds… To leave with a scalp. Well, now you've got a scalp and he needs a hat.

name: Boowolf Testicles
description: Considering the value of these Boowolf testicles, you might as well be carrying a pair of gold… ingots.

name: Greedo Rum
description: This bottle was accidentally left inside a Greedovore, used as a mobile cellar for several years.

name: Dragon Pig Horn
description: This horn belonged to one of Amakna's most famous predators: the Dragon Pig. Many hunters would be ready to sell their entire family to buy what's in your hands. That's the dream opportunity for you to have a family for cheap!

name: Dragon Pig Snout
description: The Dragon Pig didn't smell that one coming. Hahaha.

name: Topaz
description: For some dubious reasons, Topaz is still the most popular jewel among jewellers. It attracts quite a lot of Crobaks in the Cania Plains.

name: Silicate
description: This ore probably comes from the depths of the Pandala Island mines where Gardan Framine fell head over heels in love with a female Pandawa ghost. Love really doesn't know any boundaries!

name: Maho Firefoux Ghost Fabric
description: This red-coloured magic fabric is imbued with an ultra-powerful magic. Not quite a feature you share!

name: Yokai Firefoux Ghost Bone
description: This bone could have been used to crack cheeky adventurers' skulls open or to drive Enutrofs into the ground like asparagus. But now it's in your hands, its destiny risks being a little more modest.

name: Dragon Pig Hair
description: Though you've searched thoroughly, you couldn't find out where this Dragon Pig hair came from. Search some more. The Dragon Pig's anatomy is full of surprises.

name: Koolich Braid
description: This huge braid was made by the Koolich himself, some years ago. With the passing years, it became as stiff as a rock. However, it still holds a foul, slimy liquid that attracts Moskitos from time to time. The most surprising thing is that this braid used to perfectly suit the Koolich. Like a big Slob, you had the ridiculous idea to steal it.

name: Protective Mask
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Puffed Frosteez Flour
description: This flour has the distinction of not blowing away when blown on, which is a very useful characteristic when faced with gassy children and blundering Iops.

name: Gutted Icefish
description: Once gutted, Icefish look a lot less dangerous.

name: Gorgoyle Fragment
description: Lousy Pigs suck on this fragment when they're near a willing female in order to test the specimen's durability. So what's it doing in your mouth?

name: Cursed Pumpkwin Seeds
description: If you plant these seeds and wait a few months, you'll soon see a horde of Cursed Pumpkwins come at you, snapping for your head. Why aren't they very popular again...?

name: Moon Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Dramak Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Scale of Endurance Fragment
description: If you manage to procure several of these, it may be possible to assemble them into a complete dragon scale with magic properties, which will be indispensable in helping you find the Emerald Dofus.

name: Hurtful Locker Horn
description: The Hurtful Locker's two horns are actually connected to one another. It took mammoth strength to detach this one from its twin.

name: Brutatax's Factory Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Eel
description: Much like a Sram, the eel slips without difficulty through the oddest places.

name: Nyan
description: Fleeing while backing up is just like giving fierce chase to an escaping enemy. Except in reverse.

name: Polished Ball
description: From what part of the Crackrock's anatomy does this ball come? And why do they always come in pairs?

name: Ouassingue Slobber
description: The legend says that the aroma produced by this slobber is a blend of all the smells in the World. A real pot pourri of fragrances that will make you want to carve your nostrils out.

name: Blodz Uker Skin
description: You used a cheese grater to scrape this skin off a poor Blodz Uker. No doubt he will remember that terrible event for life. Don't count on him to tell you the way next time you get lost in his maze.

name: Major Domo
description: Generally speaking, spreading out is a horrible tactic. It's almost as bad as sticking together.

name: Boopig Testicles
description: These huge testicles are covered with soft, warm, downy fluff. The most dedicated of all crotch-sniffers, the Boopigs, will tear them apart if you get too close.

name: Slate Dragoss Shell
description: You could use this Sapphire Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

name: Slate Dragoss Scale
description: You could use this Sapphire Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

name: Boogranny Mojo
description: This small flask contains the virile power of the Boogranny in liquid form. Be careful though, it's not edible.

name: Boowolf Fabric
description: This fabric, made of Boowolf Hair, is very rare. It's strong enough to resist all kinds of physical and magical attacks.

name: Boowonoké Scalp
description: When you and the Boowonoké met, the same thought ran through your warped minds… To leave with a scalp. Well, now you've got a scalp and it needs a hat.

name: Boopig Eye
description: Even removed, the gaze of the Boopig remains fixed on you. Its gaze follows you wherever you go… It's quite impressive.

name: Limestone Dragoss Scale
description: You could use this White Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

name: Sak
description: Whatever doesn't eat you makes you stronger.

name: Boogranny Canine
description: This sharpened tooth is above all prized as a lucky charm. If this is true, Lady Luck must have a very poor sense of smell.

name: Gobkool Leather
description: This multicoloured leather is perfect for making multicoloured leather underpants, which will be enough to awaken the jealousy of even the least fashion-conscious Chafers.

name: Limestone Dragoss Horn
description: Not quite as pointy as a Xelor's Synchro, but a lot more solid, the White Dragoss uses this horn to turn an arse-kicking session into an arse-piercing one.

name: Clay Dragoss Scale
description: You could use this Golden Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

name: Rhinoblasty Horn
description: It's only when you realise that the Rhinoblasty's horn was ripped clean off that you fully appreciate the violence of the battle in which you partook. You don't worry about it too much, though: you're too focussed on collecting more so you can dress up as Dark Moll for the Al Howin's celebrations!

name: Rhinoblasty Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Boowolf Tail
description: The Boowolf Tail is so similar to a big mossy log that you just can't tell them apart. That'll only add to your manic paranoia, I know, but you're better off knowing, believe me.

name: Boowoldlum Magic Testicles
description: Nobody knows exactly when or how it happened, but one day, these testicles were given magic powers… The extent of their true powers remains shrouded in mystery.

name: Gobkool Horn
description: According to an old legend, when you grind this horn down, the powder is said to have aphrodisiac powers. The same legend specifies that it can also have surprising side effects. Another reason to try it out!

name: Clay Dragoss Shell
description: You could use this Golden Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

name: Mastogobbly Ear
description: Frigostians normally eat these ears with vinaigrette because they taste awful, and Frigostians love vinaigrette.

name: Boowonoké Hairs
description: This hair is different from other hair. It has magical properties which makes it extremely valuable to alchemists.

name: Boowoldlum Claw
description: This filthy claw is used to make fearsome weapons.

name: Cave Gobball Brain
description: There is no doubt that this brain comes from a Cave Gobball. Well-cooked, it's the favourite dish of young Iops who long to be strong and tall. They also believe it can make them more intelligent, but if that were true, they would stop this idiotic practise immediately.

name: Gobkool Wool
description: This wool looks like Gobball wool but isn't. This wool doesn't smell.

name: Shape-Shifting Dragoss Horn
description: Not quite as pointy as a Xelor's Synchro, but a lot more solid, the Sapphire Dragoss uses this horn to turn an arse-kicking session into an arse-piercing one.

name: Coal Dragoss Shell
description: You could use this Black Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

name: Shape-Shifting Dragoss Shell
description: You could use this White Dragoss Shell to protect your most precious parts.

name: Coal Dragoss Scale
description: You could use this Black Dragoss Scale to make a very nice pair of boots or some underwear for fighting in.

name: Mastogobbly Leather
description: They say that boiling this leather 8 times in water renders it edible. That's a Frigostian's idea of a funny joke, by the way.

name: Stunted Rat Paw
description: Young Frigostian schoolchildren have a game called "BowMeouch" which involves cutting a paw off a Stunted Rat and using it to simulate footprints in the snow. They attract Snow Bow Meows in search of prey to ambush. Once the Snow Bow Meow is caught, they shave its fur off and turn it into a muffle. Aren't children wonderful?

name: Stunted Rat Fabric
description: Before Frigost froze over, Stunted Rats were hunted for their fur, which was then sold on the Amaknian continent under the name "Exotic Kitsou Skin".

name: Potion of Old Age
description: This potion can speed up certain chemical processes, such as the the formation of precipitates. It’s a bit like a super-powerful yeast, but it doesn't taste as bad.

name: Slicing Canine
description: All the iron contained in the blood imbued in this tooth has made it as strong as a blade.

name: Spanner Tooth
description: As decayed as this tooth is, it's still as solid as a rock. If you slaughter several million Spanners, you'll gather enough of them to build yourself a castle!

name: Mp Ga Rune
description: This rune is so powerful that it should be hurled off the World by the Gods themselves. It makes weapons so much lighter and so much easier to put away that you can sit back and concentrate on the important things… although what's more important than watching your enemies getting sliced up?

name: Major Yosh
description: …then I took an arrow to the heart.

name: Spe Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much, much more popular.

name: Spe Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more popular.

name: Spanner Stilt
description: This stilt can be used as a swatter for turbulent children, a poker for noisy animals, a cage bar for bawdy daughters and a cane for civilised walks on the green.

name: Mama Koalak Bone
description: The Mama Koalak has particularly solid bones that don't break under her weight. The same cannot be said for the famous minstrel Jon Lemon who lost the use of both his arms when he got squashed by a Mama Koalak's humongous thighs.

name: Farle's Pig Skin
description: If you believe the breeders, Farle was the greatest breeder of all. But then again, they were all jealous of Shika. Anyway, what's certain is Farle is the one who created Farle's Pigs. Another certainty is that he wasn't the most handsome creature - the pigs were created in his own image.

name: Gobvious's Elastic Band
description: World-famous jack of all trades Mac Gayver would find a thousand things to do with this elastic band. You're not a genius like him, so you'll probably stick to the tried and tested recipes in your books.

name: Gobvious's Duster
description: The feathers on this sad specimen are long gone, but you can always use it as a riding crop at one of the masked parties you're always pretending you don't go to.

name: Drakoalak Skin
description: This skin's smell will remind you of the Amakna Castle stables.

name: Shredded Drakoalak Headgear
description: This weird-looking headgear used to hide the premature baldness of the Drakoalak. With a little practise, it might soon be able to hide yours.

name: Morongrel Ear
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Major Petunia
description: The harder you are, the bigger you fall.

name: Morongrel Leg
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Teleb
description: Keep your friends far away and your enemies even further.

name: Ancestral Amber
description: This amber comes from an Ancestral Treechnid and is priceless. It can confer magic properties on some items, provided they are made by skilled hands.

name: Unique Kralove
description: This Kralove is monogamous. This is surprising when you know its habits.

name: Scrawny Bwak
description: Breeders have always believed the Bwaks flew away at the end of their lives… this Bwak must be an exception.

name: Ancestral Domain Key
description: This key made of Treechnid Bark could take root in any warm and humid microsystem... like a Bwork's crotch, for example.

name: Slimy Silk
description: Perfect for slime balls.

name: Sylvan Seal
description: The Foresters in the King of Amakna's service recognise each other by their inimitable odour, a subtle combination of humus, musk and sweat. So don't expect this seal to help you pass as one of them - your spicy adventurer's scent will give you away.

name: Dakid
description: He who sleeps with his enemies wakes up dead.

name: Pirate's Cute Shorts
description: Pirate's shorts are the proof that ridicule has actually killed someone. But apparently, they are also very lucky.

name: Oliviolet Wood
description: This wood seems to be completely heat-resistant. Don't try to use it to make a fire as you will die of exposure before the wood ever lights.

name: Quality Rum
description: This old rum must come from a highly prized cellar. Unless it comes from a flask forgotten for many generations in someone's pocket.

name: Gullipop Beak
description: Gullipops are rather stupid, badly behaved creatures whose guano lies scattered in stinking piles around Permafrost Port. They like to steal fish from fishermen, but if properly trained, they can also "liberate" the personal effects of distracted tourists and hide them in their beaks.

name: Sailor Knot
description: This knot is very popular with sailors and will win the hearts of young girls who dream of adventure.

name: Rac Globule
description: This glistening yellow blob that protrudes from the Rac Queen's abdomen is probably a sensory organ, or it might be just to distinguish the queen from the other Arak-hai... But more importantly, what will it fetch at the markets?

name: Oliviolet Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: LeChouque's Boat Key
description: They say whoever shows this key to pirate Jack Martel will win the right to visit the Dark Hurl, LeChouque's boat. Once you’re on board, it’s hard to say what might happen... Few have returned alive to tell the tale.

name: LeChouque Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Magik Riktus Big Top Key
description: This key will allow you to see a Magik Riktus performance.

name: Spe Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much more popular.

name: Bewitched Wood Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Ancestral Treechnid Bark
description: This bark got loose from the Ancestral Treechnid without you having to tear it off with your teeth.

name: Ancestral Treechnid Bud
description: This shrivelled up bud was completely drained of its sap by a hungry creature. If you plunge it into water, you'll see it resume its original form, swell, and then if you wait a long time, rot.

name: Ancestral Treechnid Root
description: Even if you snatch it from its owner, this root can whip you or twist your ankles. Mean thing!

name: Ancestral Treechnid Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Stale Meat
description: You needed to check meat, but then you find it’s a stale meat. Can’t win them all.

name: Stale Carrion
description: If you can find a buyer for this meat, then you now know what you to do with the bodies of your Sidekicks...

name: Spe Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more popular.

name: Cauldini's False Face
description: This mask will not turn you into a magician worthy of the name.

name: LeChouque's Beard
description: You have just torn off LeChouque's beard from his chin. Weirdly enough, his teeth came along with the beard… That might be because he's been dead for a long time.

name: Cannon Dorf Ball
description: No one knows if it's because of his experience handling big balls, or because he is one himself, but Cannon Dorf is the best cannoneer on LeChouque's crew.

name: Range Rune
description: This rune will increase the range of your attacks.

name: Elm Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Gullipop Feather
description: Frigostian schoolchildren use these feathers to write with, which is why mother Gullipops always stress to their chicks the need to accelerate when passing a school.

name: Hazwonarm Headband
description: This accessory, appreciated amongst pirates, can be used as an eye-patch, a nose-patch or a privates-patch, depending on the size and occasion.

name: Rac Queen Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Pa So Rune
description: This rune will improve your ability to heal others.

name: Kralove
description: The Kralove may not look like much, but don't be fooled - behind its sad eyes, a fearsome predator crouches, ready to pounce on an intruding stranger.

name: Bewitched Wood
description: This wood was bewitched by a Treechnid Magus to give birth to a tiny Treechnid once put into water. This wood is obviously extremely magical.

name: Cauldini Fabric
description: Many years ago, tailors created a simple system for determining the value of a material - the worse it smells, the better it is. This fabric smells worse than an Enutrof's foot bath commandeered by a Chafer to wash his pants in.

name: Agathe
description: This stone has been named after a very famous female Pandawa: Agathe Pahtes. She could be found in places of debauchery such as the Sufokia Pirates' Pub, where she spent her last years dancing, chained up to a big mast in the middle of the pub.

name: Key to the Lair of the Rac Queen
description: Fancy browsing a web? Use this key to see how well you click with the Rac Queen. But be careful, you may accidentally walk inter-her-net and have a venomenal time. The web site is in the Arak-hai Forest.

name: Rusty Blade
description: Tettinus was a fearsome pirate whose very name inspired dread and awe in all who heard it. Armed with his Rusty Blade, he was the living embodiment of death, more cruel than death itself could ever be. No one knows what happened to him, but many have reported seeing pirates using a Rusty Blade to scare their enemies…

name: Cauldini Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Boble
description: You can't taste a Dofus without breaking the shell.

name: Holy Bambooto Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Holy Bambooto Amber
description: This amber is the Holy Bambooto's sole treasure. That might explain why it's so bitter and mean to the tourists who venture onto Pandala Island.

name: Holy Bambooto Leaf
description: This big leaf is so hard and heavy that it could squash you alive if you happened to fall asleep under a Holy Bambooto in autumn.

name: Holy Bambooto Wood
description: You must be careful with this wood. Not everyone should have it in their hands. But no one knows why.

name: Lilbike Wheel
description: This wheel comes from the remains of a Lilbike's unicycle.

name: Lilbike Skin
description: This skin is made up of a multitude of scales and is in all ways superior to the classic Dalbweel Skin. Indeed, the Lilbike Skin's outside is more resistant and is covered with sharp, cutting scales, while the inside is particularly soft. There's a legend that some old tailors would confuse the two sides when making underwear. The legend doesn't say, however, whether that brought them less business, or more…

name: Dark Treechnee Web
description: If you're going to throw your weight around, you might as well throw it onto this strong, silent type of web.

name: Nephilady Silk
description: Tailors fight over this raw material and for good reason: clothes made from Nephilady silk have a slimming effect, which is hugely popular. It also causes a rash, but such is the cost of looking good.

name: Major Nyoro
description: It's said that it can hypnotize, but no one's really clear how or why it would do that.

name: Pirolienne Bud
description: This bud comes from a Pirolienne's burnt stick.

name: Purple Fabric
description: The main characteristics of this strange Purple Fabric are that it is light and soft to the touch. The tag says "made in Tie One On".

name: Bandages
description: These bandages are revolutionary: triple thickness, ultra-resistant and violet-scented. Shaped for confidence, shaped for comfort.

name: Jumparak Eye
description: It's impossible to confuse the eye-catching colour of this eye with another creature's. If you compare any two side-by-side, the difference really jumps out.

name: Greaseball Fabric
description: This fabric is actually recycled paper. Greaseballs often use it to give a particular look to their balls.

name: Magic Slice of Burnabwork
description: This slice is dripping with noxious substances that prolong combustion.

name: Bizarbwork Scalp
description: Early on, young Enutrofs try and get hold of a Bizarbwork Scalp to hide their growing bald spot. Wearing that thing on their heads, they look even more ridiculous than normal!

name: Burnabwork Skin
description: This flesh has been scorched by numerous exposures to open flame.

name: Magic Oats
description: This wisp of magic oat straw once belonged to a simple peasant. The poor country fellow was bewitched by a Bwork Magus apprentice, who read his book upside down by mistake.

name: Dalbweel Knife
description: This knife has sent many an adventurer fleeing in terror. Don't underestimate it.

name: Arak-hai Gland
description: This somewhat repugnant organ may be useful for those into toxic substances. So why do you have it in your bag?

name: Venomica Wool
description: So you thought nothing could be more uncomfortable than a Gobball Wool cape? Well try sleeping under a Venomica wool blanket.

name: Gargantula Teeth
description: This fang was extracted by force from a Gargantula's mouth. Anaesthetic was unnecessary: the monster had so many teeth, it didn't even notice one missing.

name: Greaseball Bomb
description: Apprentice Greaseballs learn to juggle next to campfires. Survivors are automatically chosen to join the ranks of the clan.

name: Bewitched Wicker
description: This piece of Bewitched Wicker will enable you to make a beautiful basket for magic fruits, combining elegance and power… quite the opposite of a bad Liche.

name: Purple Mégabwork Leather
description: Bwork handicraft remains very mysterious. Some adventurers think the purplish colour comes from Goblins. But the origins of the leather are still unknown. Very strange.

name: Mabwork Ear
description: Mabworks need first-class material to make their implants. At first glance, this ear seems to have been ripped off a piglet's head without its permission.

name: Tattered Bwork Boot
description: A boot like this is almost useless. Once it has been correctly patched up by a skilled shoemaker it'll do something, but for now its smell can help you repel the advances of your eager fans.

name: Dalbweel Skin
description: Actually getting a complete piece of Dalbweel Skin is almost a miracle. Most of the time, Poachers only collect a few scales. Ideal to make bags, this old skin will also be appreciated by tailors who make fighting-underwear.

name: Pignolia Leather
description: How do you tell the difference between a Pignolia Leather and a common Piglet Leather? Just read the label – that's what it's there for, dummy.

name: Pignolia Milk
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Dark Treechnee Bark
description: This fire-proof bark would make useful construction material for adventurers who like to play with fire.

name: Daddy Longlex Mouthparts
description: Daddy Longlex is rumoured to have razor-sharp wit. These appendages would tend to support the theory.

name: Woolly Bow Meow Sternum
description: No one knows for certain what exactly this sternum is used for. Stuffing Woolly Bow Meows, perhaps?

name: Redolph Pattern
description: This pattern can be used by craftsmen to make part of the Redolph Set.

name: Summo Rune
description: This rune will make it easier for shamans to summon.

name: Woolly Bow Meow Hair
description: While they were still alive, the Mayor of Frigost's political opponents would tell anyone who would listen that she wore Woolly Bow Meow Hair lingerie.

name: Redolph's Red Nose
description: This blocked up nose is leaking a sticky substance that stinks of alcohol. Only the most reckless Pandawas would put it in their mouths.

name: Cri Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much more surprising.

name: Dagob
description: When well the battle goes, happen the worst does not.

name: Cri Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more surprising.

name: Coco Koalak Hair
description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

name: Pippin Koalak Hair
description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

name: Indigo Koalak Hair
description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

name: Morello Cherry Koalak Hair
description: This hair is covered with Blop pollen, which gives it a delectable taste, but a foul smell.

name: Fisheralak Bone
description: This bone is quite spongy and enables the Fisheralak to float if it falls in while pulling up a big catch.

name: Piralak Skin
description: This scar-covered skin is more resistant than a rock but remains extremely supple. It's perfect for making whips and tasteless sandals.

name: Koalak Forester Hair
description: This hair is covered in Kaliptus sap, giving it a shiny glint. Unfortunately, it cannot be used for haute couture as it smells like rotting Dragoturkey.

name: Arachnotron Broken Mask
description: This Arachnotron wore a mask to conceal his identity from other Arachnees. It wasn't just him you crushed, but also his dreams of one day becoming a famous superhero.

name: Squashed Arachnee
description: This Arachnee got in a pickle and was spat out in this mangled state. Be careful what you eat.

name: Major Dynamo
description: Better hope you can hit a moving target…

name: Manganese
description: Contrary to general opinion, this metal is not used to make gutters but terrifying weapons such as the "Manganesian Sharp"... This implement has bumped off more than a few Tofus at the Bulgur Festivals.

name: Maple Wood
description: Maple leaves are well-known for having inspired people of limited imagination to create a flag, and the syrup adds taste to pancakes. As for Maple Wood, we still don't know what to do with it.

name: Hurricane Potion
description: This howling potion contains strong air magic, and can be used to powerfully enchant all sorts of items.

name: Storm Flax
description: This Flax went through the most terrible storms and rose up again more than seven times. Pretty extraordinary for flax, you must admit. After getting wet every day for more than 148 years by the magic dew of the Great Pahti fields, its fibre might be useful for something.

name: Morello Cherry Key Fragment
description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

name: Coco Key Fragment
description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

name: Indigo Key Fragment
description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

name: Black Wo Wabbit Stomach
description: You might find it hard to believe, but this stomach is filled with Cawwots and Cawwots alone. Looks like even people who gorge themselves on veggies can become fatty bum-bums.

name: Wabbit Bolt
description: The soldiers in the Wa Wabbit's personal guard carry bolts like this for good luck. It helps them keep their feet on the ground.

name: Wa Wobot Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Scordion Tail
description: The residents of Ohwymi have got into the habit of putting Scordion Tails in their liquor bottles, to scare tourists. Fortunately, after a few hours spent with said liquor, the venom contained within this tail is eliminated completely.

name: Fennex Tail
description: The hairs of this tail are often used to craft the best paintbrushes. To the point of transforming any child's scribblings into a masterpiece… at least in their parents' eyes.

name: Mastodon Cemetery Key
description: This key has more of a symbolic value, attesting to your motivation to want to enter the Mastodon Cemetery, rather than any real use.

name: Cri Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more surprising.

name: Spe Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more popular.

name: Bakelelite
description: Bakelelite is not a solid alloy but correctly sharpened, it becomes as sharp as a Chafer's blade.

name: Gutted Open-Market Shark
description: The Gutted Open-Market Shark can now be used as an ingredient.

name: Agathe Stone
description: This stone has been named after a Pandala river in which great quantities of it used to be found. But times have changed and the intensive exploitation of the past now means it is difficult to find.

name: Pippin Key Fragment
description: If you find the other pieces of this key, you'll have to go and fight the Rainbow Blop. If you don't want to look for the other pieces anymore after hearing that, I understand.

name: Wa Wobot Beard
description: This beard is just what you needed to finish off your Kwismas outfit! This year, the kids are in for a scare!

name: Wobot Wosungwee Fur
description: Wobot Wosungwees have much softer fur than their Wabbity counterparts. The Tiwabbit Wosungwee may do more exercise, but the Wobot is on a permanent Cawwot Juice diet, and it pays off.

name: Venerable Treechnid Root
description: This root helps to keep the Venerable Treechnid sturdy and strong in the worst of storms. But if you can't find a use for it, you can always drop it and if anyone asks, just tell them you're putting down roots.

name: Blood-Soaked Meat
description: If you've got no more paint, you could always use this meat to colour your walls.

name: Mantiscore Heart
description: This heart is imbued with spice, which makes it a particularly spicy and refined dish. It is sought after by the greatest chefs in the world who use it to justify the astronomical price of their dishes.

name: Ekar Habib's Map
description: This map will take you to Ekar Habib's treasure.

name: Cri Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one a bit more surprising.

name: Freyesque Orchid
description: This flower is as rare as it is beautiful. It's not surprising when you know that the rampant toads of the region use them to feed their offspring.

name: Earthquake Potion
description: This bone-shaking potion contains strong earth magic, and can be used to powerfully enchant all sorts of items.

name: Hea Rune
description: This rune will improve your ability to heal others.

name: Wobot Helmet
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Ecaflip's Ball
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Pythag Orchid
description: The alchemist-butcher Pythagore is the first to have turned to this planty infusion for inspiration, which he was sorely lacking.

name: Leopena Eye
description: Even once it's removed from its owner, this eye seems to follow you around as if it could bite you. Don't let it hang around in your pockets; you never know...

name: Spe Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one a bit more popular.

name: Flax
description: There's nothing special about the Flax stem except that it is able to return to its original shape after bending up seven times. And so its fibre is equally flexible.

name: Tsunami Potion
description: This flooding potion contains strong water magic, and can be used to powerfully enchant all sorts of items.

name: Tupe-Halett Pike
description: This new species - resulting from the cross-breeding of several types of pike by the scientists Halett and Tupe - is supposed to have magical properties. Created only for experimentation, two specimens escaped during a violent argument between the two experts.

name: Fascine Substrate
description: Rather than filling in gaps in scientific Knowledge, this potion serves to fill in the gap between apprentice and disciple.

name: Cri Rune
description: This rune will make your attacks even more surprising.

name: Dark Bamboo Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Wa Wabbit's Warren Key
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Whitepaw Wabbit Staff
description: To your great disappointment, this staff isn't magic. The Whitepaw Wabbit you stole it from just used it to walk without limping. Although you have to admit that it made him look a darn sight more impressive when he started gesticulating wildly to cast a spell. Come to think about it, you kinda miss the old guy.

name: Venerable Treechnid Bark
description: This thick bark protects the Venerable Treechnid from vicious swings of the axe. But if you can't find a use for it, you can simply return it, just make sure you don't put the bark up the wrong tree.

name: Blood-Soaked Carrion
description: If you squeeze this meat, you’ll get enough blood out of it for several transfusions.

name: Ourobubble Scales
description: These scales are perfect for crafting armour that is both light and resistant. As a result, they can also be used to make combat swimsuits, so you can fight while topping up your tan.

name: Mantiscore Carapace
description: Once used to craft armour, it now serves as a projectile in sand yacht races.

name: Mantiscore Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Wildfire Potion
description: This fulminating potion contains strong fire magic, and can be used to powerfully enchant all sorts of items.

name: Pike
description: This pike is a freshwater fish of average size. It's a barbecue's best friend.

name: Gutted Sickle-Hammerhead Shark
description: This Sickle-Hammerhead Shark can now be used as an ingredient.

name: Hornbeam Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Daggero Hair
description: This hair was plucked from Daggero during an intense battle. Luckily for him, Pandawa hair grows back fast.

name: Daggero's Nappy
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Tiwobot Goggles
description: The Tiwobot can't see much through these goggles, which is why it's so fearless. If you could see the faces you pull in battle, you'd prefer to fight blind too.

name: Ironing Board
description: Don't worry: it's not just for women.

name: Maple Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Aroumb
description: A healed enemy can be KO'd several times over.

name: Fine Sand
description: Although some people walk on it all day, this sand can be used for many things. Building castles, for example.

name: Spykbal Ball
description: These balls are mainly used in the famous game of the Spykbowls. The rules are simple: you have some balls covered with spikes, and must throw them at your opponents.

name: Kitsou Nufeu Skin
description: This top quality skin can be cut into thin strips to make a really efficient whip. The ideal gift for parents of boisterous and insolent kids.

name: Dark Treechnid Root
description: This root comes from the corpse of a Dark Treechnid.

name: Liroye Merline's Bark
description:
This fragment of bark comes from a tree in the enchanted clearing of Liroye Merline.
This fragment fell down when Brouce Boulgoure the lumberjack broke his Boulgourde against one of the enchanted trees.

name: Dark Treechnid Amber
description: This magnificent amber contains a nasty bug, which was caught in the dripping sap of its master. It's a kind of sarcophagus, really, and the Dark Treechnid uses it as a reminder of all its summons long after they are dead.

name: Brown Warko Boomerang
description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

name: Kitsou Nere Skin
description: This top quality skin can be cut into thin strips to make a really efficient whip. The ideal gift for parents of boisterous and insolent children.

name: Pikmi
description: You can't make an omelette without breaking a few eggs.

name: Novice Puddle
description: Thanks to its rich vitamin and salt mineral content, this water can make you a small fortune when sold in large enough quantities.

name: Sauroshell Eye
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Resistant String
description: If the shoemakers and tailors had known of the existence of the Resistant String, they would have certainly invented a Week of the Resistant String, a Fair of the Resistant String and a Holy Day of the Resistant String.

name: Water Res Per Rune
description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Water damage.

name: Novice Powder
description: This powder is the perfect addition to any apprentice alchemist's briefcase.

name: Novice Smoke
description: Here's the proof you CAN have smoke without fire.

name: AP Res Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that gives one much, much more integrity.

name: AP Red Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more manipulative.

name: Oni Blood
description: This much sought-after flask full of Oni Blood is used by the experienced alchemists to give frightening properties to some weapons.

name: Kitsou Nae Skin
description: This top quality skin can be cut into thin strips to make a really efficient whip. The ideal gift for parents of boisterous and insolent kids.

name: Earth Res Per Rune
description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Earth damage.

name: Neutral Res Per Rune
description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Neutral damage.

name: Horiz
description: When the wiseman points to the horizon, the idiot looks at his finger, and the monster eats the finger. The idiot survives, the wiseman is down a finger, and the monster is hopefully sated.

name: MP Red Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much, much more binding.

name: MP Res Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that lets one move much, much more freely.

name: Novice Mud
description: This thermospasmic mud is a cleaner's nightmare - if it gets on your clothes, the stains are so tough even a Piks machine can't get them out.

name: Novice Ashes
description: These Ashes smell as bad as a pubescent Osamodas taking part in Captain Chafer's Panty Party.

name: MP Res Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that lets one move much, much more freely.

name: Fire Res Per Rune
description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Fire damage.

name: Air Res Per Rune
description: This rune will increase fixed resistance to Air damage.

name: Poacher's Armband
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: AP Red Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much, much more manipulative.

name: AP Res Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that gives one much, much more integrity.

name: MP Red Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more binding.

name: Limestone Dreggon Egg
description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Limestone Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen…

name: Dok Alako Fabric
description: This fabric seems to be imbued with an ancestral magic that is quite unpredictable and uncontrollable. Yet another thing it has common with your beloved.

name: Medicinal Stone
description: According to the legend, the Dok Alakos were so intent on finding the very best Medicinal Stones the world had to offer that they dug and dug and dug, until their mountain was criss-crossed with ravines. Only Enutrofs and baby Koalaks actually believe that tosh, of course.

name: Slate Dreggon Egg
description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Slate Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen…

name: Clay Dreggon Egg
description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Clay Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen…

name: Coal Dreggon Egg
description: A cute little Dreggon will come out of this strange egg if a female Coal Dreggon sits on it. Until then, don't try to keep it warm against you. You never know what could happen…

name: Dok Alako Boomerang
description: This weirdly shaped piece of wood travelled for a long time through the air between enemy ranks before breaking. Rumour has it that it will always fly back to its owner, but rarely into their hands.

name: Major Behelit
description: He who seeks only to dominate their adversaries dies with a collar around his neck.

name: Kitsou Nakwa Skin
description: This top quality skin can be cut into thin strips to make a really efficient whip. The ideal gift for parents of boisterous and insolent kids.

name: Hulhu
description: Fear makes the Gobball run faster than a Tofu.

name: Limestone Dreggon Shell
description: This white shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

name: Shiny Sardine
description: Some fish just don't know when to put it away... Cover up, get off the stage... Catching this bugger couldn't be easier.

name: Ebony Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Mega Legendary Crackler Rock
description: This humongous rock looks like a rock from the Legendary Crackler, but it is not. It's a lot more special than that!

name: Pa Mp Red Rune
description: Normally used to treat heavy legs, this rune's effect has been reversed. Basically, don't expect to run like a Dragoturkey when you use it.

name: Nelween Down
description: You might not have recovered his precious smoke, but at least you managed to pull some of Nelween's hair off. It has no more power than the fabric of a Whitish Fang, but it's ever so shiny, and you know how distracted young adventurers get. I'm sure they'll pay a fair whack for it.

name: Golden Dragoturkey Wing
description: The crafters don't yet know enough about this item for its characteristics to be revealed to potential buyers.

name: Golden Dragoturkey Peak
description: There are tons of reasons for wanting a great big peak: protection against predators, aerodynamic jogging, an excuse not to go into small rooms... And as well as all the important things, there are also old favourites such as picking your nose and drawing in the sand.

name: Alabaster Dreggon Claw
description: Specialists are still hotly debating what to call this item. Since it's found at the tip of an animal's paw, some say that it's a claw. Others claim it's a fingernail. Yet another divisive debate tearing the World of Twelve apart.

name: Clay Dreggon Shell
description: This golden shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

name: Dark Sardine
description: Unlike the Shiny Sardine, the Dark Sardine is extremely difficult to catch.

name: Euphoric Hemp
description: This Hemp stem seems to have extremely powerful effects. Handled by a specialist, it could prove to be very useful.

name: Topaz Stone
description: Batches of this weird-looking stone were once used to feed the young Crackrocks of Pandala breeders. Believe it or not, the stones are now endangered, so this practise has been discontinued.

name: Legendary Crackler Rock
description: It is said that this rock might be the heart of the Legendary Crackler. What we do know is that the Legendary Crackler never had a heavy heart. Therefore, this rock is incredibly light, making it possible to create suitable items for characters who favour mobility, agility and protection. Just perfect!

name: Gourlo's Wrecked Shorts
description: No one ever found an intact pair of Gourlo's shorts - he was a pyromaniac, and frequently burnt his clothes right off his body.

name: Pa Mp Res Rune
description: This rune's powerful magic gives you the urge to run. Great for some good times during your morning jog.

name: Pa Ap Red Rune
description: This rune provokes a kind of deep lethargy. Powdered, it can be used to send your enemies to sleep.

name: Gourlo the Terrible Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Legendary Crackler Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: MP Res Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that lets one move much more freely.

name: AP Res Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that gives one much more integrity.

name: MP Red Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more binding.

name: Draegnerys's Hair
description: This hair is widely used to make items that protect against heat because they are very heat-resistant.

name: Old Dreggon Bone
description: This old bone is magic. Correctly used, it should make very powerful items.

name: Kaniger Eye
description: Kaniger Eyes have become a fashion phenomenon – just look at the number of adventurers who wear them around their necks.

name: Gourlo the Terrible Relic
description: This impressive relic might make you forget all of your worries.

name: Otomai's Ark Key
description: This strange key will enable you to enter Otomai's Ark in one piece.

name: Vood
description: If one of your allies is in line with you, he is already dead, he just doesn't know it yet.

name: Rancid Carrion
description: Even though it’s totally unfit for consumption, there’s numerous ways of recycling this meat to make it commercially viable.

name: MP Res Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that lets one move much more freely.

name: Draegnerys's Cloth
description: It took bravery (or foolishness) to rip off a piece of the Immature Dreggons' guardian's tunic. Many have been burnt alive for less than that.

name: Coal Dreggon Shell
description: This black shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

name: Kaniger Nail
description: You have to be powerful and fast to take a Nail from a Kaniger - powerful to extract it and fast to avoid getting your ears bitten off.

name: Pandulum Skin
description: The colour of this rough skin regularly changes, but no one knows why.

name: Kaliptus Plank
description: A handyman could use this plank to make something delightful - a coffin, for example. Just bear that in mind.

name: Gourlo's Explosive Powder
description: To compensate for the cannon he couldn't transplant as an arm, Gourlo never goes out without his weapon. He can't shoot very quickly since he must wait for the powder to dry each time.

name: Flask of Nelween Smoke
description:
You recovered this volatile smoke from the corpse of Nelween. Try not to breathe it in when you use it in a workshop, it can cause madness and hallucinations.
Now, what did I say? Don't even think about it.

name: AP Red Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much more manipulative.

name: MP Red Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much more binding.

name: Alabaster Dreggon Skin
description: Even now that it's been removed from its owner, don't expose it to the sun for too long or it'll get a sunburn.

name: Slate Dreggon Shell
description: This sapphire shell is nearly unbreakable, but if the best jewellers polish it for generations, they can use its magic properties to make amulets with exceptional powers.

name: Gutted Perch
description: This Perch can now be used as an ingredient.

name: Gutted Kittenperch
description: That Kittenperch can now be used as an ingredient.

name: Bombu Wood
description: This wood is the softest you can find. It is solid, malleable and a joy to carve.

name: Pandulum Hair
description: This magic hair is strong enough to bring a broken clock back to life.

name: Cracklers Rocky Peaks Key
description: This key is almost unbreakable but it is a little worn from opening so many doors. It looks like it's been created from the intimate parts of a Crackler.

name: Key to Draegnerys's Trial
description: This key will open the doors to your first baptism by fire. No, that's not a metaphor; it's literally what might happen to you.

name: Gourlo the Terrible Fabric
description: Used in the past as a blister bandage by Gourlo the Terrible, this fabric is still imbued with a dizzying stench. The funny thing is, one sniff and you'll be overcome with an irresistible hunger.

name: Pa Ap Res Rune
description: You feel much more energetic with this rune in your hand. Use it to avoid any kind of lethargy.

name: Brumen Tinctorias's LaboRATory Key
description: This key, made from the remains of moorland creatures, goes perfectly with your clothes when you wear it around your neck.

name: Nelween Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Bombu Sap
description: Sap has numerous uses, but lumberjacks have always preferred using it to make Yule Logs.

name: Rancid Meat
description: This meat will definitely no longer be spoiled if you just change the use-by date. Ignore the flies buzzing round it.

name: AP Res Ko Pa Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that gives one much more integrity.

name: AP Red Tra Pa Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much more manipulative.

name: Draegnerys Essence
description: This essence contains a part of the immense power of a dungeon keeper: the pick of the litter of monsters in the World of Twelve. Now you just have to find a use befitting such power.

name: Reptilian Shield
description: What purpose could this beautiful, jewel-decorated shield possibly serve? While you search for the answer, you can use it as a tea tray.

name: Crocodyl Chief Skull
description: This huge skull is testimony to the appalling dental hygiene of the Crocodyl Chief. The funny thing is it still seems to contain some magic power since it is still inhabited by the Crocodyl Chief's soul. Sometimes it even sheds Crocodyl tears if you're very nasty to it.

name: Crocodyl Chief Scale
description: This fragment of shell will certainly be used to make beautiful boots.

name: Minor Rocha
description: Whoever's closest is usually wrong. But not by a wrong shot.

name: Crovus Feather
description: Sharpened into quill pens for years, Crobak Feathers are now used to adorn the rich and famous. No wonder Crovuses are nervous creatures – anyone who knows the value of these feathers will go a long way to get their hands on them.

name: Vetauran Hair
description: The Vetauran Hair reflects the sun in a strange way, as if it was absorbing some of the rays.

name: Scurvion Seed
description: These seeds have been prepared with Scurvion venom. The effects of this lethal poison are exponential, according to the dose you take.

name: Scurvion Pincer
description: Once used as a backscratcher (back when a back was a back and a man was a man), it's now used to hang coats. I think that sums up the whole sorry history of the World of Twelve.

name: Kolerat Whiskers
description: Not very resistant, these whiskers will enable you to show off in front of your friends... by imitating Salv and Torh Bali, two great Brakmarian painters, for example.

name: Whitish Fang Fur
description: While the tiny, but beautiful, Midgette Bardot ruled the land, a strict ban was imposed on the hunting of Whitish Fangs. Now she's in exile, and it's hunting season all year round! The tailors are crying out for skins... Make sure you slaughter at least one Whitish Fang - before they disappear forever.

name: Mushroom
description: With or without cream, Mushrooms are very tasty. The easiest way to get some is to kill a Fungi Master.

name: Dragoturkey Teeth
description: This tooth seems to be very sharp. It could become a fearsome weapon in the wrong hands. Fortunately, the Dragoturkey only uses it to chew salad.

name: Scurvion Carapace
description: Ideal for the creation of heavy armour, the Scurvion also has almost unlimited powers of reproduction, which is great news for Brakmar's armed forces.

name: Cracklope Tongue
description: This tongue certainly explored many dark places before you got your hands on it.

name: Reptilian Sword Fragment
description: With this fragment of sword hung above the fireplace, you have a good reason to show off. You have defeated the Crocodyl after all, just like the eccentric Mikool J., also known as Crocodyl Dandy, did before you. No one will know that you got it off a dead Arachnee.

name: Macian Chops
description: Did it cross your mind that these chops could slobber for all eternity? Well, the scary part is they probably can – these animals are well-known for their everlasting gluttony.

name: Vetauran Tin
description: This preserve contains morsels of Vetauran, cubed and canned. Very practical and portable, cubed Vetauran is really man's best friend.

name: Mushd Hand
description: This Mushd Hand, found inside an Arachnee carcass, is covered in mud, or at least that's what people think. But imagine if there was nothing under that mud, not even a Mushd Hand.

name: Ginger Dragoturkey Peak
description: Dragoturkeys use these bony protuberances so little that for years they had even the most eminent biologists scratching their heads, wondering how they all managed to get so worn down. These days, of course, we know full well why: in mating season, Dragoturkeys like nothing more than rubbing up against Trools and having a good scratch.

name: Flax Fibre
description: This is the fibre they use to make the finest of cloth… Being quite rare, this stuff is expensive, but always popular with the weavers.

name: Flint
description: This sharp stone has cut the throat of more than one careless mole.

name: Scurvion Leg
description: It's quite rare to get a Scurvion leg in such good condition. Use it wisely, to pick the locks on doors for example.

name: Ginger Dragoturkey Wing
description: This wing smells like sulphur. Any Dragoturkey breeder will tell you it's the most tender part for a barbecue. Just don't forget to season it because the wing is also the most tasteless part.

name: Crovus Eye
description: A Crovus Eye is always useful… so long as you know how to avoid the evil eye.

name: Broken Macian Collar
description: Like any good Ouginak, their collar gives information. A message is inscribed on this collar: "If lost, please return me to my Brakmarian master on the Sidimote Moors, who will reward you with a punch in the face."

name: Cracklope Eye
description: This Eye glows in the dark even once extracted from its owner's face. It's so bright you can read your favourite comic books all night long.

name: Dead Kolerat
description: You did good picking it up, it's intact. Dead but intact.

name: Foxfyter Fabric
description: This fabric is a perfect and beautiful hair replacement. With this on, no one will fail to notice you!

name: Foxfyter Ear
description: This is an Ouginak's favourite dish: Foxfyter Ears in plain sauce. Traditionally, it should be cooked with a lot of wild mint and some nails for texture.

name: Ginger Dragoturkey Tail
description: The relevance of that tail is quite simple: put it on a round rock and make the tail turn. When it stops, follow the direction indicated by its tip. For centuries, Sadidas lived their whole lives according to this principle.

name: Dragoturkey Beard Hairs
description: This hair is urticant enough to change simple Dragoturkey kisses into weapons of mass destruction. Very urticant indeed.

name: Whitish Fang Fabric
description: You'll be as mischievous as an old Whitish Fang with this rag on your block. If you've always dreamt of wrapping a cloth round your head and walking like a drunken cat, you have no worries. If that is the case, though, I think you have more to worry about than what hat to wear.

name: Crabeye Pincer
description: Crabeyes are hunted by the fishermen of Frigost for two reasons: their permanent bad temper and their tendency to play jokes on the fishermen by snipping their nets with their pincers. The fishermen get their revenge, and play jokes on the crabs by snipping their pincers off.

name: Ap Res Rune
description: You feel more energetic with this rune in your hand. Use it to avoid any kind of lethargy.

name: Do Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much, much less brave.

name: Loc Ko Ra Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one much, much more clingy.

name: AP Res Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that gives one a bit more integrity.

name: AP Red Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one a bit more manipulative.

name: Megacrackler Megastone
description: Thou shalt not cast the first Megastone!

name: Polished Stone Fragment
description: This fragment of polished stone comes from the left buttock of a Cracklerge. For squashing Arachnees, there's nothing finer, except for the Cracklerge itself, perhaps.

name: Whitish Fang Tail
description: God Osamodas can't stand people who hunt wild animals. "They are so cute!" he yells. Well, he has obviously never been torn to pieces by one of these 'cuties'.

name: Dark Wicker
description: This Piece of Wicker is as dark as the darkest ghost, as magic as the most magic ghost, as resistant as the most resistant ghost. Just remember ghosts don't exist.

name: Do Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much less courageous.

name: Scurvion Tail
description: A fantastic trophy. It's a pity it oozes smelly fluid.

name: Whitish Fang Ears
description: When you've seen what kind of filth and bugs Whitish Fangs have in their ears, you have to wonder how they hear anything at all.

name: Ap Red Rune
description: This rune provokes a kind of lethargy. Powdered, it can be used to send your enemies to sleep.

name: AP Res Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that gives one a bit more integrity.

name: MP Res Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that lets one move more freely.

name: AP Red Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more manipulative.

name: Coal
description: Coal has no particular magical properties, despite what you might think. However, it does attract lightning, stores it and, worst of all, always frees it at the worst possible time.

name: Whitish Fang Paw
description: Whitish Fang Paws are highly prized by Amakna's gourmet chefs. They share their magical properties with whoever puts them on. If you put them on, however, you'll quickly find that luck is not as random as you.

name: Crabeye Eye
description: The eye contains a vitreous fluid that is used in traditional Frigostian recipes to replace vinegar – but only if you let the eye ferment for long enough.

name: Oaf
description: Keep your distance.

name: MP Red Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that makes one a bit more binding.

name: Loc Tra Ra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one much, much more clingy.

name: MP Red Tra Rune
description: An eternal dream rune that makes one a bit more binding.

name: Pointed Stone Fragment
description: This fragment of pointed stone comes from the right shoulder blade of a Plain Crackler. Or maybe it's a part of the lower abdomen. Anyway, just be careful where you put it.

name: Scurvion Entrails
description: At first sight, these entrails don't look very appetising. Fair enough. Scurvion entrails are actually revolting, even when cooked with loving care.

name: Mp Res Rune
description: This rune's magic gives you the urge to run. Great for some good times during your morning jog.

name: Mp Red Rune
description: Normally used to treat heavy legs, this rune's effect has been reversed. Basically, don't expect to run like a Tofu when you use it.

name: Spectral Flame
description: Raval was the one who lit the burning flame you can see in the eyes of the ghosts of those who fell during the Crimson Dawn. Nobody knows when this flame will go out. Don't count on it to keep you warm on those long, cold, lonely nights, because though it may feed on bodies, hearts and souls, it's as cold as a YeCh'Ti burp.

name: MP Res Ko Rune
description: An unending nightmare rune that lets one move more freely.

name: Barbrossa's Shirt
description: Do you need an insect repellent? Just put Barbrossa's Shirt on! One side effect is that people will vomit automatically if they come within five feet of you.

name: Barbrossa's Ridiculous Beard
description: This tiny hair tuft will remind you of your holidays thanks to its smell of sand, sunscreen and alcohol. What a pity it stinks so much of gunpowder too!

name: Immature Koalak Skin
description: The little immature Koalak who's skin you tore off didn't want you to treat him that way... but hey, you're stronger and crueller than he is.

name: Sparo's Humerus
description: Even though this bone's called a humerus, it's hard to tell if it actually comes from Sparo's arm. When he died, his skeleton was put in a barrel and smashed up. It sounds painful, even for a bone.

name: Sparo's Scarf
description: This scarf is an essential accessory for both the summer and winter seasons. It will give you an original look, though a bit kitsch. Its flashy colour will certainly excite male Gobballs, but is that really what you want?

name: Payo
description: There'll always be something to unite those who are worlds apart.

name: Grass Snake Skin
description: This skin will slip through your fingers more than any other skin would. Don't make shoes from this skin, you mightn't be able to take them off!

name: Flib's Red Tuft
description: No one knows whether the colour of this tuft is natural or due to some untimely bush fire.

name: Kyoub
description: He who underestimates the resistance factor of projectiles when encountering air resistance probably won't make it through winter.

name: Flib's Stump
description: If I were you I wouldn't pick this thing up - the mouth it came from is about as clean as the devil's crotch. But well, you're the adventurer, you know your business!

name: Crackler Heart
description: Jon Lemon used to do a cover of this stone's song: "You'll neeever break, neeeever break, neeeever break, neeever break… my heart of stone. (Oh no no!)"

name: Dragoturkey Milk
description: Breeders find it pleasant to milk their Dragoturkeys. The only problem is that they can't sell the milk because it's revoltingly disgusting, so they use it to feed young Dragoturkeys… it's a kind of vicious circle.

name: Almond Dragoturkey Tail
description: Strangely enough, the tail of a Dragoturkey has no magic powers, although it quickly grows back, like a Crocodyl's. Legend also has it that a Dragoturkey once grew out of the end of a tail. Don't say I didn't warn you.

name: Almond Dragoturkey Peak
description: Located on the back of the Dragoturkey, this peak can be used to scratch your crotch, provided you can mount a Dragoturkey.

name: Crackler Stone
description: This stone is almost alive, it draws life from the precious stones it contains. Nobody can break it except a Crackler. It'll make a great stone hammer.

name: Crackler's Gold Tooth
description: You've just broken the tooth of a Crackler. What a pity it was his only tooth! A denture could easily have covered the monthly cost of the Zaap.

name: Dragoturkey Wing
description: The domestic Dragoturkey tastes much better than its wild cousin. It has no sulphurous aftertaste, and the meat is delightfully moreish. That's why it's every child's favourite meal.

name: Minor Zaihn
description: The eye of the cyclone is less dangerous than the cyclops' club.

name: Royal Bluish Jelly
description: This delicious jelly is the result of the digestion and fermentation of honey by a Royal Jelly. Inedible in its raw state, it's nevertheless an ingredient of choice for sweets.

name: Wild Mint
description: This is the staple food of Green Jelly, so if you smell mint, don't get the teacups out right away…

name: Small Sandy Carp
description: This small carp is sand-coloured, a distinctive feature which in theory should make it invisible to predators. What a pity there's not a single grain of sand in the lakes of Amakna.

name: Timber Substrate
description: Some Iops tried eating some, thinking it would make them more clever. What would make them think that, only a Iop knows.

name: Wa Wabbit Fabric
description: No one really knows where the Wa Wabbit got this fabric and no one seems interested in knowing either. Disturbing and disquieting, the origin of the fabric remains one of the greatest mysteries of all Amakna.

name: Royal Blop Leaf
description: When dried, rolled and smoked, this leaf can evoke hallucinations in the weakest adventurers, as well as an implacable urge for... relief. An overdose can lead to speedy death.

name: Kanniballs
description: They probably won't miss 'em…
